translated: having worshipped Me with sacrifices, seek heaven.🔽Having attained that meritorious world of the lord of gods,

analyzed: aśnanti divyān divi deva bhogān
translated: they enjoy divine pleasures in heaven.

analyzed: te tam bhuktvā svarga lokam viśālam
translated: Having enjoyed that vast heavenly world,

analyzed: kṣīṇe puṇye martya lokam viśanti
translated: when their merit is exhausted, they enter the mortal world.

analyzed: evam trayī dharmam anuprapannā
translated: Thus, those who follow the religion of the three Vedas,

analyzed: gata āgatam kāma kāmāḥ labhante
translated: desiring sensual pleasures, attain going and coming.

original: ananyāś cintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ paryupāsate
analyzed: an anyāḥ cintayantaḥ mām ye janāḥ paryupāsate
translated: Those people who, not being attached to anything else, worship Me,

analyzed: teṣām nitya abhiyuktānām yogakṣemam vahāmi aham
translated: I carry the eternal burden of those who are always devoted to Me.

analyzed: ye pi anya devatāḥ bhaktāḥ yajante śraddhayā anvitāḥ
translated: Even those who are devotees of other gods, who worship with faith,

original: te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhipūrvakam
analyzed: te pi mām eva kaunteya yajanti avidhi pūrvakam
translated: they also, O son of Kunti, worship Me alone, though not according to the rules.

original: ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca
analyzed: aham hi sarva yajñānām bhoktā ca prabhuḥ eva ca
translated: For I am the enjoyer and the lord of all sacrifices.

original: na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te
analyzed: na tu mām abhijānanti tattvena atas cyavanti te
translated: But they do not know Me in truth, and therefore they fall away.

original: yānti devavratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛvratāḥ
analyzed: yānti deva vratāḥ devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ vratāḥ
translated: Those who are devoted to the gods go to the gods, those who are devoted to the ancestors go to the ancestors.

original: bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti madyājino 'pi mām
analyzed: bhūtāni yānti bhūta ijyāḥ yānti mad yājinaḥ u mām
translated: Those who worship the elements go to the elements, and even those who worship Me go to Me.

original: patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati
analyzed: patram puṣpam phalam toyam yaḥ me bhaktyā prayacchati
translated: He who offers to Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water,

analyzed: tat aham bhakti upahṛtam aśnāmi prayata ātmanaḥ
translated: I accept that which is offered to Me with devotion by one whose mind is controlled.

original: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat
analyzed: yat karoṣi yat aśnāsi yat juhoṣi dadāsi yat
translated: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer as oblation, whatever you give,

original: yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva madarpaṇam
analyzed: yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad arpaṇam
translated: whatever austerity you perform, O son of Kunti, do that as an offering to Me.

analyzed: śubha aśubha phalaiḥ evam mokṣyase karma bandhanaiḥ
translated: Thus you will be freed from the bondage of fruitive work, which has good and bad results.

analyzed: saṃnyāsa yoga yukta ātmā vimuktaḥ mām upaiṣyasi
translated: With your mind fixed in renunciation and yoga, being liberated, you will come to Me.

original: samo 'haṃ sarvabhūteṣu na me dveṣyo 'sti na priyaḥ
analyzed: samaḥ ham sarva bhūteṣu na me dveṣyaḥ sti na priyaḥ
translated: I am the same to all beings. I have no one whom I dislike or love.

original: ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy aham
analyzed: ye bhajanti tu mām bhaktyā mayi te teṣu ca api aham
translated: But those who worship Me with devotion, they are in Me and I am in them.

original: api cet sudurācāro bhajate mām ananyabhāk
analyzed: api ced su durācāraḥ bhajate mām an anya bhāj
translated: Even if a person of very bad conduct worships Me with single-minded devotion,

original: sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ
analyzed: sādhuḥ eva sa mantavyaḥ samyak vyavasitaḥ hi saḥ
translated: he should be considered righteous, for he has resolved rightly.

analyzed: kṣipram bhavati dharma ātmā śaśvat śāntim nigacchati
translated: He quickly becomes righteous-minded and attains eternal peace.

original: kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
analyzed: kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
translated: O son of Kunti, know that My devotee is never lost.

original: māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpayonayaḥ
analyzed: mām hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye pi syuḥ pāpa yonayaḥ
translated: Even those who are of bad birth, O son of Prtha,

original: striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṃ gatim
analyzed: striyaḥ vaiśyāḥ tathā śūdrāḥ te yānti parām gatim
translated: women, Vaishyas and Shudras, who take refuge in Me, attain the highest state.

original: kiṃ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā
analyzed: kim punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyāḥ bhaktāḥ rājarṣayaḥ tathā
translated: What to speak of Brahmanas, who are meritorious, and royal sages, who are devotees?

original: anityam asukhaṃ lokam imaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām
analyzed: anityam asukham lokam imam prāpya bhajasva mām
translated: Having attained this world which is impermanent and unhappy, worship Me.

original: manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ namaskuru
analyzed: mad manāḥ bhava mad bhaktaḥ mad yājī mām namaskuru
translated: Be intent on Me, be devoted to Me, be a worshipper of Me, bow down to Me.

analyzed: mām eva eṣyasi yuktvā evam ātmānam mad parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Thus uniting your self with Me, and having Me as your highest goal, you will attain Me alone.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: bhūya eva mahābāho śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: bhūyas eva mahā bāho śṛṇu me paramam vacaḥ
translated: Listen again, O mighty-armed one, to My supreme words,

analyzed: yat te ham prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hita kāmyayā
translated: which I shall tell you out of a desire for your welfare, to one who is pleased with Me.

original: na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṃ na maharṣayaḥ
analyzed: na me viduḥ sura gaṇāḥ prabhavam na mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The hosts of gods and the great sages do not know My origin,

original: aham ādir hi devānāṃ maharṣīṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: aham ādiḥ hi devānām mahā ṛṣīṇām ca sarvaśas
translated: for I am the beginning of all the gods and the great sages.

original: yo mām ajam anādiṃ ca vetti lokamaheśvaram
analyzed: yaḥ mām ajam anādim ca vetti loka mahā īśvaram
translated: He who knows Me as unborn and beginningless, as the Lord of the world,

analyzed: asaṃmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: is not deluded among mortals and is freed from all sins.

original: buddhir jñānam asaṃmohaḥ kṣamā satyaṃ damaḥ śamaḥ
analyzed: buddhiḥ jñānam asaṃmohaḥ kṣamā satyam damaḥ śamaḥ
translated: Intellect, knowledge, absence of delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-control, tranquility,

original: sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṃ cābhayam eva ca
analyzed: sukham duḥkham bhavaḥ bhāvaḥ bhayam ca abhayam eva ca
translated: happiness, sorrow, existence, non-existence, fear, and fearlessness,

original: ahiṃsā samatā tuṣṭis tapo dānaṃ yaśo 'yaśaḥ
analyzed: ahiṃsā sama tā tuṣṭiḥ tapaḥ dānam yaśaḥ yaśaḥ
translated: non-violence, equality, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and lack of fame,

original: bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṃ matta eva pṛthagvidhāḥ
analyzed: bhavanti bhāvāḥ bhūtānām mattaḥ eva pṛthagvidhāḥ
translated: these various states of beings come from Me alone.

original: maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavas tathā
analyzed: mahā ṛṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāraḥ manavaḥ tathā
translated: The seven ancient great sages, the four Manus,

original: madbhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṃ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: mad bhāvāḥ mānasāḥ jātāḥ yeṣām loke imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: These people in the world are born with minds full of devotion to Me.

original: etāṃ vibhūtiṃ yogaṃ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ
analyzed: etām vibhūtim yogam ca mama yaḥ vetti tattvataḥ
translated: He who knows this manifestation and this yoga of Mine in truth

analyzed: saḥ vikampena yogena yujyate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: becomes united with yoga that is unshakable. There is no doubt about this.

original: ahaṃ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṃ pravartate
analyzed: aham sarvasya prabhavaḥ mattaḥ sarvam pravartate
translated: I am the origin of all. From Me everything proceeds.

original: iti matvā bhajante māṃ budhā bhāvasamanvitāḥ
analyzed: iti matvā bhajante mām budhāḥ bhāva samanvitāḥ
translated: Thinking thus, the wise worship Me with devotion.

original: maccittā madgataprāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam🔽kathayantaś ca māṃ nityaṃ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
analyzed: mad cittāḥ mad gata prāṇāḥ bodhayantaḥ parasparam  kathayantaḥ ca mām nityam tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
translated: With their minds on Me, their lives dedicated to Me, instructing one another,🔽and always talking about Me, they are satisfied and delighted.

analyzed: teṣām satata yuktānām bhajatām prīti pūrvakam
translated: To them who are always devoted, who worship with love,

original: dadāmi buddhiyogaṃ taṃ yena mām upayānti te🔽teṣām evānukampārtham aham ajñānajaṃ tamaḥ
analyzed: dadāmi buddhi yogam tam yena mām upayānti te  teṣām eva anukampā artham aham ajñāna jam tamaḥ
translated: I give that yoga of knowledge by which they attain Me.🔽For their sake alone, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge

analyzed: nāśayāmi ātma bhāva sthaḥ jñāna dīpena bhāsvatā
translated: the darkness born of ignorance.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: paraṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma pavitraṃ paramaṃ bhavān🔽puruṣaṃ śāśvataṃ divyam ādidevam ajaṃ vibhum🔽āhus tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣir nāradas tathā
analyzed: param brahma param dhāma pavitram paramam bhavān  puruṣam śāśvatam divyam ādidevam ajam vibhum  āhuḥ tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve deva ṛṣiḥ nāradaḥ tathā
translated: You are the supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, the pure, the supreme.🔽The sages all call You the eternal, divine, primordial god, the unborn, the all-pervading.

original: asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṃ caiva bravīṣi me
analyzed: asitaḥ devalaḥ vyāsaḥ svayam ca eva bravīṣi me
translated: The celestial sage Nārada, Asita, Devala, and Vyāsa, and You Yourself tell me

original: sarvam etad ṛtaṃ manye yan māṃ vadasi keśava
analyzed: sarvam etat ṛtam manye yat mām vadasi keśava
translated: I consider all this to be true, O Keshava, what you tell me.

original: na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṃ vidur devā na dānavāḥ
analyzed: na hi te bhagavan vyaktim viduḥ devāḥ na dānavāḥ
translated: O Lord, neither the gods nor the demons know your manifestation.

analyzed: svayam eva ātmanā ātmānam vettha tvam puruṣottama
translated: You alone, by yourself, know your own Self, O Supreme Person.

analyzed: bhūtabhāvana bhūteśa devadeva jagatpate
translated: O creator of beings, O Lord of beings, O god of gods, O Lord of the universe,

original: vaktum arhasy aśeṣeṇa divyā hy ātmavibhūtayaḥ
analyzed: vaktum arhasi aśeṣeṇa divyāḥ hi ātma vibhūtayaḥ
translated: you should describe in full the divine manifestations of your own Self.

original: yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṃs tvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi
analyzed: yābhiḥ vibhūtibhiḥ lokān imān tvam vyāpya tiṣṭhasi
translated: By which manifestations you pervade and abide in these worlds.

original: kathaṃ vidyām ahaṃ yogiṃs tvāṃ sadā paricintayan
analyzed: katham vidyām aham yogin tvām sadā paricintayan
translated: How should I know you, O yogi, always contemplating you?

original: keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo 'si bhagavan mayā
analyzed: keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyaḥ si bhagavat mayā
translated: In which states should I think of you, O Lord?

analyzed: vistareṇa ātmanaḥ yogam vibhūtim ca janārdana
translated: In detail, O Janardana, your yoga and manifestations.

original: bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptir hi śṛṇvato nāsti me 'mṛtam
analyzed: bhūyas kathaya tṛptiḥ hi śṛṇvataḥ nā asti me mṛtam
translated: Again, tell me, for I am not satisfied hearing your nectar-like words.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hy ātmavibhūtayaḥ
analyzed: hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyāḥ hi ātma vibhūtayaḥ
translated: I will tell you about my divine manifestations,

original: prādhānyataḥ kuruśreṣṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me🔽aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarvabhūtāśayasthitaḥ
analyzed: prādhānyataḥ kuruśreṣṭha na asti antaḥ vistarasya me  aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarva bhūta āśaya sthitaḥ
translated: but only in brief, O best of the Kurus, for there is no end to my details.🔽I am the Self, O Gudakesha, dwelling in the hearts of all beings.

original: aham ādiś ca madhyaṃ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca
analyzed: aham ādiḥ ca madhyam ca bhūtānām antaḥ eva ca
translated: I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.

original: ādityānām ahaṃ viṣṇur jyotiṣāṃ ravir aṃśumān
analyzed: ādityānām aham viṣṇuḥ jyotiṣām raviḥ aṃśumān
translated: I am Vishnu among the Adityas, the sun among the luminaries, the rays.

original: marīcir marutām asmi nakṣatrāṇām ahaṃ śaśī
analyzed: marīciḥ marutām asmi nakṣatrāṇām aham śaśī
translated: I am Marichi among the Maruts, the moon among the stars.

analyzed: vedānām sāmavedaḥ smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ
translated: I am the Sama Veda among the Vedas, Vasava among the gods.

original: indriyāṇāṃ manaś cāsmi bhūtānām asmi cetanā🔽rudrāṇāṃ śaṃkaraś cāsmi vitteśo yakṣarakṣasām
analyzed: indriyāṇām manaḥ ca asmi bhūtānām asmi cetanā  rudrāṇām śaṃkaraḥ ca asmi vitteśaḥ yakṣa rakṣasām
translated: I am the mind among the senses, the consciousness among beings.🔽I am Shankara among the Rudras, the lord of wealth among the Yakshas and Rakshasas.

original: vasūnāṃ pāvakaś cāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham
analyzed: vasūnām pāvakaḥ ca asmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham
translated: I am the fire among the Vasus, Mount Meru among the peaks.

original: purodhasāṃ ca mukhyaṃ māṃ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim
analyzed: purodhasām ca mukhyam mām viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim
translated: Know me, O son of Pritha, as the chief priest among the priests, Brihaspati.

original: senānīnām ahaṃ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
analyzed: senā nīnām aham skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
translated: I am Skanda among the generals, the ocean among the reservoirs of water.

original: maharṣīṇāṃ bhṛgur ahaṃ girām asmy ekam akṣaram
analyzed: mahā ṛṣīṇām bhṛguḥ aham girām asmi ekam akṣaram
translated: I am Bhrigu among the great sages, the syllable Om among the words.

analyzed: yajñānām japa yajñaḥ smi sthāvarāṇām himālayaḥ
translated: I am the sacrifice of meditation among the sacrifices, the Himalayas among the mountains.

analyzed: aśvatthaḥ sarva vṛkṣāṇām deva ṛṣīṇām ca nāradaḥ
translated: I am the Ashvattha among all trees, Narada among the celestial sages.

analyzed: gandharvāṇām citrarathaḥ siddhānām kapilaḥ muniḥ
translated: I am Chitraratha among the Gandharvas, the sage Kapila among the Siddhas.

analyzed: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānām viddhi mām amṛta udbhavam
translated: Know me, O Arjuna, as the horse Ucchaihshrava born from the nectar.

analyzed: airāvatam gaja indrāṇām narāṇām ca narādhipam
translated: I am Airavata among the lords of elephants, the king among men.

original: āyudhānām ahaṃ vajraṃ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
analyzed: āyudhānām aham vajram dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
translated: I am the thunderbolt among weapons, the wish-fulfilling cow among the cows.

original: prajanaś cāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
analyzed: prajanaḥ ca asmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
translated: I am the procreator among the gods, and I am Kama among the Gandharvas. I am Vasuki among the serpents.

original: anantaś cāsmi nāgānāṃ varuṇo yādasām aham
analyzed: anantaḥ ca asmi nāgānām varuṇaḥ yādasām aham
translated: I am Ananta among the Nagas, and I am Varuna among the waters.

original: pitṝṇām aryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṃyamatām aham
analyzed: pitṝṇām aryamā ca asmi yamaḥ saṃyamatām aham
translated: I am Aryaman among the manes, and I am Yama among the controllers.

original: prahlādaś cāsmi daityānāṃ kālaḥ kalayatām aham
analyzed: prahlādaḥ ca asmi daityānām kālaḥ kalayatām aham
translated: I am Prahlada among the Daityas, and I am Kala among the measurers.

original: mṛgāṇāṃ ca mṛgendro 'haṃ vainateyaś ca pakṣiṇām
analyzed: mṛgāṇām ca mṛgendraḥ ham vainateyaḥ ca pakṣiṇām
translated: I am the lion among the beasts, and I am Garuda among the birds.

original: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastrabhṛtām aham🔽jhaṣāṇāṃ makaraś cāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
analyzed: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastrabhṛtām aham  jhaṣāṇām makaraḥ ca asmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
translated: I am the wind among the winds, and I am Rama among the wielders of weapons.🔽I am the Makara among the fishes, and I am the Ganges among the streams.

original: sargāṇām ādir antaś ca madhyaṃ caivāham arjuna
analyzed: sargāṇām ādiḥ antaḥ ca madhyam ca eva aham arjuna
translated: I am the beginning, the middle and the end of beings, O Arjuna.

analyzed: adhyātma vidyā vidyānām vādaḥ pravadatām aham
translated: I am the knowledge of the self among the sciences, and I am the debate among the disputations.

analyzed: akṣarāṇām akāraḥ smi dvaṃdvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca
translated: I am the letter A among the syllables, and I am the dvanda among the compounds.

analyzed: aham eva akṣayaḥ kālaḥ dhātā aham viśvatomukhaḥ
translated: I alone am the imperishable time, and I am the creator with face turned to all sides.

original: mṛtyuḥ sarvaharaś cāham udbhavaś ca bhaviṣyatām
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ sarva haraḥ ca aham udbhavaḥ ca bhaviṣyatām
translated: I am death that devours the world, and I am the source of all that is to be.

original: kīrtiḥ śrīr vāk ca nārīṇāṃ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
analyzed: kīrtiḥ śrīḥ vāc ca nārīṇām smṛtiḥ medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
translated: I am the fame, the fortune, the speech, the memory, the intelligence, the patience, and the forgiveness of women.

original: bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnāṃ gāyatrī chandasām aham
analyzed: bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnām gāyatrī chandasām aham
translated: I am the Brihat-Sama among the Samans, and I am the Gayatri among the metres.

analyzed: māsānām mārgaśīrṣaḥ ham ṛtūnām kusumākaraḥ
translated: I am the Margasirsha among the months, and I am the spring among the seasons.

original: oṣadhīnāṃ yavaś cāsmi dhātūnām asmi kāñcanam
analyzed: oṣadhīnām yavaḥ ca asmi dhātūnām asmi kāñcanam
translated: I am the barley of the herbs, and gold of the metals.

original: saurabheyo gavām asmi snehānāṃ sarpir apy aham
analyzed: saurabheyaḥ gavām asmi snehānām sarpiḥ api aham
translated: I am the fragrance of the fragrant, and the lustre of the lustrous.

original: sarvāsāṃ tṛṇajātīnāṃ darbho 'haṃ pāṇḍunandana🔽dyūtaṃ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
analyzed: sarvāsām tṛṇa jātīnām darbhaḥ haṃ pāṇḍu nandana  dyūtam chalayatām asmi tejaḥ tejasvinām aham
translated: I am the sacred grass among all kinds of grass, O son of Pandu.🔽I am the gambling of the deceitful, and the energy of the energetic.

analyzed: jayaḥ smi vyavasāyaḥ smi sattvam sattvavatām aham
translated: I am the victory of the victorious, and the strength of the strong.

analyzed: vṛṣṇīnām vāsudevaḥ smi pāṇḍavānām dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: I am Vasudeva among the Vrishnis, and Dhananjaya among the Pandavas.

original: munīnām apy ahaṃ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ
analyzed: munīnām api aham vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanāḥ kaviḥ
translated: I am Vyasa among the sages, and the sage Usanas among the poets.

original: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣatām
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ damayatām asmi nītiḥ asmi jigīṣatām
translated: I am the punishment of the chastisers, and the policy of those who desire to conquer.

original: maunaṃ caivāsmi guhyānāṃ jñānaṃ jñānavatām aham
analyzed: maunam ca eva asmi guhyānām jñānam jñānavatām aham
translated: I am the silence of the secret ones, and the knowledge of the wise.

original: yac cāpi sarvabhūtānāṃ bījaṃ tad aham arjuna🔽na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṃ carācaram
analyzed: yat ca api sarva bhūtānām bījam tat aham arjuna  na tat asti vinā yat syāt mayā bhūtam carācaram
translated: And I am the seed of all beings, O Arjuna.🔽There is nothing moving or unmoving that can exist without Me.

analyzed: na antaḥ sti mama divyānām vibhūtīnām paraṃtapa
translated: There is no end, O scorcher of foes, to My divine manifestations.

original: eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
analyzed: eṣa tu uddeśataḥ proktaḥ vibhūteḥ vistaraḥ mayā
translated: This much has been said by Me as an indication of My manifestations.

original: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṃ śrīmad ūrjitam eva vā
analyzed: yat yat vibhūtimat sattvam śrīmat ūrjitam eva vā
translated: Whatever is glorious, prosperous, or powerful,

original: tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṃ mama tejoṃśasaṃbhavam
analyzed: tat tat eva avagaccha tvam mama tejaḥ oṃśa saṃbhavam
translated: know that to have originated from a part of My splendour.

original: atha vā bahunaitena kiṃ jñātena tavārjuna
analyzed: atha vā bahunā etena kim jñātena tava arjuna
translated: Or what need is there, O Arjuna, of knowing this much of Mine?

original: viṣṭabhyāham idaṃ kṛtsnam ekāṃśena sthito jagat
analyzed: viṣṭabhya aham idam kṛtsnam eka aṃśena sthitaḥ jagat
translated: I am supporting this entire world by a single part of Myself.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca  mad anugrahāya paramam guhyam adhyātma saṃjñitam
translated: Arjuna said:🔽For my favor, You have spoken these words which are the highest secret, known as spiritual knowledge.

original: yat tvayoktaṃ vacas tena moho 'yaṃ vigato mama
analyzed: yat tvayā uktam vacaḥ tena mohaḥ yam vigataḥ mama
translated: By that, this delusion of mine has gone away.

original: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṃ śrutau vistaraśo mayā
analyzed: bhava apyayau hi bhūtānām śrutau vistaraśaḥ mayā
translated: I have heard in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings.

analyzed: tvattaḥ kamala patra akṣa māhātmyam api ca avyayam
translated: From You, O lotus-eyed one, I have also heard the imperishable greatness.

original: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṃ parameśvara
analyzed: evam etat yathā āttha tvam ātmānam parameśvara
translated: It is so, O Supreme Lord, as You have said about Yourself.

original: draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṃ puruṣottama
analyzed: draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaram puruṣottama
translated: O Supreme Person, I wish to see Your divine form.

original: manyase yadi tac chakyaṃ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho
analyzed: manyase yadi tat śakyam mayā draṣṭum iti prabho
translated: If You think that it is possible for me to see it, O Lord,

original: yogeśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānam avyayam
analyzed: yogeśvara tatas me tvam darśaya ātmānam avyayam
translated: then, O Lord of Yoga, show me Your imperishable Self.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca🔽paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi sahasraśas

analyzed: yat me tvat anyena na dṛṣṭa pūrvam
translated: Which has never been seen by you before, except by me.

analyzed: na veda yajña adhyayanaiḥ na dānaiḥ
translated: Not by knowledge of the Vedas, not by sacrifices, not by gifts,

original: na ca kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ🔽evaṃrūpaḥ śakya ahaṃ nṛloke /
analyzed: na ca kriyābhiḥ na tapobhiḥ ugraiḥ  evaṃrūpaḥ śakyaḥ aham nṛ loke
translated: Nor by rites, nor by severe austerities,🔽In this world of men, O best of the Kurus, am I able to be seen

analyzed: draṣṭum tvat anyena kuru pravīra
translated: By anyone other than you, in this form.

original: mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍhabhāvo /
analyzed: mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍha bhāvaḥ
translated: Do not be distressed, nor be confused,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā rūpam ghoram īdṛś mama idam
translated: Having seen this terrible form of mine like this.

analyzed: vyapeta bhīḥ prīta manāḥ punar tvam
translated: Be free from fear, with a delighted mind, again.

original: tad eva me rūpam idaṃ prapaśya
analyzed: tat eva me rūpam idam prapaśya
translated: This very form of Mine you behold now,

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca  iti arjunam vāsudevaḥ tathā uktvā
translated: Sanjaya said:🔽Thus having spoken to Arjuna,

analyzed: svakam rūpam darśayām āsa bhūyas
translated: Vasudeva again showed him His own form,

analyzed: āśvāsayām āsa ca bhītam enam
translated: and comforted the frightened one.

analyzed: bhūtvā punar saumya vapuḥ mahātmā
translated: Having again become of a gentle body, the great-souled one,

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava saumyaṃ janārdana
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam mānuṣam rūpam tava saumyam janārdana
translated: Having seen this gentle human form of Yours, O Janardana,

original: idānīm asmi saṃvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ
analyzed: idānīm asmi saṃvṛttaḥ sa cetāḥ prakṛtim gataḥ
translated: now I have become composed and have attained my natural state.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: sudurdarśam idaṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭavān asi yan mama
analyzed: su durdarśam idam rūpam dṛṣṭavān asi yat mama
translated: You have seen this form of Mine, which is difficult to behold,

original: devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṃ darśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: devāḥ api asya rūpasya nityam darśana kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: even the gods always desire to see this form of Mine.

original: nāhaṃ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā
analyzed: na aham vedaiḥ na tapasā na dānena na ca ijyayā
translated: I cannot be seen by means of the Vedas, austerities, charity, or sacrifices,

original: śakya evaṃvidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavān asi māṃ yathā
analyzed: śakyaḥ evaṃvidhaḥ draṣṭum dṛṣṭavān asi mām yathā
translated: in this way as you have seen Me.

original: bhaktyā tv ananyayā śakya aham evaṃvidho 'rjuna
analyzed: bhaktyā tu an anyayā śakyaḥ aham evaṃvidhaḥ rjuna
translated: But by single-minded devotion, O Arjuna,

original: jñātuṃ draṣṭuṃ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṃ ca paraṃtapa
analyzed: jñātum draṣṭum ca tattvena praveṣṭum ca paraṃtapa
translated: I can be known and seen in reality, and entered into, O scorcher of enemies.
The one who performs actions for Me, who is devoted to Me, who is My devotee, who is free from attachment,

original: nirvairaḥ sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
analyzed: nirvairaḥ sarva bhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
translated: who is free from enmity towards all beings, he comes to Me, O son of Pandu.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: evaṃ satatayuktā ye bhaktās tvāṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: evam satata yuktāḥ ye bhaktāḥ tvām paryupāsate
translated: In this way, those who are always devoted and worship You,

original: ye cāpy akṣaram avyaktaṃ teṣāṃ ke yogavittamāḥ
analyzed: ye ca api akṣaram avyaktam teṣām ke yoga vittamāḥ
translated: and those who meditate on the imperishable, unmanifest - who among them are the best knowers of yoga?

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: mayy āveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate
analyzed: mayi āveśya manaḥ ye mām nitya yuktāḥ upāsate
translated: Those who, fixing their minds on Me, worship Me, ever devoted,

original: śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā upetāḥ te me yuktatamāḥ matāḥ
translated: endowed with supreme faith, they are considered by Me to be the most devoted.

original: ye tv akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṃ paryupāsate🔽sarvatragam acintyaṃ ca kūṭastham acalaṃ dhruvam
analyzed: ye tu akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktam paryupāsate  sarvatragam acintyam ca kūṭastham acalam dhruvam
translated: But those who meditate on the imperishable, indescribable, unmanifest,🔽omnipresent, inconceivable, immutable, unshakable, and eternal,

analyzed: saṃniyamya indriya grāmam sarvatra sama buddhayaḥ
translated: restraining the group of senses, with an equal mind everywhere,

original: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ
analyzed: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva bhūta hite ratāḥ
translated: they attain Me alone, engaged in the welfare of all beings.

analyzed: kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ teṣām avyakta āsakta cetasām
translated: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the difficulty is greater.

original: avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṃ dehavadbhir avāpyate
analyzed: avyaktā hi gatiḥ duḥkham dehavadbhiḥ avāpyate
translated: For the attainment of the unmanifest is difficult for those who have bodies.

original: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya matparāḥ
analyzed: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya mad parāḥ
translated: But those who, dedicating all actions to Me, are devoted to Me,

original: ananyenaiva yogena māṃ dhyāyanta upāsate🔽teṣām ahaṃ samuddhartā mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt
analyzed: an anyena eva yogena mām dhyāyantaḥ upāsate  teṣām aham samuddhartā mṛtyu saṃsāra sāgarāt
translated: meditating on Me with single-pointed yoga and worshipping Me,🔽I become their deliverer from the ocean of birth and death, O Partha,

analyzed: bhavāmi nacirāt pārtha mayi āveśita cetasām
translated: in no time, of those who have fixed their minds on Me.

original: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ niveśaya
analyzed: mayi eva manaḥ ādhatsva mayi buddhim niveśaya
translated: Fix your mind on Me alone, place your intellect in Me,

original: nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: nivasiṣyasi mayi eva atas ūrdhvam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: You will certainly dwell in Me alone from then on.

original: atha cittaṃ samādhātuṃ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram
analyzed: atha cittam samādhātum na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram
translated: But if you are unable to fix your mind firmly in Me,

analyzed: abhyāsa yogena tatas mām iccha āptum dhanaṃjaya
translated: then, O Dhananjaya, try to attain Me through the yoga of practice.

analyzed: abhyāse pi si mad karma paramaḥ bhava
translated: If you are unable to practice, then be devoted to My actions.

original: madartham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
analyzed: mad artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
translated: By performing actions for My sake, you will attain perfection.

original: athaitad apy aśakto 'si kartuṃ madyogam āśritaḥ
analyzed: athā etat api aśaktaḥ si kartum mad yogam āśritaḥ
translated: But if you are unable to do even that, taking refuge in My yoga,

analyzed: sarva karma phala tyāgam tatas kuru yata ātmavān
translated: then, with a controlled self, renounce the fruits of all actions.

original: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṃ viśiṣyate
analyzed: śreyaḥ hi jñānam abhyāsāt jñānāt dhyānam viśiṣyate
translated: For knowledge is better than practice; meditation is superior to knowledge.
From meditation comes renunciation of the fruits of action; from renunciation comes peace, immediately.

original: adveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca
analyzed: a dveṣṭā sarva bhūtānām maitraḥ karuṇaḥ eva ca
translated: He who is free from hatred toward all beings, friendly, compassionate,
free from sense of possession, free from egotism, the same in pain and pleasure, tolerant,

analyzed: saṃtuṣṭaḥ satatam yogī yata ātmā dṛḍha niścayaḥ
translated: always content, a yogī, with a controlled self, firm in resolve,

original: mayy arpitamanobuddhir yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: mayi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: whose mind and understanding are fixed on Me, he who is devoted to Me, is dear to Me.

original: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ
analyzed: yasmāt na udvijate lokaḥ lokāt na udvijate ca yaḥ
translated: He from whom the world does not tremble and who does not tremble from the world,

original: harṣāmarṣabhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
analyzed: harṣa amarṣa bhaya udvegaiḥ muktaḥ yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
translated: who is free from joy, anger, fear and anxiety, he too is dear to Me.

analyzed: anapekṣaḥ śuciḥ dakṣaḥ udāsīnaḥ gata vyathaḥ
translated: He who is free from attachment, pure, skillful, indifferent, free from distress,

original: sarvārambhaparityāgī yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: sarva ārambha parityāgī yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: and has renounced all undertakings - he who is devoted to Me is dear to Me.

original: yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati
analyzed: yaḥ na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati
translated: He who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires,

original: śubhāśubhaparityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: śubha aśubha parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: and is free from the notion of good and bad - he who is devoted is dear to Me.

original: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāvamānayoḥ
analyzed: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā māna avamānayoḥ
translated: Equal towards friend and foe, and likewise towards honor and insult,

analyzed: śīta uṣṇa sukha duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga vivarjitaḥ
translated: and towards cold, heat, happiness, and sorrow, free from attachment,

original: tulyanindāstutir maunī saṃtuṣṭo yena kena cit
analyzed: tulya nindā stutiḥ maunī saṃtuṣṭaḥ yena kena cit
translated: equal towards praise and blame, silent, content with anything,

original: aniketaḥ sthiramatir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ
analyzed: aniketaḥ sthira matiḥ bhaktimān me priyaḥ naraḥ
translated: homeless, of steady mind, and devoted - such a man is dear to Me.

original: ye tu dharmyāmṛtam idaṃ yathoktaṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: ye tu dharmya amṛtam idam yathā uktam paryupāsate
translated: But those who serve this nectar of righteousness as it has been taught,

original: śraddadhānā matparamā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ
analyzed: śraddadhānāḥ mad paramāḥ bhaktāḥ te tīva me priyāḥ
translated: with faith, with the highest devotion to Me, they are exceedingly dear to Me.

original: arjuna uvāca🔽prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva kṣetraṃ kṣetrajñam eva ca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca  prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva kṣetram kṣetrajñam eva ca
translated: Arjuna said:🔽I wish to know this: Nature, the individual soul, the field, and the knower of the field,

original: etad veditum icchāmi jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ ca keśava
analyzed: etat veditum icchāmi jñānam jñeyam ca keśava
translated: and also knowledge and the knowable, O Keshava.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva kṣetraṃ kṣetrajñam eva ca
analyzed: prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva kṣetram kṣetrajñam eva ca
translated: Nature, the individual soul, the field, and the knower of the field,

original: etat te kathayiṣyāmi jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: etat te kathayiṣyāmi jñānam jñeyam ca bhārata
translated: this I shall now explain to you, O scion of the Bharata dynasty, as well as knowledge and the knowable.

original: idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetram ity abhidhīyate
analyzed: idam śarīram kaunteya kṣetram iti abhidhīyate
translated: This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field.

original: etad yo vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ
analyzed: etat yaḥ vetti tam prāhuḥ kṣetrajñaḥ iti tad vidaḥ
translated: He who knows this, they call the knower of the field.

original: kṣetrajñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi sarvakṣetreṣu bhārata
analyzed: kṣetrajñam ca api mām viddhi sarva kṣetreṣu bhārata
translated: And know Me, O son of Bharata, to be the knower of the field in all fields.

original: kṣetrakṣetrajñayor jñānaṃ yat taj jñānaṃ mataṃ mama
analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajñayoḥ jñānam yat tat jñānam matam mama
translated: The knowledge of the field and the knower of the field, that is considered by Me to be knowledge.

original: tat kṣetraṃ yac ca yādṛk ca yadvikāri yataś ca yat
analyzed: tat kṣetram yat ca yādṛś ca yat vikāri yatas ca yat
translated: That field which is what and how it is, what its modifications are, and from what it originates,

original: sa ca yo yatprabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu
analyzed: sa ca yaḥ yad prabhāvaḥ ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu
translated: and He who is that and what His power is, listen to that from Me in brief.

original: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṃ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ bahudhā gītam chandobhiḥ vividhaiḥ pṛthak
translated: It has been sung by the sages in many ways, with various meters separately,

analyzed: brahmasūtra padaiḥ ca eva hetumadbhiḥ viniścitaiḥ
translated: and with the words of the Vedanta, which are reasoned and certain.

original: mahābhūtāny ahaṃkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca
analyzed: mahābhūtāni ahaṃkāraḥ buddhiḥ avyaktam eva ca
translated: The great elements, ego, intellect, and the unmanifest itself,

analyzed: indriyāṇi daśa ekam ca pañca ca indriya gocarāḥ
translated: the ten sense organs and one, and the five objects of the senses,

original: icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ
analyzed: icchā dveṣaḥ sukham duḥkham saṃghātaḥ cetanā dhṛtiḥ
translated: desire, aversion, happiness, sorrow, combination, consciousness, and fortitude,

analyzed: etat kṣetram samāsena sa vikāram udāhṛtam
translated: this field has been briefly described, along with its modifications.

analyzed: amāni tvam adambhi tvam ahiṃsā kṣāntiḥ ārjavam
translated: Humility, unpretentiousness, non-injury, forgiveness, sincerity,

analyzed: ācārya upāsanam śaucam sthairyam ātma vinigrahaḥ
translated: service to the teacher, purity, steadiness, self-control,

analyzed: indriya artheṣu vairāgyam anahaṃkāraḥ eva ca
translated: Non-attachment to objects of the senses, and absence of egoism,

analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā vyādhi duḥkha doṣa anudarśanam
translated: Contemplation of the evils of birth, death, old age, disease, and sorrow,

analyzed: asaktiḥ anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putra dāra gṛha ādiṣu
translated: Non-attachment, non-covetousness, towards sons, wives, houses, and so on,

analyzed: nityam ca sama citta tvam iṣṭa aniṣṭa upapattiṣu
translated: And constant equanimity in favorable and unfavorable circumstances,

analyzed: mayi ca an anya yogena bhaktiḥ avyabhicāriṇī
translated: And unwavering devotion to Me alone, without any other recourse,

analyzed: vivikta deśa sevi tvam aratiḥ jana saṃsadi
translated: Dwelling in solitary places, distaste for crowds,
Constancy in the knowledge of the Self, and the vision of the truth of the knowledge of reality,

original: etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṃ yad ato 'nyathā
analyzed: etat jñānam iti proktam ajñānam yat atas nyathā
translated: This is said to be knowledge; anything else is ignorance.

original: jñeyaṃ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛtam aśnute
analyzed: jñeyam yat tat pravakṣyāmi yat jñātvā amṛtam aśnute
translated: I shall now declare that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality.

original: anādimat paraṃ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate
analyzed: anādimat param brahma na sat tat na asat ucyate
translated: The beginningless Supreme Brahman is said to be neither existent nor non-existent.

analyzed: sarvatas pāṇi pādam tat sarvatas akṣi śiraḥ mukham
translated: It has hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and faces everywhere,

analyzed: sarvatas śrutimat loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati
translated: It has ears everywhere in the world, and it stands pervading everything.

analyzed: sarva indriya guṇa ābhāsam sarva indriya vivarjitam
translated: It manifests the qualities of all the senses, yet is devoid of all the senses,

original: asaktaṃ sarvabhṛc caiva nirguṇaṃ guṇabhoktṛ ca
analyzed: asaktam sarva bhṛt ca eva nirguṇam guṇa bhoktṛ ca
translated: It is unattached, yet supports everything, is qualityless, yet the experiencer of the qualities,

original: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṃ caram eva ca
analyzed: bahis antar ca bhūtānām acaram caram eva ca
translated: It is outside and inside of beings, unmoving, yet moving.

original: sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṃ dūrasthaṃ cāntike ca tat
analyzed: sūkṣma tvāt tat avijñeyam dūra stham ca antike ca tat
translated: It is subtle, therefore it is unknowable. It is far away, and yet it is near.

original: avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam
analyzed: avibhaktam ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam
translated: It is undivided, and yet it appears to be divided among beings.

original: bhūtabhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
analyzed: bhūta bhartṛ ca tat jñeyam grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
translated: It should be known as the supporter of beings, as the devourer, and as the powerful one.

original: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param ucyate
analyzed: jyotiṣām api tat jyotiḥ tamasaḥ param ucyate
translated: It is the light of even the luminaries, and is said to be beyond darkness.

original: jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ jñānagamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
analyzed: jñānam jñeyam jñāna gamyam hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
translated: It is knowledge, the knowable, and attainable through knowledge, and is situated in the heart of all.

original: iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ
analyzed: iti kṣetram tathā jñānam jñeyam ca uktam samāsatas
translated: Thus, the field, knowledge, and the knowable have been succinctly described.

analyzed: mad bhaktaḥ etat vijñāya mad bhāvāya upapadyate
translated: My devotee, knowing this, becomes fit for union with Me.

original: prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api
analyzed: prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva viddhi anādī ubhau api
translated: Know both Prakriti and Purusha to be beginningless.

original: vikārāṃś ca guṇāṃś caiva viddhi prakṛtisaṃbhavān
analyzed: vikārān ca guṇān ca eva viddhi prakṛti saṃbhavān
translated: Know the modifications and the qualities to arise from Prakriti.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇa kartṛ tve hetuḥ prakṛtiḥ ucyate
translated: Prakriti is said to be the cause of the agency in action and its results.

analyzed: puruṣaḥ sukha duḥkhānām bhoktṛ tve hetuḥ ucyate
translated: Purusha is said to be the cause of the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi bhuṅkte prakṛtijān guṇān
analyzed: puruṣaḥ prakṛti sthaḥ hi bhuṅkte prakṛti jān guṇān
translated: For the Purusha, indeed, abiding in Prakriti, enjoys the qualities born of Prakriti.

analyzed: kāraṇam sat asat yoni janmasu
translated: Association with the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and bad wombs.

analyzed: upadraṣṭā anumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ
translated: The Supreme Lord is the onlooker, the approver, the supporter, the enjoyer.

original: paramātmeti cāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
analyzed: paramātmā iti ca api uktaḥ dehe smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
translated: The Supreme Self is said to be the supreme Person in this body.

original: ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca guṇaiḥ saha
analyzed: yaḥ evam vetti puruṣam prakṛtim ca guṇaiḥ saha
translated: He who thus knows the Purusha and Prakriti along with the qualities,

analyzed: sarvathā vartamānaḥ pi na sa bhūyas bhijāyate
translated: however he may conduct himself, is not born again.

original: dhyānenātmani paśyanti ke cid ātmānam ātmanā
analyzed: dhyānena ātmani paśyanti ke cid ātmānam ātmanā
translated: Some, by meditation, see the Self in the Self by the Self.

analyzed: anye sāṃkhyena yogena karma yogena ca apare
translated: Others by the Yoga of Sāṃkhya, and others by the Yoga of action.

original: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate
analyzed: anye tu evam a jānantaḥ śrutvā anyebhyaḥ upāsate
translated: But others, not knowing this, worship by hearing from others.

analyzed: te ca atitaranti eva mṛtyum śruti parāyaṇāḥ
translated: They also, devoted to the Vedas, cross over death.

original: yāvat saṃjāyate kiṃ cit sattvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam
analyzed: yāvat saṃjāyate kim cit sattvam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: Whatever being is born, moving or unmoving,

analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajña saṃyogāt tat viddhi bharata ṛṣabha
translated: know that to be from the union of the field and the knower of the field, O best of the Bharatas.

analyzed: samam sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantam parameśvaram
translated: The Supreme Lord, who abides equally in all beings,

original: vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
analyzed: vinaśyatsu a vinaśyantam yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
translated: he who sees Him as not perishing when they perish, sees truly.

original: samaṃ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram
analyzed: samam paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram
translated: For one who sees the Lord as abiding equally everywhere,

original: na hinasty ātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim
analyzed: na hinasti ātmanā ātmānam tatas yāti parām gatim
translated: does not injure the Self by the Self, and thus attains the supreme goal.

analyzed: prakṛtyā eva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśas
translated: And all actions are performed by Prakṛti alone.

original: yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṃ sa paśyati
analyzed: yaḥ paśyati tathā ātmānam akartāram sa paśyati
translated: He who sees thus, sees the Self as not the agent.

analyzed: yadā bhūta pṛthagbhāvam ekastham anupaśyati
translated: When one sees the individualities of beings as united in one place,

original: tata eva ca vistāraṃ brahma saṃpadyate tadā
analyzed: tatas eva ca vistāram brahma saṃpadyate tadā
translated: And from that very thing, Brahman expands. Then

analyzed: anādi tvāt nirguṇa tvāt paramātmā ayam avyayaḥ
translated: Because of beginninglessness and being without qualities, this Supreme Self is imperishable.

original: śarīrastho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
analyzed: kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
translated: Even while dwelling in the body, O son of Kunti, it neither acts nor is tainted.

analyzed: yathā sarva gatam saukṣmyāt ākāśam na upalipyate
translated: Just as space, because of its subtlety, is not tainted although all-pervading,

analyzed: sarvatra avasthitaḥ dehe tathā ātmā na upalipyate
translated: so the Self, although present in all bodies, is not tainted.

original: yathā prakāśayaty ekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokam imaṃ raviḥ
analyzed: yathā prakāśayati ekaḥ kṛtsnam lokam imam raviḥ
translated: Just as the one sun illuminates this entire world,

original: kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata
analyzed: kṣetram kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnam prakāśayati bhārata
translated: so the all-pervading Lord illuminates the entire field, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajñayoḥ evam antaram jñānacakṣuṣā
translated: Thus the difference between the field and the Knower of the field should be known by the eye of knowledge,

original: bhūtaprakṛtimokṣaṃ ca ye vidur yānti te param
analyzed: bhūta prakṛti mokṣam ca ye viduḥ yānti te param
translated: and those who know the liberation of the material nature go to the Supreme.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: paraṃ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṃ jñānam uttamam
analyzed: param bhūyas pravakṣyāmi jñānānām jñānam uttamam
translated: I shall speak again of the knowledge of knowledge, which is supreme,

original: yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṃ siddhim ito gatāḥ
analyzed: yat jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parām siddhim itas gatāḥ
translated: knowing which all the sages have gone to the highest perfection from here.

original: idaṃ jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
analyzed: idam jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
translated: Having resorted to this knowledge, they have attained identity with Me.

original: sarge 'pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
analyzed: sarge pi na upajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
translated: They are not born even at creation, nor do they suffer at dissolution.

original: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṃ dadhāmy aham
analyzed: mama yoniḥ mahat brahma tasmin garbham dadhāmi aham
translated: My womb is the great Brahman; in that I place the seed.

analyzed: saṃbhavaḥ sarva bhūtānām tatas bhavati bhārata
translated: From that, O descendant of Bharata, the origin of all beings takes place.

analyzed: sarva yoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ saṃbhavanti yāḥ
translated: In all wombs, O son of Kunti, the forms that are born,

original: tāsāṃ brahma mahad yonir ahaṃ bījapradaḥ pitā
analyzed: tāsām brahma mahat yoniḥ aham bīja pradaḥ pitā
translated: of them Brahman is the great womb, and I am the father who gives the seed.

original: sattvaṃ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛtisaṃbhavāḥ
analyzed: sattvam rajaḥ tamaḥ iti guṇāḥ prakṛti saṃbhavāḥ
translated: Sattva, rajas, and tamas - these are the qualities born of nature.

analyzed: nibadhnanti mahā bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
translated: They bind the imperishable embodied soul to the body, O mighty-armed one.

analyzed: tatra sattvam nirmala tvāt prakāśakam anāmayam
translated: There, sattva, being pure, is illuminating and wholesome.

analyzed: sukha saṅgena badhnāti jñāna saṅgena ca anagha
translated: It binds through attachment to happiness and through attachment to knowledge, O sinless one.

analyzed: rajaḥ rāga ātmakam viddhi tṛṣṇā saṅga samudbhavam
translated: Know rajas to be of the nature of passion, arising from craving and attachment.

analyzed: tat nibadhnāti kaunteya karma saṅgena dehinam
translated: That binds the embodied soul, O son of Kunti, through attachment to action.

original: tamas tv ajñānajaṃ viddhi mohanaṃ sarvadehinām
analyzed: tamaḥ tu ajñāna jam viddhi mohanam sarva dehinām
translated: But know tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings.

analyzed: pramāda ālasya nidrābhiḥ tat nibadhnāti bhārata
translated: It binds through heedlessness, laziness, and sleep, O descendant of Bharata.

original: sattvaṃ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
analyzed: sattvam sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
translated: Sattva engages in happiness, and rajas in action, O descendant of Bharata.

original: jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta🔽rajas tamaś cābhibhūya sattvaṃ bhavati bhārata
analyzed: jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayati uta  rajaḥ tamaḥ ca abhibhūya sattvam bhavati bhārata
translated: But tamas, covering knowledge, engages in heedlessness.🔽When sattva prevails over rajas and tamas, then, O descendant of Bharata, sattva arises.

original: rajaḥ sattvaṃ tamaś caiva tamaḥ sattvaṃ rajas tathā
analyzed: rajaḥ sattvam tamaḥ ca eva tamaḥ sattvam rajaḥ tathā
translated: And rajas and tamas prevail over sattva, and tamas over rajas and sattva.

analyzed: sarva dvāreṣu dehe smin prakāśaḥ upajāyate
translated: When there is light in this body through all the senses,

original: jñānaṃ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛddhaṃ sattvam ity uta
analyzed: jñānam yadā tadā vidyāt vivṛddham sattvam iti uta
translated: then one should know that sattva has increased.

original: lobhaḥ pravṛttir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā
analyzed: lobhaḥ pravṛttiḥ ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā
translated: Greed, activity, undertaking of actions, restlessness, and desire,

analyzed: rajasi etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull of the Bharata lineage, these arise when rajas increases.

original: aprakāśo 'pravṛttiś ca pramādo moha eva ca
analyzed: pravṛttiḥ ca pramādaḥ mohaḥ eva ca
translated: Darkness, inactivity, negligence, and delusion,

analyzed: tamasi etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kuru nandana
translated: these arise, O descendant of Kuru, when tamas increases.

original: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṃ yāti dehabhṛt
analyzed: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayam yāti dehabhṛt
translated: When a embodied being, when sattva has increased, meets with destruction,

analyzed: tadā uttama vidām lokān amalān pratipadyate
translated: then he attains the pure worlds of those who know the highest.

analyzed: rajasi pralayam gatvā karma saṅgiṣu jāyate
translated: Having met with destruction in rajas, he is born among those attached to action.

analyzed: tathā pralīnaḥ tamasi mūḍha yoniṣu jāyate
translated: Similarly, having merged in tamas, he is born among the deluded species.

analyzed: karmaṇaḥ su kṛtasya āhuḥ sāttvikam nirmalam phalam
translated: They say that the pure fruit of good action is of sattva.

original: rajasas tu phalaṃ duḥkham ajñānaṃ tamasaḥ phalam
analyzed: rajasaḥ tu phalam duḥkham ajñānam tamasaḥ phalam
translated: But the fruit of rajas is sorrow, and the fruit of tamas is ignorance.

original: sattvāt saṃjāyate jñānaṃ rajaso lobha eva ca
analyzed: sattvāt saṃjāyate jñānam rajasaḥ lobhaḥ eva ca
translated: From sattva arises knowledge, and from rajas arises greed.

analyzed: pramāda mohau tamasaḥ bhavataḥ jñānam eva ca
translated: Negligence and delusion arise from tamas, as also ignorance.

original: ūrdhvaṃ gacchanti sattvasthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ
analyzed: ūrdhvam gacchanti sattva sthāḥ madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ
translated: Those established in sattva go upwards, those in rajas stay in the middle,

analyzed: jaghanya guṇa vṛtta sthāḥ adhas gacchanti tāmasāḥ
translated: Those in the mode of darkness, abiding in the lowest quality, go down.

analyzed: na anyam guṇebhyaḥ kartāram yadā draṣṭā anupaśyati
translated: When the seer does not see any agent other than the qualities,

original: guṇebhyaś ca paraṃ vetti madbhāvaṃ so 'dhigacchati
analyzed: guṇebhyaḥ ca param vetti mad bhāvam saḥ dhigacchati
translated: and knows what is beyond the qualities, he attains My nature.

original: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī dehasamudbhavān
analyzed: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha samudbhavān
translated: Having transcended these three qualities that arise from the body, the embodied soul

analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā duḥkhaiḥ vimuktaḥ mṛtam aśnute
translated: becomes free from birth, death, old age, and suffering, and attains immortality.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho
analyzed: kaiḥ liṅgaiḥ trīn guṇān etān atītaḥ bhavati prabho
translated: By what signs is one who has transcended these three qualities, O Lord?

original: kimācāraḥ kathaṃ caitāṃs trīn guṇān ativartate
analyzed: kimācāraḥ katham ca etān trīn guṇān ativartate
translated: What is his conduct, and how does he transcend these three qualities?

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prakāśaṃ ca pravṛttiṃ ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: prakāśam ca pravṛttim ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava
translated: Light, activity, and delusion - O son of Pandu,

original: na dveṣṭi saṃpravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati🔽udāsīnavad āsīno guṇair yo na vicālyate
analyzed: na dveṣṭi saṃpravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati  udāsīna vat āsīnaḥ guṇaiḥ yaḥ na vicālyate
translated: he does not hate them when they occur, nor does he desire them when they cease.🔽Sitting as if indifferent, he who is not shaken by the qualities,

original: guṇā vartanta ity eva yo 'vatiṣṭhati neṅgate🔽samaduḥkhasukhaḥ svasthaḥ samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ🔽tulyapriyāpriyo dhīras tulyanindātmasaṃstutiḥ
analyzed: guṇāḥ vartante iti eva yaḥ vatiṣṭhati na iṅgate  sama duḥkha sukhaḥ svasthaḥ sama loṣṭa aśma kāñcanaḥ  tulya priya apriyaḥ dhīraḥ tulya nindā ātma saṃstutiḥ
translated: he who remains thinking, The qualities are functioning, without moving,🔽equally happy and unhappy, self-controlled, regarding a clod, a stone, and gold as the same,🔽equally inclined towards the agreeable and disagreeable, patient,

analyzed: māna avamānayoḥ tulyaḥ tulyaḥ mitra ari pakṣayoḥ
translated: equally regarding honor and dishonor, and regarding friends and enemies as the same,

analyzed: sarva ārambha parityāgī guṇa atītaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: He who has renounced all undertakings is said to have transcended the qualities.

analyzed: mām ca yaḥ vyabhicāreṇa bhakti yogena sevate
translated: And he who serves Me with a devotion that is unwavering,

analyzed: sa guṇān samatītya etān brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: he, having transcended these qualities, becomes fit for merging into Brahman.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ hi pratiṣṭhā aham amṛtasya avyayasya ca
translated: For I am the support of Brahman, of the immortal, of the imperishable,

analyzed: śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasya aikāntikasya ca
translated: of the eternal Dharma, and of the absolute bliss.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

analyzed: ūrdhva mūlam adhas śākham aśvattham prāhuḥ avyayam
translated: They say that the imperishable Ashvattha tree has its roots above and branches below,

original: chandāṃsi yasya parṇāni yas taṃ veda sa vedavit
analyzed: chandāṃsi yasya parṇāni yaḥ tam veda sa veda vid
translated: whose leaves are the Vedas. He who knows it is a knower of the Vedas.

analyzed: adhas ca ūrdhvam prasṛtāḥ tasya śākhā
translated: Its branches spread upwards and downwards,

analyzed: guṇa pravṛddhāḥ viṣaya pravālāḥ  adhas ca mūlāni anusaṃtatāni
translated: nourished by the qualities and sprouting with objects.🔽Its roots, connected with action, extend downwards

analyzed: karma anubandhīni manuṣya loke
translated: in the human world.

analyzed: na rūpam asya iha tathā upalabhyate
translated: Its form is not perceived here in this way,

original: nānto na cādir na ca saṃpratiṣṭhā
analyzed: na antaḥ na ca ādiḥ na ca saṃpratiṣṭhā
translated: it has no end, no beginning, and no foundation.

analyzed: aśvattham enam su virūḍha mūlam
translated: This Ashvattha tree, with its roots well-established,

analyzed: asaṅga śastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā
translated: having cut it down with the firm weapon of non-attachment,

analyzed: tatas padam tat parimārgitavyam
translated: then that state should be sought,

analyzed: yasmin gatāḥ na nivartanti bhūyas
translated: to which, having gone, one does not return again.

analyzed: tam eva ca ādyam puruṣam prapadye
translated: And I take refuge in that very primordial Purusha.

analyzed: yatas pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī
translated: From which the ancient course of action has spread,

analyzed: nirmāna mohā jita saṅga doṣā
translated: Free from pride, delusion, and the fault of attachment,

analyzed: adhyātma nityāḥ vinivṛtta kāmāḥ
translated: Always devoted to the self, with desires gone,

analyzed: dvaṃdvaiḥ vimuktāḥ sukha duḥkha saṃjñaiḥ
translated: Liberated from the pairs of opposites, with the notion of pleasure and pain,

analyzed: gacchanti amūḍhāḥ padam avyayam tat
translated: The undeluded ones go to that imperishable state.

original: na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na pāvakaḥ
analyzed: na tat bhāsayate sūryaḥ na śaśāṅkaḥ na pāvakaḥ
translated: The sun does not illuminate it, nor does the moon or fire.

original: yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṃ mama
analyzed: yat gatvā na nivartante tat dhāma paramam mama
translated: Having gone to which, they do not return, that is my supreme abode.

analyzed: mama eva aṃśaḥ jīva loke jīva bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: My own part, the eternal one, has become the individual soul in the world of living beings.

analyzed: manaḥ ṣaṣṭhāni indriyāṇi prakṛti sthāni karṣati
translated: It draws the senses, with the mind as the sixth, back to their original state.

original: śarīraṃ yad avāpnoti yac cāpy utkrāmatīśvaraḥ
analyzed: śarīram yat avāpnoti yat ca api utkrāmati īśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord takes up this body and also departs from it.

analyzed: gṛhītvā etāni saṃyāti vāyuḥ gandhān iva āśayāt
translated: Taking these, it goes away, like the wind from its abode.

original: śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṃ ca rasanaṃ ghrāṇam eva ca
analyzed: śrotram cakṣuḥ sparśanam ca rasanam ghrāṇam eva ca
translated: The ear, the eye, touch, taste, and smell,

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāya manaḥ ca ayam viṣayān upasevate
translated: Relying on these, it enjoys the objects.

original: utkrāmantaṃ sthitaṃ vāpi bhuñjānaṃ vā guṇānvitam
analyzed: utkrāmantam sthitam vā api bhuñjānam vā guṇa anvitam
translated: Whether departing, remaining, or enjoying, endowed with qualities,

analyzed: vimūḍhāḥ na anupaśyanti paśyanti jñāna cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: The deluded ones do not see it, but those with the eye of knowledge see it.

original: yatanto yoginaś cainaṃ paśyanty ātmany avasthitam
analyzed: yatantaḥ yoginaḥ ca enam paśyanti ātmani avasthitam
translated: The yogis, striving, see it abiding in the self.

analyzed: yatantaḥ api akṛtātmānaḥ na enam paśyanti acetasaḥ
translated: Even though they try, those who are not self-controlled and who are devoid of wisdom do not see Him.

analyzed: yat āditya gatam tejaḥ jagat bhāsayate khilam
translated: The splendor that is in the sun illuminates the entire world,

original: yac candramasi yac cāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam
analyzed: yat candramasi yat ca agnau tat tejaḥ viddhi māmakam
translated: and that splendor which is in the moon and in the fire, know that splendor to be Mine.

original: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasā
analyzed: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmi aham ojasā
translated: And having entered the earth, I support all beings with My strength.

original: puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
analyzed: puṣṇāmi ca oṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somaḥ bhūtvā rasa ātmakaḥ
translated: And becoming the moon, I nourish all the herbs with My essence.

original: ahaṃ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṃ deham āśritaḥ
analyzed: aham vaiśvānaraḥ bhūtvā prāṇinām deham āśritaḥ
translated: Becoming the fire, I dwell in the bodies of all living beings,

analyzed: prāṇa apāna samāyuktaḥ pacāmi annam caturvidham
translated: and endowed with inhalation and exhalation, I digest the four kinds of food.

analyzed: sarvasya ca aham hṛdi saṃniviṣṭaḥ
translated: And I am situated in the heart of all.

original: mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṃ ca🔽vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo /
analyzed: mattaḥ smṛtiḥ jñānam apohanam ca  vedaiḥ ca sarvaiḥ aham eva vedyaḥ
translated: From Me are memory, knowledge and their loss.

analyzed: vedānta kṛt veda vid eva ca aham
translated: By all the Vedas I am to be known; I am the author of the Vedas, and I am the knower of the Vedas.

original: dvāv imau puruṣau loke kṣaraś cākṣara eva ca
analyzed: dvau imau puruṣau loke kṣaraḥ ca akṣaraḥ eva ca
translated: There are two persons in this world, the perishable and the imperishable.

analyzed: kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭasthaḥ kṣaraḥ ucyate
translated: The perishable is all the elements, and the immutable is said to be the Supreme Self.

original: uttamaḥ puruṣas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛtaḥ
analyzed: uttamaḥ puruṣaḥ tu anyaḥ paramātmā iti udāhṛtaḥ
translated: But there is another, the Supreme Person, called the imperishable Lord,

original: yo lokatrayam āviśya bibharty avyaya īśvaraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ lokatrayam āviśya bibharti avyayaḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: who, having entered the three worlds, supports them, the changeless God.

original: yasmāt kṣaram atīto 'ham akṣarād api cottamaḥ
analyzed: yasmāt kṣaram atītaḥ ham akṣarāt api ca uttamaḥ
translated: Since I am beyond the perishable and also above the imperishable,

original: ato 'smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: atas smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Therefore, I am renowned in the world and the Vedas as the Supreme Person.

original: yo mām evam asaṃmūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam
analyzed: yaḥ mām evam asaṃmūḍhaḥ jānāti puruṣottamam
translated: The person who, undeluded, thus knows Me as the Supreme Person,

original: sa sarvavid bhajati māṃ sarvabhāvena bhārata
analyzed: sa sarva vid bhajati mām sarva bhāvena bhārata
translated: he, O scion of the Bharata dynasty, becomes omniscient and worships Me with all his being.

original: iti guhyatamaṃ śāstram idam uktaṃ mayānagha
analyzed: iti guhyatamam śāstram idam uktam mayā anagha
translated: Thus, O sinless one, this most secret doctrine has been spoken by Me.

original: etad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛtakṛtyaś ca bhārata
analyzed: etat buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛtakṛtyaḥ ca bhārata
translated: Knowing this, one becomes wise and one whose purpose is fulfilled, O scion of the Bharata dynasty.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:
Fearlessness, purity of mind, perseverance in knowledge and yoga,

original: dānaṃ damaś ca yajñaś ca svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam
analyzed: dānam damaḥ ca yajñaḥ ca svādhyāyaḥ tapaḥ ārjavam
translated: charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the Vedas, austerity, and straightforwardness,

original: ahiṃsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śāntir apaiśunam🔽dayā bhūteṣv aloluptvaṃ mārdavaṃ hrīr acāpalam
analyzed: ahiṃsā satyam akrodhaḥ tyāgaḥ śāntiḥ apaiśunam  dayā bhūteṣu a loluptvam mārdavam hrīḥ acāpalam
translated: non-violence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, tranquility, absence of fault-finding,🔽compassion towards beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, absence of fickleness,

original: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adroho nātimānitā
analyzed: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adrohaḥ na atimāni tā
translated: splendor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, absence of malice, and absence of haughtiness,

analyzed: bhavanti saṃpadam daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
translated: these, O scion of the Bharata dynasty, are the qualities of one who is born with the divine nature.

original: dambho darpo 'timānaś ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyam eva ca
analyzed: dambhaḥ darpaḥ ti mānaḥ ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyam eva ca
translated: Arrogance, pride, excessive self-esteem, anger, and harshness,

analyzed: ajñānam ca abhijātasya pārtha saṃpadam āsurīm
translated: and ignorance, O son of Prtha, are the qualities of one who is born with the demoniac nature.

analyzed: daivī saṃpad vimokṣāya nibandhāya āsurī matā
translated: The divine nature is considered conducive to liberation, while the demoniac nature is considered conducive to bondage.

original: mā śucaḥ saṃpadaṃ daivīm abhijāto 'si pāṇḍava
analyzed: mā śucaḥ saṃpadam daivīm abhijātaḥ si pāṇḍava
translated: Do not grieve. You have been born as a son of the divine nature, O son of Pandu.

original: dvau bhūtasargau loke 'smin daiva āsura eva ca
analyzed: dvau bhūta sargau loke smin daivaḥ āsuraḥ eva ca
translated: There are two kinds of creation of beings in this world, the divine and the demoniac.

original: daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṃ pārtha me śṛṇu
analyzed: daivaḥ vistaraśaḥ proktaḥ āsuram pārtha me śṛṇu
translated: The divine has been described in detail. Listen to the demoniac, O son of Pritha.

original: pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca janā na vidur āsurāḥ
analyzed: pravṛttim ca nivṛttim ca janāḥ na viduḥ āsurāḥ
translated: The demoniacal people do not know engagement and disengagement.

original: na śaucaṃ nāpi cācāro na satyaṃ teṣu vidyate
analyzed: na śaucam na api ca ācāraḥ na satyam teṣu vidyate
translated: They have no purity, no conduct, no truth.

original: asatyam apratiṣṭhaṃ te jagad āhur anīśvaram
analyzed: asatyam apratiṣṭham te jagat āhuḥ anīśvaram
translated: They say that this world is false, without support, without a Lord,

analyzed: a paraspara saṃbhūtam kim anyat kāma haitukam
translated: arisen from mutual union, and caused by nothing but desire.

analyzed: etām dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭa ātmānaḥ lpabuddhayaḥ
translated: Relying on this view, those whose souls are lost, of little understanding,

original: prabhavanty ugrakarmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato 'hitāḥ🔽kāmam āśritya duṣpūraṃ dambhamānamadānvitāḥ
analyzed: prabhavanti ugra karmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagataḥ hitāḥ  kāmam āśritya duṣpūram dambha māna mada anvitāḥ
translated: arise for the destruction of the world, of evil deeds, of fierce actions.🔽Relying on desire, which is insatiable, full of pride, conceit and intoxication,

analyzed: mohāt gṛhītvā asat grāhān pravartante śuci vratāḥ
translated: they engage in impure vows, taking up bad views out of delusion.

analyzed: cintām aparimeyām ca pralaya antām upāśritāḥ
translated: They resort to immeasurable anxiety, ending in destruction.

analyzed: kāma upabhoga paramāḥ etāvat iti niścitāḥ
translated: They are certain that this much is enough, that the highest is the enjoyment of desire.

analyzed: āśā pāśa śataiḥ baddhāḥ kāma krodha parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Bound by hundreds of fetters of hope, devoted to desire and anger,

analyzed: īhante kāma bhoga artham anyāyena artha saṃcayān
translated: they seek wealth for the enjoyment of desire by unjust means.

original: idam adya mayā labdham idaṃ prāpsye manoratham
analyzed: idam adya mayā labdham idam prāpsye manoratham
translated: Today I have obtained this, I will obtain this desire,

original: idam astīdam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam
analyzed: idam asti idam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam
translated: This is mine, and this wealth will be mine again.

original: asau mayā hataḥ śatrur haniṣye cāparān api
analyzed: asau mayā hataḥ śatruḥ haniṣye ca aparān api
translated: This enemy has been killed by me, and I will kill others too.

original: īśvaro 'ham ahaṃ bhogī siddho 'haṃ balavān sukhī
analyzed: īśvaraḥ ham aham bhogī siddhaḥ ham balavān sukhī
translated: I am the lord, I am an enjoyer, I am accomplished, powerful, happy,

analyzed: āḍhyaḥ asmi kaḥ sti sadṛśaḥ mayā
translated: Wealthy, well-born - who else is there equal to me?

analyzed: yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣye iti ajñāna vimohitāḥ
translated: I will sacrifice, I will give, I will rejoice - thus deluded by ignorance,

analyzed: aneka citta vibhrāntāḥ moha jāla samāvṛtāḥ
translated: Confused by many thoughts, covered by the net of delusion,

analyzed: prasaktāḥ kāma bhogeṣu patanti narake śucau
translated: Addicted to the enjoyment of desires, they fall into an impure hell.

analyzed: ātma saṃbhāvitāḥ stabdhāḥ dhana māna mada anvitāḥ
translated: Self-conceited, arrogant, full of pride, vanity and anger,

original: yajante nāmayajñais te dambhenāvidhipūrvakam🔽ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ ca saṃśritāḥ
analyzed: yajante nāma yajñaiḥ te dambhena a vidhi pūrvakam  ahaṃkāram balam darpam kāmam krodham ca saṃśritāḥ
translated: They worship with sacrifices that are mere show, not in accordance with the rules.🔽Relying on ego, strength, pride, desire and anger,

analyzed: mām ātma para deheṣu pradviṣantaḥ bhyasūyakāḥ
translated: They, the envious, hate Me dwelling in the bodies of themselves and others.

original: tān ahaṃ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu narādhamān🔽kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu
analyzed: tān aham dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu nara adhamān  kṣipāmi ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣu eva yoniṣu
translated: I cast those haters, the cruel, the lowest of men,🔽Constantly into inauspicious births, into demon births alone.

original: āsurīṃ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani
analyzed: āsurīm yonim āpannāḥ mūḍhāḥ janmani janmani
translated: Born in demon births, deluded in birth after birth,

original: mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṃ gatim
analyzed: mām a prāpya eva kaunteya tatas yānti adhamām gatim
translated: Without attaining Me, O son of Kunti, they go to the lowest state.

analyzed: trividham narakasya idam dvāram nāśanam ātmanaḥ
translated: This is the threefold gate to hell, which destroys the self:

original: kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṃ tyajet
analyzed: kāmaḥ krodhaḥ tathā lobhaḥ tasmāt etat trayam tyajet
translated: Desire, anger, and greed - therefore one should abandon these three.

original: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvārais tribhir naraḥ
analyzed: etaiḥ vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamaḥ dvāraiḥ tribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: O son of Kunti, a man who is free from these three gates to darkness

original: ācaraty ātmanaḥ śreyas tato yāti parāṃ gatim
analyzed: ācarati ātmanaḥ śreyaḥ tatas yāti parām gatim
translated: practices what is good for himself and then attains the highest state.

analyzed: yaḥ śāstra vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ
translated: One who, abandoning the injunction of scripture, acts according to desire,

original: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṃ na parāṃ gatim
analyzed: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukham na parām gatim
translated: does not attain perfection, nor happiness, nor the highest state.

analyzed: tasmāt śāstram pramāṇam te kārya akārya vyavasthitau
translated: Therefore, scripture is the authority for you in determining what should and should not be done.

analyzed: jñātvā śāstra vidhāna uktam karma kartum iha arhasi
translated: Having understood what is stated in the scriptures, you should perform your duties here.

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

analyzed: ye śāstra vidhim utsṛjya yajante śraddhayā anvitāḥ
translated: Those who, abandoning the injunction of scripture, worship with faith,

original: teṣāṃ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ
analyzed: teṣām niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajaḥ tamaḥ
translated: what is their goal, O Krishna, - sattva, rajas, or tamas?

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṃ sā svabhāvajā
analyzed: trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehinām sā svabhāva jā
translated: Faith of embodied beings is of three kinds, born of their own nature.

original: sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṃ śṛṇu
analyzed: sāttvikī rājasī ca eva tāmasī ca iti tām śṛṇu
translated: Listen to it, as it is of the sattva, rajas, and tamas types.

analyzed: sattva anurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, everyone's faith is in accordance with their sattva.

original: śraddhāmayo 'yaṃ puruṣo yo yacchraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
analyzed: śraddhā mayaḥ yam puruṣaḥ yaḥ yad śraddhaḥ saḥ eva saḥ
translated: This person is full of faith. He is what his faith is.

analyzed: yajante sāttvikāḥ devān yakṣa rakṣāṃsi rājasāḥ
translated: The good worship the gods, the mediocre the Yakshas and the Rakshasas,

original: pretān bhūtagaṇāṃś cānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
analyzed: pretān bhūta gaṇān ca anye yajante tāmasāḥ janāḥ
translated: and the bad worship the ghosts and other spirits.

original: aśāstravihitaṃ ghoraṃ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ
analyzed: a śāstra vihitam ghoram tapyante ye tapaḥ janāḥ
translated: Those who practice terrible austerities not prescribed by the scriptures,

analyzed: dambha ahaṃkāra saṃyuktāḥ kāma rāga bala anvitāḥ
translated: who are full of hypocrisy and pride, and endowed with the power of lust and passion,

analyzed: karśayantaḥ śarīra stham bhūta grāmam acetasaḥ
translated: who, being senseless, torment the group of elements in the body,

analyzed: mām ca eva antar śarīra stham tān viddhi āsura niścayān
translated: and who consider Me as dwelling within the body - know them to be of demoniacal resolve.

original: āhāras tv api sarvasya trividho bhavati priyaḥ
analyzed: āhāraḥ tu api sarvasya trividhaḥ bhavati priyaḥ
translated: Moreover, the food of all is of three kinds and is liked.

original: yajñas tapas tathā dānaṃ teṣāṃ bhedam imaṃ śṛṇu🔽āyuḥsattvabalārogyasukhaprītivivardhanāḥ
analyzed: yajñaḥ tapaḥ tathā dānam teṣām bhedam imam śṛṇu  āyuḥ sattva bala ārogya sukha prīti vivardhanāḥ
translated: Sacrifice, austerity, and charity - hear from Me the distinction of these.🔽Those that increase life, goodness, strength, health, happiness, and joy,

original: rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvikapriyāḥ
analyzed: rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirāḥ hṛdyāḥ āhārāḥ sāttvika priyāḥ
translated: that are pleasant, unctuous, firm, and agreeable - such food is liked by the good.
Food that is pungent, sour, salty, very hot, sharp, rough, and burning,

analyzed: āhārāḥ rājasasya iṣṭāḥ duḥkha śoka āmaya pradāḥ
translated: is liked by the mediocre, and gives rise to sorrow, grief, and disease.

original: yātayāmaṃ gatarasaṃ pūti paryuṣitaṃ ca yat
analyzed: yātayāmam gata rasam pūti paryuṣitam ca yat
translated: What is stale, tasteless, putrid, and old,

analyzed: ucchiṣṭam api ca amedhyam bhojanam tāmasa priyam
translated: and what is left over and impure - such food is liked by the bad.

analyzed: a phala ākāṅkṣibhiḥ yajñaḥ vidhi dṛṣṭaḥ yaḥ ijyate
translated: That sacrifice which is performed according to the rules, without desire for fruits,

original: yaṣṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
analyzed: yaṣṭavyam eva iti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
translated: with the mind fixed on the thought that it must be performed, is said to be of the sattva quality.

original: abhisaṃdhāya tu phalaṃ dambhārtham api caiva yat
analyzed: abhisaṃdhāya tu phalam dambha artham api ca eva yat
translated: But that sacrifice which is performed with a view to fruits, and even with hypocrisy,

original: ijyate bharataśreṣṭha taṃ yajñaṃ viddhi rājasam🔽vidhihīnam asṛṣṭānnaṃ mantrahīnam adakṣiṇam
analyzed: ijyate bharata śreṣṭha tam yajñam viddhi rājasam  vidhi hīnam a sṛṣṭa annam mantra hīnam a dakṣiṇam
translated: O best of the Bharatas, know that sacrifice to be of the rajas quality.🔽That sacrifice which is devoid of rules, where food is not distributed, where mantras are not used, where no fees are given,

analyzed: śraddhā virahitam yajñam tāmasam paricakṣate
translated: and which is devoid of faith, is said to be of the tamas quality.

analyzed: deva dvija guru prājña pūjanam śaucam ārjavam
translated: Worship of gods, Brahmanas, preceptors and the wise, purity, sincerity,

original: brahmacaryam ahiṃsā ca śārīraṃ tapa ucyate
analyzed: brahmacaryam ahiṃsā ca śārīram tapaḥ ucyate
translated: celibacy and non-violence - this is said to be bodily austerity.

original: anudvegakaraṃ vākyaṃ satyaṃ priyahitaṃ ca yat
analyzed: an udvega karam vākyam satyam priya hitam ca yat
translated: Speech that does not cause distress, that is true, pleasant and beneficial,

analyzed: svādhyāya abhyasanam ca eva vāc mayam tapaḥ ucyate
translated: and the practice of self-study - this is said to be verbal austerity.
Tranquility of the mind, gentleness, silence, self-control,

original: bhāvasaṃśuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam ucyate
analyzed: bhāva saṃśuddhiḥ iti etat tapaḥ mānasam ucyate
translated: and purification of thoughts - this is said to be mental austerity.

original: śraddhayā parayā taptaṃ tapas tat trividhaṃ naraiḥ🔽aphalākāṅkṣibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṃ paricakṣate
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā taptam tapaḥ tat trividham naraiḥ  a phala ākāṅkṣibhiḥ yuktaiḥ sāttvikam paricakṣate
translated: That austerity which is performed by men with supreme faith,🔽without desire for fruits, and with devotion, is said to be of the sattva quality.

analyzed: satkāra māna pūjā artham tapaḥ dambhena ca eva yat
translated: That austerity which is performed for the sake of honor, respect and worship, and even with hypocrisy,

original: kriyate tad iha proktaṃ rājasaṃ calam adhruvam
analyzed: kriyate tat iha proktam rājasam calam adhruvam
translated: That which is done here with the idea that it is to be done, is said to be of the rajas strand, unsteady and impermanent.

analyzed: mūḍha grāheṇa ātmanaḥ yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
translated: That austerity which is practised by one who has a deluded notion of the self, and which is practised with pain,

analyzed: parasya utsādana artham vā tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
translated: or for the destruction of another, is said to be of the tamas strand.

analyzed: dātavyam iti yat dānam dīyate n upakāriṇe
translated: That gift which is given with the idea that it is to be given, to one who does not benefit,

original: deśe kāle ca pātre ca tad dānaṃ sāttvikaṃ smṛtam
analyzed: deśe kāle ca pātre ca tat dānam sāttvikam smṛtam
translated: in a proper place, time and recipient, that gift is said to be of the sattva strand.

original: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṃ phalam uddiśya vā punaḥ
analyzed: yat tu pratyupakāra artham phalam uddiśya vā punar
translated: But that which is given with the idea of return, or with the thought of fruit,

original: dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṃ tad dānaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam🔽adeśakāle yad dānam apātrebhyaś ca dīyate
analyzed: dīyate ca parikliṣṭam tat dānam rājasam smṛtam  a deśa kāle yat dānam apātrebhyaḥ ca dīyate
translated: and which is given with pain, that gift is said to be of the rajas strand.🔽That gift which is given in an improper place and time, and to improper recipients,

analyzed: asatkṛtam avajñātam tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
translated: and which is given without respect and with contempt, that is said to be of the tamas strand.

original: oṃ tat sad iti nirdeśo brahmaṇas trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ
analyzed: om tat sat iti nirdeśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Om, tat, sat - this is said to be the threefold designation of Brahman.

original: brāhmaṇās tena vedāś ca yajñāś ca vihitāḥ purā
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ tena vedāḥ ca yajñāḥ ca vihitāḥ purā
translated: By that, the Brahmanas, the Vedas, and the sacrifices were created in the past.

analyzed: tasmāt om iti udāhṛtya yajña dāna tapaḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Therefore, having uttered Om, the rites of sacrifice, gift, and austerity,

original: pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṃ brahmavādinām🔽tad ity anabhisaṃdhāya phalaṃ yajñatapaḥkriyāḥ
analyzed: pravartante vidhāna uktāḥ satatam brahma vādinām  tat iti an abhisaṃdhāya phalam yajña tapaḥ kriyāḥ
translated: which are prescribed by the rules, are always performed by the expounders of Brahman.🔽Those rites of sacrifice, austerity,

analyzed: dāna kriyāḥ ca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣa kāṅkṣibhiḥ
translated: and various acts of giving are performed by those who desire liberation without aiming at a result.

original: sadbhāve sādhubhāve ca sad ity etat prayujyate
analyzed: sadbhāve sādhu bhāve ca sat iti etat prayujyate
