original: tatra tatraiva dṛśyante sāyudhāḥ sāṅgadair bhujaiḥ
analyzed: tatra tatra eva dṛśyante sa āyudhāḥ sa aṅgadaiḥ bhujaiḥ
translated: with their weapons and their arms adorned with bracelets, right there.

original: hayārohā hayāṃs tyaktvā gajārohāś ca dantinaḥ
analyzed: haya ārohāḥ hayān tyaktvā gaja ārohāḥ ca dantinaḥ
translated: The cavalrymen abandoned their horses and the elephant-riders their tuskers,

analyzed: arjunasya bhayāt rājan samantāt vipradudruvuḥ
translated: fleeing in all directions out of fear of Arjuna, O king.

original: rathebhyaś ca gajebhyaś ca hayebhyaś ca narādhipāḥ
analyzed: rathebhyaḥ ca gajebhyaḥ ca hayebhyaḥ ca narādhipāḥ
translated: The lords of the earth, from their chariots, elephants and horses,

analyzed: patitāḥ pātyamānāḥ ca dṛśyante rjuna tāḍitāḥ
translated: were seen falling and being struck down, afflicted by Arjuna.

original: sagadān udyatān bāhūn sakhaḍgāṃś ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: sa gadān udyatān bāhūn sa khaḍgān ca viśām pate
translated: The upraised arms with maces and swords, O lord of the people,

analyzed: sa prāsān ca sa tūṇīrān sa śarān sa śarāsanān
translated: With their spears, quivers, arrows, bows,

original: sāṅkuśān sapatākāṃś ca tatra tatrārjuno nṛṇām
analyzed: sa aṅkuśān sa patākān ca tatra tatra arjunaḥ nṛṇām
translated: goads and flags, here and there on the battlefield.

original: nicakarta śarair ugrai raudraṃ bibhrad vapus tadā
analyzed: nicakarta śaraiḥ ugraiḥ raudram bibhrat vapuḥ tadā
translated: Displaying a terrible form, he cut them down with his fierce arrows.

original: parighāṇāṃ pravṛddhānāṃ mudgarāṇāṃ ca māriṣa🔽prāsānāṃ bhiṇḍipālānāṃ nistriṃśānāṃ ca saṃyuge
analyzed: parighāṇām pravṛddhānām mudgarāṇām ca māriṣa  prāsānām bhindipālānām nistriṃśānām ca saṃyuge
translated: Of spiked clubs, large hammers,🔽spears, javelins, and swords in battle,🔽of sharp axes and lances, O Bharata,

analyzed: paraśvadhānām tīkṣṇānām tomarāṇām ca bhārata
translated: of armor and shields cast aside on the ground,

original: varmaṇāṃ cāpaviddhānāṃ kavacānāṃ ca bhūtale🔽dhvajānāṃ carmaṇāṃ caiva vyajanānāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ🔽chatrāṇāṃ hemadaṇḍānāṃ cāmarāṇāṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: varmaṇām ca apaviddhānām kavacānām ca bhū tale  dhvajānām carmaṇām ca eva vyajanānām ca sarvaśas  chatrāṇām hema daṇḍānām cāmarāṇām ca bhārata
translated: of flags, shields, and fans in every way,🔽of parasols with golden handles and yak tails, O Bharata,

original: pratodānāṃ kaśānāṃ ca yoktrāṇāṃ caiva māriṣa
analyzed: pratodānām kaśānām ca yoktrāṇām ca eva māriṣa
translated: of whips, reins, and yoking thongs, O venerable one,

analyzed: rāśayaḥ ca atra dṛśyante vinikīrṇāḥ raṇa kṣitau
translated: heaps were seen scattered on the battlefield.

original: nāsīt tatra pumān kaś cit tava sainyasya bhārata
analyzed: na āsīt tatra pumān kaḥ cit tava sainyasya bhārata
translated: There was no man in your army, O Bharata,

original: yo 'rjunaṃ samare śūraṃ pratyudyāyāt kathaṃ cana
analyzed: yaḥ rjunam samare śūram pratyudyāyāt katham cana
translated: who could in any way approach the heroic Arjuna in battle.

original: yo yo hi samare pārthaṃ patyudyāti viśāṃ pate
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ hi samare pārtham pati udyāti viśām pate
translated: For whoever advanced against Partha in battle, O lord of the people,

original: sa sa vai viśikhais tīkṣṇaiḥ paralokāya nīyate
analyzed: sa sa vai viśikhaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ para lokāya nīyate
translated: he was led to the next world by sharp arrows.

analyzed: teṣu vidravamāṇeṣu tava yodheṣu sarvaśas
translated: When all your warriors were fleeing in every direction,

original: arjuno vāsudevaś ca dadhmatur vārijottamau🔽rorūyamāṇo dṛśyeta dhvajāgre vānareśvaraḥ
analyzed: arjunaḥ vāsudevaḥ ca dadhmatuḥ vārija uttamau  rorūyamāṇaḥ dṛśyeta dhvaja agre vānara īśvaraḥ
translated: Arjuna and Vasudeva blew their excellent conch shells.🔽The lord of monkeys was seen crying out, at the top of the flagpole,

analyzed: dṛṣṭyā bhīṣayate śatrūn stabdha karṇaḥ mahā kapiḥ
translated: The great monkey, with his ears erect, frightened the enemies with his gaze.

original: tat prabhagnaṃ balaṃ dṛṣṭvā pitā devavratas tava
analyzed: tat prabhagnam balam dṛṣṭvā pitā devavrataḥ tava
translated: Seeing that army shattered, your father Devavrata,

original: abravīt samare śūraṃ bhāradvājaṃ smayann iva
analyzed: abravīt samare śūram bhāradvājam smayan iva
translated: smiled and said to the brave Bharadvaja's son in the battle:

original: eṣa pāṇḍusuto vīraḥ kṛṣṇena sahito balī
analyzed: eṣa pāṇḍu sutaḥ vīraḥ kṛṣṇena sahitaḥ balī
translated: This brave son of Pandu, powerful, accompanied by Krishna,

analyzed: tathā karoti sainyāni yathā kuryāt dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: acts towards the soldiers as if he were Dhananjaya himself.

original: na hy eṣa samare śakyo jetum adya kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na hi eṣa samare śakyaḥ jetum adya katham cana
translated: For he is certainly not able to be defeated in battle at all today,

analyzed: yathā asya dṛśyate rūpam kāla antaka yama upamam
translated: as his form is seen, resembling that of the god of death at the end of an aeon.

original: na nivartayituṃ cāpi śakyeyaṃ mahatī camūḥ
analyzed: na nivartayitum ca api śakyā iyam mahatī camūḥ
translated: And this great army cannot be turned back at all,

analyzed: anyonya prekṣayā paśya dravati iyam varūthinī
translated: look, this army is fleeing, looking at each other.

analyzed: vayam ca śastribhiḥ bhinnāḥ nṛpaiḥ indra samaiḥ yudhi
translated: And we are being shattered by the kings who are equal to Indra in battle, with their weapons.

original: bhīto vyūhasya sarvatra na sthātuṃ kaś cid icchati
analyzed: bhītaḥ vyūhasya sarvatra na sthātum kaḥ cit icchati
translated: No one wishes to remain anywhere out of fear of the vyuha.

analyzed: śara vrātāḥ pradṛśyanta pannaga ābhāḥ samantataḥ
translated: Arrows are seen everywhere, resembling serpents.

original: diśaś ca vidiśaś caiva vyāptā hy ārjunasāyakaiḥ
analyzed: diśaḥ ca vidiśaḥ ca eva vyāptāḥ hi ārjuna sāyakaiḥ
translated: The directions and the intermediate directions are pervaded by Arjuna's arrows.

analyzed: eṣa ca astam giri śreṣṭham bhānumān pratipadyate
translated: And the sun is setting behind that best of mountains,

analyzed: vapūṃṣi sarva lokasya saṃharan iva sarvathā
translated: as if completely withdrawing the bodies of all the worlds in every way.

analyzed: tatra avahāram saṃprāptam manye ham puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: There, O bull among men, I think the time has come to withdraw.

analyzed: śrāntāḥ bhītāḥ ca naḥ yodhāḥ na yotsyanti katham cana  evam uktvā tatas bhīṣmaḥ droṇam ācārya sattamam
translated: Our warriors are tired and frightened, and will not fight in any way.🔽Having said this, Bhishma then made the withdrawal of your great warriors,

analyzed: avahāram atho cakre tāvakānām mahā rathaḥ
translated: after the best of teachers, Drona,

analyzed: tatas sa ratha nāga aśvāḥ jayam prāpya sa somakāḥ
translated: had obtained victory, along with the chariots, elephants and horses.🔽The Panchalas and Pandavas, together with the Somakas,

original: pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva praṇeduś ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ ca eva praṇeduḥ ca punar punar
translated: shouted again and again,

analyzed: prayayuḥ śibirāya eva dhanaṃjaya puraskṛtāḥ
translated: and proceeded towards their camp, led by Dhananjaya,

analyzed: vāditra ghoṣaiḥ saṃhṛṣṭāḥ pranṛtyantaḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: the great warriors delighted with the sounds of musical instruments, dancing.

original: tato 'vahāraḥ sainyānāṃ tava teṣāṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: tatas vahāraḥ sainyānām tava teṣām ca bhārata
translated: Then, O Bharata, the withdrawal of your troops and theirs

original: astaṃ gacchati sūrye 'bhūt saṃdhyākāle ca vartati
analyzed: astam gacchati sūrye bhūt saṃdhyā kāle ca vartati
translated: took place when the sun was setting, at the time of dusk.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: prabhātāyām tu śarvaryām bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ tatas
translated: Then, when the night had dawned, Bhishma, the son of Shantanu,

analyzed: anīkāni anusaṃyāne vyādideśa atha bhārata
translated: And then, O Bharata, he ordered the divisions to be arrayed in the following manner.

original: gāruḍaṃ ca mahāvyūhaṃ cakre śāṃtanavas tadā
analyzed: gāruḍam ca mahā vyūham cakre śāṃtanavaḥ tadā
translated: Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, formed the great array in the shape of Garuda.

analyzed: putrāṇām te jaya ākāṅkṣī bhīṣmaḥ kuru pitāmahaḥ
translated: Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus, desirous of victory for your sons,

original: garuḍasya svayaṃ tuṇḍe pitā devavratas tava
analyzed: garuḍasya svayam tuṇḍe pitā devavrataḥ tava
translated: Your father Devavrata himself was at the beak of the Garuda,

original: cakṣuṣī ca bharadvājaḥ kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
analyzed: cakṣuṣī ca bharadvājaḥ kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
translated: Bharadvaja's son and Satvata Kritavarma were at the eyes,

original: aśvatthāmā kṛpaś caiva śīrṣam āstāṃ yaśasvinau
analyzed: aśvatthāmā kṛpaḥ ca eva śīrṣam āstām yaśasvinau
translated: The illustrious Ashvatthama and Kripa were at the head,

analyzed: trigartaiḥ matsya kaikeyaiḥ vāṭadhānaiḥ ca saṃyutau

original: bhūriśravāḥ śalaḥ śalyo bhagadattaś ca māriṣa
analyzed: bhūriśravāḥ śalaḥ śalyaḥ bhagadattaḥ ca māriṣa
translated: Bhurishrava, Shala, Shalya and Bhagadatta, O sire,

original: madrakāḥ sindhusauvīrās tathā pañcanadāś ca ye
analyzed: madrakāḥ sindhusauvīrāḥ tathā pañcanadāḥ ca ye
translated: The Madras, the Sindhus, the Sauviras, the Panchanadas,

analyzed: jayadrathena sahitāḥ grīvāyām saṃniveśitāḥ
translated: Together with Jayadratha, were placed at the neck.

original: pṛṣṭhe duryodhano rājā sodaraiḥ sānugair vṛtaḥ
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe duryodhanaḥ rājā sodaraiḥ sa anugaiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: King Duryodhana was at the back, surrounded by his brothers and followers,

analyzed: vinda anuvindau āvantyau kāmbojaḥ ca śakaiḥ saha
translated: Vinda and Anuvinda from Avanti, and the Kambojas with the Shakas,

analyzed: puccham āsan mahā rāja śūrasenāḥ ca sarvaśas

analyzed: māgadhāḥ ca kaliṅgāḥ ca dāśeraka gaṇaiḥ saha
translated: The Magadhas, the Kalingas, and the Daserakas,

analyzed: dakṣiṇam pakṣam āsādya sthitāḥ vyūhasya daṃśitāḥ

analyzed: kānanāḥ ca vikuñjāḥ ca muktāḥ tathā

analyzed: vyūḍham dṛṣṭvā tu tat sainyam savyasācī paraṃtapaḥ

original: tāvakānāṃ tu taṃ vyūhaṃ pratyavyūhanta pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: tāvakānām tu tam vyūham pratyavyūhanta pāṇḍavāḥ

analyzed: dakṣiṇam śṛṅgam āsthāya bhīmasenaḥ vyarocata

analyzed: nānā śastra ogha saṃpannaiḥ nānādeśyaiḥ nṛpaiḥ vṛtaḥ

translated: Right after him were Virata and the great warrior Drupada,

analyzed: tad anantaram eva āsīt nīlaḥ nīlāyudhaiḥ saha

translated: And the mighty car-warriors, the sons of Pandu, their bodies mangled with arrows,

translated: And honouring one another, filled with great joy,

analyzed: nadantaḥ vividhān nādān tūrya svana vimiśritān

analyzed: siṃhanādān ca kurvāṇāḥ vimiśrām śaṅkha nisvanaiḥ

analyzed: vinadantaḥ mahātmānaḥ kampayantaḥ ca medinīm

original: yathā hi dṛśyate sarvaṃ daivayogena saṃjaya

analyzed: kena avadhyāḥ mahātmānaḥ pāṇḍu putrāḥ mahā balāḥ

analyzed: kena datta varāḥ tāta kim vā jñānam vidanti te

original: yena kṣayaṃ na gacchanti divi tārāgaṇā iva
analyzed: yena kṣayam na gacchanti divi tārā gaṇāḥ iva

original: punaḥ punar na mṛṣyāmi hataṃ sainyaṃ sma pāṇḍavaiḥ
analyzed: punar punar na mṛṣyāmi hatam sainyam sma pāṇḍavaiḥ

analyzed: mayi eva daṇḍaḥ patati daivāt parama dāruṇaḥ

analyzed: yathā avadhyāḥ pāṇḍu sutāḥ yathā vadhyāḥ ca me sutāḥ

analyzed: na hi pāram prapaśyāmi duḥkhasya asya katham cana

analyzed: samudrasya iva mahataḥ bhujābhyām prataran naraḥ

analyzed: putrāṇām vyasanam manye dhruvam prāptam su dāruṇam

analyzed: ghātayiṣyati me putrān sarvān bhīmaḥ na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: na hi paśyāmi tam vīram yaḥ me rakṣet sutān raṇe

analyzed: dhruvam vināśaḥ samare putrāṇām mama saṃjaya

analyzed: tasmāt me kāraṇam sūta yuktim ca eva viśeṣataḥ

analyzed: pṛcchataḥ dya yathātattvam sarvam ākhyātum arhasi
translated: You should tell me everything truthfully as I ask now.

original: duryodhano 'pi yac cakre dṛṣṭvā svān vimukhān raṇe
analyzed: duryodhanaḥ pi yat cakre dṛṣṭvā svān vimukhān raṇe

analyzed: bhīṣma droṇau kṛpaḥ ca eva saubaleyaḥ jayadrathaḥ

analyzed: drauṇiḥ vā api mahā iṣvāsaḥ vikarṇaḥ vā mahā balaḥ

analyzed: niścayaḥ vā api kaḥ teṣām tadā hi āsīt mahātmanām

analyzed: vimukheṣu mahā prājña mama putreṣu saṃjaya

analyzed: yat vṛttam tatra saṃgrāme tat bhavān vaktum arhati

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca

analyzed: śṛṇu rājan avahitaḥ śrutvā ca eva avadhāraya

original: naiva mantrakṛtaṃ kiṃ cin naiva māyāṃ tathāvidhām
analyzed: na eva mantra kṛtam kim cit na eva māyām tathāvidhām

analyzed: su bahūni nṛśaṃsāni putraiḥ tava janeśvara

translated: For that sinful act which was constantly being done,

translated: O king, though being warded off by your well-wishers,

translated: by Vidura, by Bhishma, and by the great-souled Drona,

analyzed: tathā mayā ca api asakṛt vāryamāṇaḥ na gṛhṇasi
translated: and also by me, you do not accept

analyzed: duryodhanena saṃpṛṣṭaḥ etam artham pitāmahaḥ
translated: When this matter was asked by Duryodhana, the grandfather,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā bhrātṝn raṇe sarvān nirjitān su mahā rathān

analyzed: pitāmaham mahā prājñam vinayena upagamya ha

analyzed: tvam ca droṇaḥ ca śalyaḥ ca kṛpaḥ drauṇiḥ tathā eva ca

analyzed: kṛtavarmā ca hārdikyaḥ kāmbojaḥ ca sudakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Kritavarma the son of Hridika, and Sudakshina the ruler of the Kambojas,

analyzed: bhūriśravāḥ vikarṇaḥ ca bhagadattaḥ ca vīryavān

analyzed: trayāṇām api lokānām paryāptāḥ iti me matiḥ

analyzed: pāṇḍavānām samastāḥ ca na tiṣṭhanti parākrame

analyzed: tatra me saṃśayaḥ jātaḥ tat mama ācakṣva pṛcchataḥ

analyzed: yam samāśritya kaunteyāḥ jayanti asmān pade pade

translated: Bhishma said:

analyzed: śṛṇu rājan vacaḥ mahyam yat tvām vakṣyāmi kaurava

analyzed: kriyatām pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdham śamaḥ bharata sattama
translated: Make peace with the Pandavas, O best of the Bharata race.

original: etat kṣamam ahaṃ manye pṛthivyās tava cābhibho
analyzed: etat kṣamam aham manye pṛthivyāḥ tava ca abhibho

analyzed: bhuñja imām pṛthivīm rājan bhrātṛbhiḥ sahitaḥ sukhī

analyzed: durhṛdaḥ tāpayan sarvān nandayan ca api bāndhavān

original: na ca me krośatas tāta śrutavān asi vai purā
analyzed: na ca me krośataḥ tāta śrutavān asi vai purā
translated: But, O son, you did not listen to me when I spoke before.

original: tad idaṃ samanuprāptaṃ yat pāṇḍūn avamanyase
analyzed: tat idam samanuprāptam yat pāṇḍūn avamanyase
translated: Now that has come to pass, that you despise the Pandus.

original: yaś ca hetur avadhyatve teṣām akliṣṭakarmaṇām
analyzed: yaḥ ca hetuḥ avadhya tve teṣām akliṣṭa karmaṇām
translated: And the reason why those of unblemished deeds cannot be killed,

original: taṃ śṛṇuṣva mahārāja mama kīrtayataḥ prabho

translated: Wearing a crown and Kaustubha jewel, he is the one who grants fearlessness to friends.

analyzed: avajānan mahātmānam ghore tamasi majjati
translated: Disrespecting that great soul, one sinks into terrible darkness.

analyzed: evam viditvā tattva artham lokānām īśvara īśvaraḥ
translated: Knowing this truth in this way, the lord of the lords of the worlds,

analyzed: vāsudevaḥ namaskāryaḥ sarva lokaiḥ sura uttamāḥ
translated: Vasudeva, should be worshipped by all the people, O best of the gods.

original: evam uktvā sa bhagavān sarvān devagaṇān purā
analyzed: evam uktvā sa bhagavān sarvān deva gaṇān purā
translated: Having spoken thus to all the hosts of gods in the past,

analyzed: visṛjya sarva loka ātmā jagāma bhavanam svakam
translated: the lord of all worlds dismissed them and went to his own abode.

analyzed: tatas devāḥ sa gandharvāḥ munayaḥ psarasaḥ pi ca
translated: Then the gods, along with the gandharvas, sages and apsaras,

original: kathāṃ tāṃ brahmaṇā gītāṃ śrutvā prītā divaṃ yayuḥ🔽etac chrutaṃ mayā tāta ṛṣīṇāṃ bhāvitātmanām
analyzed: kathām tām brahmaṇā gītām śrutvā prītāḥ divam yayuḥ  etat śrutam mayā tāta ṛṣīṇām bhāvitātmanām
translated: having heard that story sung by Brahma, were delighted and went to heaven.🔽O father, this was heard by me in the past,

analyzed: vāsudevam kathayatām samavāye purātanam
translated: in an assembly of sages of purified souls, who were speaking about Vasudeva.

analyzed: jāmadagnyasya rāmasya mārkaṇḍeyasya dhīmataḥ
translated: It was heard from Jamadagni's son Rama, the wise Markandeya,

analyzed: vyāsa nāradayoḥ ca api śrutam śruta viśārada
translated: and also from Vyasa and Narada, who are skilled in learning.

original: etam arthaṃ ca vijñāya śrutvā ca prabhum avyayam
analyzed: etam artham ca vijñāya śrutvā ca prabhum avyayam
translated: Having understood this meaning and heard about the imperishable lord,

analyzed: vāsudevam mahātmānam lokānām īśvara īśvaram
translated: the great-souled Vasudeva, the lord of the lords of the worlds,

original: yasyāsāv ātmajo brahmā sarvasya jagataḥ pitā
analyzed: yasya asau ātmajaḥ brahmā sarvasya jagataḥ pitā
translated: Whose son is Brahma, the father of the entire universe,

original: kathaṃ na vāsudevo 'yam arcyaś cejyaś ca mānavaiḥ
analyzed: katham na vāsudevaḥ yam arcyaḥ ca ijyaḥ ca mānavaiḥ
translated: How is this Vasudeva not to be worshipped and revered by men?

analyzed: vāritaḥ si purā tāta munibhiḥ vedapāragaiḥ
translated: You were formerly restrained by the sages who have mastered the Vedas,

original: mā gaccha saṃyugaṃ tena vāsudevena dhīmatā
analyzed: mā gaccha saṃyugam tena vāsudevena dhīmatā
translated: Not to engage in battle with that wise Vasudeva,

original: mā pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdham iti tac ca mohān na budhyase
analyzed: mā pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdham iti tat ca mohāt na budhyase
translated: And not to have an alliance with the Pandavas, but you did not understand that due to delusion.

original: manye tvāṃ rākṣasaṃ krūraṃ tathā cāsi tamovṛtaḥ
analyzed: manye tvām rākṣasam krūram tathā ca asi tamaḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: I consider you to be a cruel demon, and so you are, enveloped in darkness,

original: yasmād dviṣasi govindaṃ pāṇḍavaṃ ca dhanaṃjayam
analyzed: yasmāt dviṣasi govindam pāṇḍavam ca dhanaṃjayam
translated: Since you hate Govinda and the Pandava Dhananjaya,

original: naranārāyaṇau devau nānyo dviṣyād dhi mānavaḥ
analyzed: nara nārāyaṇau devau na anyaḥ dviṣyāt hi mānavaḥ
translated: No other man should hate the gods Nara and Narayana.

original: tasmād bravīmi te rājann eṣa vai śāśvato 'vyayaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt bravīmi te rājan eṣa vai śāśvataḥ vyayaḥ
translated: Therefore, O king, I say to you, he is eternal and unchanging,

original: sarvalokamayo nityaḥ śāstā dhātā dharo dhruvaḥ
analyzed: sarva loka mayaḥ nityaḥ śāstā dhātā dharaḥ dhruvaḥ
translated: Composed of all the worlds, always the ruler, the creator, the supporter, the firm one.

original: lokān dhārayate yas trīṃś carācaraguruḥ prabhuḥ
analyzed: lokān dhārayate yaḥ trīn carācara guruḥ prabhuḥ
translated: He who supports the three worlds, the preceptor of the moving and unmoving, the lord,

original: yoddhā jayaś ca jetā ca sarvaprakṛtir īśvaraḥ
analyzed: yoddhā jayaḥ ca jetā ca sarva prakṛtiḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: The warrior, the victory, the conqueror, the origin of all, the lord,

analyzed: rājan sattva mayaḥ hi eṣa tamaḥ rāga vivarjitaḥ
translated: O king, he is full of goodness, devoid of passion and darkness,

original: yataḥ kṛṣṇas tato dharmo yato dharmas tato jayaḥ
analyzed: yatas kṛṣṇaḥ tatas dharmaḥ yatas dharmaḥ tatas jayaḥ
translated: Where there is Krishna, there is Dharma, where there is Dharma, there is victory.

analyzed: tasya māhātmya yogena yogena ātmanaḥ eva ca
translated: By the yoga of his greatness and by the yoga of his own self,

original: dhṛtāḥ pāṇḍusutā rājañ jayaś caiṣāṃ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: dhṛtāḥ pāṇḍu sutāḥ rājam jayaḥ ca eṣām bhaviṣyati
translated: O king, the sons of Pandu are upheld by him, and victory will be theirs.

original: śreyoyuktāṃ sadā buddhiṃ pāṇḍavānāṃ dadhāti yaḥ
analyzed: śreyaḥ yuktām sadā buddhim pāṇḍavānām dadhāti yaḥ
translated: He who always bestows wisdom connected with what is beneficial to the Pandavas,

original: balaṃ caiva raṇe nityaṃ bhayebhyaś caiva rakṣati
analyzed: balam ca eva raṇe nityam bhayebhyaḥ ca eva rakṣati
translated: And who always provides strength in battle and protects from dangers,

original: sa eṣa śāśvato devaḥ sarvaguhyamayaḥ śivaḥ
analyzed: saḥ eṣa śāśvataḥ devaḥ sarva guhya mayaḥ śivaḥ
translated: He is the eternal god, the auspicious one full of all secrets,

original: vāsudeva iti jñeyo yan māṃ pṛcchasi bhārata
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ iti jñeyaḥ yat mām pṛcchasi bhārata
translated: To be known as Vasudeva, O descendant of Bharata, about whom you ask me.

original: brāhmaṇaiḥ kṣatriyair vaiśyaiḥ śūdraiś ca kṛtalakṣaṇaiḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ vaiśyaiḥ śūdraiḥ ca kṛta lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: He is served and worshipped by Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras who have attained their characteristics,

analyzed: sevyate bhyarcyate ca eva nitya yuktaiḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: By those who are always devoted to their own duties.

analyzed: dvāparasya yugasya ante ādau kali yugasya ca
translated: At the end of the Dvapara age and the beginning of the Kali age,

original: sātvataṃ vidhim āsthāya gītaḥ saṃkarṣaṇena yaḥ
analyzed: sātvatam vidhim āsthāya gītaḥ saṃkarṣaṇena yaḥ
translated: The one who was sung by Samkarshana, following the Satvata method,

analyzed: saḥ eṣa sarva asura martya lokam
translated: He, the one who created the entire world of gods and demons,

analyzed: samudra kakṣyā antaritāḥ purīḥ ca
translated: The cities surrounded by the ocean's shores,

original: yuge yuge mānuṣaṃ caiva vāsaṃ /🔽punaḥ punaḥ sṛjate vāsudevaḥ🔽duryodhana uvāca
analyzed: yuge yuge mānuṣam ca eva vāsam  punar punar sṛjate vāsudevaḥ  duryodhanaḥ uvāca
translated: And human abodes again and again in every age,

original: vāsudevo mahad bhūtaṃ sarvalokeṣu kathyate🔽tasyāgamaṃ pratiṣṭhāṃ ca jñātum icche pitāmaha🔽bhīṣma uvāca
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ mahat bhūtam sarva lokeṣu kathyate 🔽tasya āgamam pratiṣṭhām ca jñātum icche pitāmaha 🔽bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Is Vasudeva, the creator of the universe.

original: vāsudevo mahad bhūtaṃ saṃbhūtaṃ saha daivataiḥ
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ mahat bhūtam saṃbhūtam saha daivataiḥ
translated: Vasudeva is a great being, born with the gods.

analyzed: na param puṇḍarīkākṣāt dṛśyate bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, none is seen superior to Pundarikaksha (Krishna).

original: śrutaṃ me tāta rāmasya jāmadagnyasya jalpataḥ
analyzed: śrutam me tāta rāmasya jāmadagnyasya jalpataḥ
translated: O father, I have heard Rama, the son of Jamadagni,

analyzed: nāradasya ca deva ṛṣeḥ kṛṣṇadvaipāyanasya ca
translated: the celestial sage Narada, Krishna Dvaipayana,

analyzed: asitaḥ devalaḥ ca api vālakhilyāḥ tapodhanāḥ
translated: Asita, Devala, the Valakhilyas, the ascetics,

original: mārkaṇḍeyaś ca govindaṃ kathayaty adbhutaṃ mahat
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ ca govindam kathayati adbhutam mahat
translated: and Markandeya speak of Govinda's wonderful greatness.

analyzed: sarva bhūtāni bhūtātmā mahātmā puruṣottamaḥ
translated: The great soul, the supreme being, the soul of all beings,

original: āpo vāyuś ca tejaś ca trayam etad akalpayat
analyzed: āpaḥ vāyuḥ ca tejaḥ ca trayam etat akalpayat
translated: created the three - water, air, and fire.

original: sa sṛṣṭvā pṛthivīṃ devaḥ sarvalokeśvaraḥ prabhuḥ
analyzed: sa sṛṣṭvā pṛthivīm devaḥ sarva loka īśvaraḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Having created the earth, the god, the lord of all worlds,

original: apsu vai śayanaṃ cakre mahātmā puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: apsu vai śayanam cakre mahātmā puruṣottamaḥ
translated: the great soul, the supreme being, lay down in the waters.

original: sarvatoyamayo devo yogāt suṣvāpa tatra ha
analyzed: sarva toya mayaḥ devaḥ yogāt suṣvāpa tatra ha
translated: The god, full of all waters, slept there through yoga.

original: mukhataḥ so 'gnim asṛjat prāṇād vāyum athāpi ca
analyzed: mukhataḥ saḥ gnim asṛjat prāṇāt vāyum atha api ca
translated: From his mouth, he created fire, from his breath, air,

original: sarasvatīṃ ca vedāṃś ca manasaḥ sasṛje 'cyutaḥ
analyzed: sarasvatīm ca vedān ca manasaḥ sasṛje cyutaḥ
translated: and from his mind, Achyuta created Sarasvati and the Vedas.

original: eṣa lokān sasarjādau devāṃś carṣigaṇaiḥ saha
analyzed: eṣa lokān sasarja ādau devān ca ṛṣi gaṇaiḥ saha
translated: He created the worlds in the beginning, the gods along with the groups of sages,

original: nidhanaṃ caiva mṛtyuṃ ca prajānāṃ prabhavo 'vyayaḥ
analyzed: nidhanam ca eva mṛtyum ca prajānām prabhavaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: and also death, the end of beings, the imperishable source of beings.

original: eṣa dharmaś ca dharmajño varadaḥ sarvakāmadaḥ🔽eṣa kartā ca kāryaṃ ca pūrvadevaḥ svayaṃprabhuḥ
analyzed: eṣa dharmaḥ ca dharma jñaḥ vara daḥ sarva kāma daḥ  eṣa kartā ca kāryam ca pūrvadevaḥ svayaṃprabhuḥ
translated: He is Dharma, the knower of Dharma, the granter of boons, the fulfiller of all desires.🔽He is the creator and the created, the primordial god, the self-existent lord.

original: bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ bhaviṣyac ca pūrvam etad akalpayat
analyzed: bhūtam bhavyam bhaviṣyat ca pūrvam etat akalpayat
translated: He ordained the past, the present, and the future.

original: ubhe saṃdhye diśaḥ khaṃ ca niyamaṃ ca janārdanaḥ
analyzed: ubhe saṃdhye diśaḥ kham ca niyamam ca janārdanaḥ
translated: Janardana ordained the two twilights, the directions, the sky, and the rules.

original: ṛṣīṃś caiva hi govindas tapaś caivānu kalpayat
analyzed: ṛṣīn ca eva hi govindaḥ tapaḥ ca eva anu kalpayat
translated: Govinda also ordained the sages and austerities.

original: sraṣṭāraṃ jagataś cāpi mahātmā prabhur avyayaḥ
analyzed: sraṣṭāram jagataḥ ca api mahātmā prabhuḥ avyayaḥ
translated: The great-souled, imperishable lord, the creator of the world,

analyzed: agra jam sarva bhūtānām saṃkarṣaṇam akalpayat
translated: ordained Samkarshana, the elder brother of all beings.

analyzed: tasmāt nārāyaṇaḥ jajñe devadevaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: Therefore, Narayana, the eternal god of gods, was born.

analyzed: nābhau padmam babhūva asya sarva lokasya saṃbhavaḥ
translated: A lotus appeared on his navel, the origin of all worlds.

original: tasmāt pitāmaho jātas tasmāj jātās tv imāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: tasmāt pitāmahaḥ jātaḥ tasmāt jātāḥ tu imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: From that, the grandfather was born, and from him, these beings were born.

original: śeṣaṃ cākalpayad devam anantam iti yaṃ viduḥ
analyzed: śeṣam ca akalpayat devam anantam iti yam viduḥ
translated: The god who is known as Ananta, the infinite one, was also ordained.

original: yo dhārayati bhūtāni dharāṃ cemāṃ saparvatām
analyzed: yaḥ dhārayati bhūtāni dharām ca imām sa parvatām
translated: He who supports the beings and this earth with its mountains,

original: dhyānayogena viprāś ca taṃ vadanti mahaujasam
analyzed: dhyāna yogena viprāḥ ca tam vadanti mahā ojasam
translated: the brahmins speak of him as having great energy through the yoga of meditation.

analyzed: karṇa srota udbhavam ca api madhum nāma mahā asuram
translated: And the great demon named Madhu, born from the cavity of his ear,

original: tam ugram ugrakarmāṇam ugrāṃ buddhiṃ samāsthitam
analyzed: tam ugram ugra karmāṇam ugrām buddhim samāsthitam
translated: He was fierce, of fierce deeds, and had resorted to fierce intelligence.

original: harantaṃ brahmaṇo vedāñ jaghāna brahmaṇaḥ pitā
analyzed: harantam brahmaṇaḥ vedām jaghāna brahmaṇaḥ pitā
translated: The father of Brahma killed him, who was carrying away the Vedas of Brahma.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ upacitim jaghāna puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Performing the funeral rites of Brahma, the best of men killed him.

analyzed: tasya tāta vadhāt eva deva dānava mānavāḥ
translated: O son, because of his killing him, the gods, demons and men

original: madhusūdanam ity āhur ṛṣayaś ca janārdanam
analyzed: madhusūdanam iti āhuḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca janārdanam
translated: call Madhusudana, Janardana, the Rishis

original: varāhaś caiva siṃhaś ca trivikramagatiḥ prabhuḥ
analyzed: varāhaḥ ca eva siṃhaḥ ca trivikrama gatiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: and the lord who has the form of a boar and a lion, Trivikrama.

original: eṣa mātā pitā caiva sarveṣāṃ prāṇināṃ hariḥ
analyzed: eṣa mātā pitā ca eva sarveṣām prāṇinām hariḥ
translated: Hari is the mother and father of all living beings.

original: paraṃ hi puṇḍarīkākṣān na bhūtaṃ na bhaviṣyati
analyzed: param hi puṇḍarīkākṣāt na bhūtam na bhaviṣyati
translated: For there has never been nor will there be anyone greater than the lotus-eyed one.

analyzed: mukhataḥ sṛjat brāhmaṇān bāhubhyām kṣatriyān tathā
translated: From his mouth he created the Brahmanas, from his arms the Kshatriyas,

original: vaiśyāṃś cāpy ūruto rājañ śūdrān padbhyāṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: vaiśyān ca api ūrutaḥ rājam śūdrān padbhyām tathā eva ca
translated: and from his thighs the Vaishyas, O king, and from his feet the Shudras.

original: tapasā niyato devo nidhānaṃ sarvadehinām🔽brahmabhūtam amāvāsyāṃ paurṇamāsyāṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: tapasā niyataḥ devaḥ nidhānam sarva dehinām  brahma bhūtam amāvāsyām paurṇamāsyām tathā eva ca
translated: The god, restrained by austerities, is the refuge of all embodied beings.🔽On the new moon day and on the full moon day, one should serve Keshava, who is Brahman,

analyzed: yoga bhūtam paricaran keśavam mahat āpnuyāt
translated: and who is Yoga, and one will attain greatness.

analyzed: keśavaḥ paramam tejaḥ sarva loka pitāmahaḥ
translated: Keshava is the supreme splendor, the grandfather of all the worlds.

original: evam āhur hṛṣīkeśaṃ munayo vai narādhipa
analyzed: evam āhuḥ hṛṣīkeśam munayaḥ vai narādhipa
translated: Thus, O lord of men, the sages call him Hrishikesha.

original: evam enaṃ vijānīhi ācāryaṃ pitaraṃ gurum
analyzed: evam enam vijānīhi ācāryam pitaram gurum
translated: Know him thus as the teacher, the father, the guru.

original: kṛṣṇo yasya prasīdeta lokās tenākṣayā jitāḥ
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ yasya prasīdeta lokāḥ tena akṣayāḥ jitāḥ
translated: For one in whom Krishna is pleased, he has conquered the imperishable worlds.

original: yaś caivainaṃ bhayasthāne keśavaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajet
analyzed: yaḥ ca eva enam bhaya sthāne keśavam śaraṇam vrajet
translated: And one who would go to Keshava for refuge in a place of fear,

original: sadā naraḥ paṭhaṃś cedaṃ svastimān sa sukhī bhavet
analyzed: sadā naraḥ paṭhan ca idam svastimān sa sukhī bhavet
translated: and if a man always recites this, he would be prosperous and happy.

original: ye ca kṛṣṇaṃ prapadyante te na muhyanti mānavāḥ
analyzed: ye ca kṛṣṇam prapadyante te na muhyanti mānavāḥ
translated: And those who resort to Krishna, those men are not deluded.

original: bhaye mahati ye magnāḥ pāti nityaṃ janārdanaḥ
analyzed: bhaye mahati ye magnāḥ pāti nityam janārdanaḥ
translated: Janardana always protects those who are immersed in great fear.

analyzed: etat yudhiṣṭhiraḥ jñātvā yāthātathyena bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, Yudhishthira knew this as it truly is,

analyzed: sarva ātmanā mahātmānam keśavam jagat īśvaram
translated: and with his whole being he resorted to the great-souled Keshava, the lord of the world,

original: prapannaḥ śaraṇaṃ rājan yogānām īśvaraṃ prabhum
analyzed: prapannaḥ śaraṇam rājan yogānām īśvaram prabhum
translated: the lord of yoga, the powerful one, O king.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

analyzed: śṛṇu ca idam mahā rāja brahma bhūta stavam mama
translated: Listen to this hymn of mine to Brahma, O great king,

original: brahmarṣibhiś ca devaiś ca yaḥ purā kathito bhuvi
analyzed: brahmarṣibhiḥ ca devaiḥ ca yaḥ purā kathitaḥ bhuvi
translated: which was told in ancient times on earth by the brahman sages and the gods.

original: sādhyānām api devānāṃ devadeveśvaraḥ prabhuḥ🔽lokabhāvanabhāvajña iti tvāṃ nārado 'bravīt
analyzed: sādhyānām api devānām devadeva īśvaraḥ prabhuḥ  loka bhāvana bhāva jñaḥ iti tvām nāradaḥ bravīt
translated: The lord, the god of gods, the powerful one of even the Sadhya gods,🔽Narada has said that you know the nature of the creation of the world.

original: bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ bhaviṣyaṃ ca mārkaṇḍeyo 'bhyuvāca ha
analyzed: bhūtam bhavyam bhaviṣyam ca mārkaṇḍeyaḥ bhyuvāca ha
translated: Markandeya has said that you are the past, the present and the future.

original: yajñānāṃ caiva yajñaṃ tvāṃ tapaś ca tapasām api
analyzed: yajñānām ca eva yajñam tvām tapaḥ ca tapasām api
translated: You are the sacrifice among sacrifices, and austerity among austerities,

original: devānām api devaṃ ca tvām āha bhagavān bhṛguḥ
analyzed: devānām api devam ca tvām āha bhagavān bhṛguḥ
translated: And you are the god among gods, so says the illustrious Bhrigu.

original: purāṇe bhairavaṃ rūpaṃ viṣṇo bhūtapateti vai
analyzed: purāṇe bhairavam rūpam viṣṇo bhūtapate iti vai
translated: In the Puranas, the fearful form of Vishnu, the lord of beings,

original: vāsudevo vasūnāṃ tvaṃ śakraṃ sthāpayitā tathā
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ vasūnām tvam śakram sthāpayitā tathā
translated: You are Vasudeva among the Vasus, and the establisher of Shakra,

analyzed: deva devaḥ si devānām iti dvaipāyanaḥ bravīt
translated: And you are the god of gods among the gods, so says Dvaipayana.

analyzed: pūrve prajā nisargeṣu dakṣam āhuḥ prajāpatim
translated: In the creation of beings in the past, Daksha is said to be the lord of beings,

analyzed: sraṣṭāram sarva bhūtānām aṅgirāḥ tvām tatas bravīt
translated: The creator of all beings, and Angiras then spoke of you,

original: avyaktaṃ te śarīrotthaṃ vyaktaṃ te manasi sthitam
analyzed: avyaktam te śarīra uttham vyaktam te manasi sthitam
translated: Your unmanifest form arises from the body, and your manifest form is established in the mind,

original: devā vāksaṃbhavāś ceti devalas tv asito 'bravīt
analyzed: devāḥ vāc saṃbhavāḥ ca iti devalaḥ tu asitaḥ bravīt
translated: And the gods are born from speech, so said Devala Asita.

original: śirasā te divaṃ vyāptaṃ bāhubhyāṃ pṛthivī dhṛtā
analyzed: śirasā te divam vyāptam bāhubhyām pṛthivī dhṛtā

translated: Dhritarashtra said:

analyzed: vyūḍham evam yathāśāstram amogham ca eva saṃjaya

analyzed: aparokṣam ca vidyāsu vyāyāmeṣu kṛta śramam

analyzed: śastra grahaṇa vidyāsu sarvāsu pariniṣṭhitam  ārohe paryavaskande saraṇe sa antaraplute

analyzed: samyak praharaṇe yāne vyapayāne ca kovidam
translated: Properly striking, riding, and retreating,

analyzed: nāga aśva ratha yāneṣu bahuśas su parīkṣitam
translated: Well-tested many times in elephant, horse, and chariot riding,

analyzed: parīkṣya ca yathānyāyam vetanena upapāditam
translated: And having been properly examined, he was employed with wages,

analyzed: apāram iva garjantam sāgara pratimam mahat

analyzed: guptam pravīraiḥ lokasya sāravadbhiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: It was protected by the best heroes in the world, by great souls who were the essence of the world.

original: yad ahanyata saṃgrāme diṣṭam etat purātanam

analyzed: na etādṛśam samudyogam dṛṣṭavantaḥ mānuṣāḥ

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ hi bala oghaḥ tu yuktaḥ śastra astra saṃpadā

analyzed: viparītam idam sarvam pratibhāti sma saṃjaya

analyzed: yatra īdṛśam balam ghoram na atarat yudhi pāṇḍavān

analyzed: atha vā pāṇḍava arthāya devāḥ tatra samāgatāḥ

analyzed: yudhyante māmakam sainyam yat avadhyanta saṃjaya

analyzed: uktaḥ hi vidureṇa iha hitam pathyam ca saṃjaya

analyzed: na ca gṛhṇāti tat mandaḥ putraḥ duryodhanaḥ mama

original: tasya manye matiḥ pūrvaṃ sarvajñasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: tasya manye matiḥ pūrvam sarvajñasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: I think that the great-souled one, who knows all,

analyzed: āsīt yathāgatam tāta yena dṛṣṭam idam purā

analyzed: yat ekaḥ samare rājan bahubhiḥ samayodhayat

translated: When Bhimasena had entered, Dhrishtadyumna, the son of Prishata,

analyzed: viśokaḥ tam uvāca idam dhṛṣṭadyumnam kṛta añjaliḥ
translated: Viśoka, with folded hands, said this to Dhṛṣṭadyumna,

analyzed: saṃsthāpya mām iha balī pāṇḍaveyaḥ pratāpavān

analyzed: yāvat etān nihanmi āśu ye ime mad vadha udyatāḥ

analyzed: abhyadhāvat gadā pāṇiḥ tat balam sa mahā balaḥ
translated: With a club in his hand, the greatly strong one rushed at that army.

translated: Seeing the greatly strong one rushing with a club in his hand,

translated: or because of my misfortune,

analyzed: ekaḥ eva samudyātaḥ paryāptam tat nidarśanam

analyzed: droṇam ca yudhi saṃrabdham mām ca nirjitya saṃyuge

analyzed: nivāta kavacān yuddhe vāsavena api durjayān

analyzed: jitavān samare pārthaḥ paryāptam tat nidarśanam

analyzed: yasya goptā jagat goptā śaṅkha cakra gadā dharaḥ

Vasudeva is of infinite power, the cause of creation and dissolution,
the lord of all, the god of gods, the supreme soul, the eternal one.

analyzed: uktaḥ si bahuśas rājan nārada ādyaiḥ mahā ṛṣibhiḥ

analyzed: yat janāḥ kathayiṣyanti yāvat sthāsyati medinī
translated: People will talk about it as long as the earth remains.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tava sutaḥ nirjagāma janeśvara
translated: Thus addressed, your son departed, O lord of people.

translated: Having come there, the king, the destroyer of enemies, dismissed the great crowd and quickly entered the inner apartments.

analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ sa niśām tām ca gamayām āsa pārthivaḥ

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: prabhātāyām tu śarvaryām prātar utthāya vai nṛpaḥ
translated: When the night dawned, the king rose in the morning

analyzed: rājñaḥ samājñāpayata senām yojayata iti ha
translated: and ordered the king's men, Prepare the army.

original: adya bhīṣmo raṇe kruddho nihaniṣyati somakān
analyzed: adya bhīṣmaḥ raṇe kruddhaḥ nihaniṣyati somakān
translated: Today the enraged Bhishma will slay the Somakas in battle.

original: duryodhanasya tac chrutvā rātrau vilapitaṃ bahu
analyzed: duryodhanasya tat śrutvā rātrau vilapitam bahu
translated: Having heard that much lamentation of Duryodhana at night,

analyzed: manyamānaḥ sa tam rājan pratyādeśam iva ātmanaḥ
translated: considering it to be a warning to himself, O king,🔽Bhishma, the son of Shantanu,

analyzed: nirvedam paramam gatvā vinindya paravācya tām
translated: Having become extremely dejected and censured his own speech,

original: dīrghaṃ dadhyau śāṃtanavo yoddhukāmo 'rjunaṃ raṇe🔽iṅgitena tu taj jñātvā gāṅgeyena vicintitam
analyzed: dīrgham dadhyau śāṃtanavaḥ yoddhu kāmaḥ rjunam raṇe  iṅgitena tu tat jñātvā gāṅgeyena vicintitam
translated: Shantanu's son meditated for a long time, desiring to fight with Arjuna in battle.🔽But Duryodhana, the great king, understood through gestures what Bhishma was thinking,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ mahā rāja duḥśāsanam acodayat
translated: and urged Duhshasana, saying:

analyzed: duḥśāsana rathāḥ tūrṇam yujyantām bhīṣma rakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Duhshasana, let chariots be quickly yoked to protect Bhishma.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat tvam anīkāni sarvāṇi eva abhicodaya
translated: You urge all the thirty-two divisions.

analyzed: idam hi samanuprāptam varṣa pūga abhicintitam
translated: This has now arrived, what was thought of for many years -

analyzed: pāṇḍavānām sa sainyānām vadhaḥ rājyasya ca āgamaḥ
translated: the destruction of the Pandavas with their soldiers and the acquisition of the kingdom.

analyzed: tatra kāryam aham manye bhīṣmasya eva abhirakṣaṇam
translated: There, I think, the protection of Bhishma alone is our duty.

original: sa no guptaḥ sukhāya syād dhanyāt pārthāṃś ca saṃyuge
analyzed: sa naḥ guptaḥ sukhāya syāt dhanyāt pārthān ca saṃyuge
translated: Protected by him, we will be happy and will defeat the Parthas in battle.

original: abravīc ca viśuddhātmā nāhaṃ hanyāṃ śikhaṇḍinam
analyzed: abravīt ca viśuddha ātmā na aham hanyām śikhaṇḍinam
translated: And the pure-souled one said: I will not kill Shikhandi,

original: strīpūrvako hy asau jātas tasmād varjyo raṇe mayā
analyzed: strī pūrvakaḥ hi asau jātaḥ tasmāt varjyaḥ raṇe mayā
translated: for he was born as a woman first, therefore he is to be avoided by me in battle.

original: lokas tad veda yad ahaṃ pituḥ priyacikīrṣayā
analyzed: lokaḥ tat veda yat aham pituḥ priya cikīrṣayā
translated: The world knows that I, desiring to do what is pleasing to my father,

original: rājyaṃ sphītaṃ mahābāho striyaś ca tyaktavān purā
analyzed: rājyam sphītam mahā bāho striyaḥ ca tyaktavān purā
translated: in the past gave up a prosperous kingdom and women, O mighty-armed one.

original: naiva cāhaṃ striyaṃ jātu na strīpūrvaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na eva ca aham striyam jātu na strī pūrvam katham cana
translated: I have never been a woman, nor have I been a man who has previously been a woman.

original: hanyāṃ yudhi naraśreṣṭha satyam etad bravīmi te
analyzed: hanyām yudhi nara śreṣṭha satyam etat bravīmi te
translated: I will never kill a woman, nor one who was a woman, in battle, O best of men. I tell you this truthfully.

original: ayaṃ strīpūrvako rājañ śikhaṇḍī yadi te śrutaḥ
analyzed: ayam strī pūrvakaḥ rājam śikhaṇḍī yadi te śrutaḥ
translated: If you have heard of this Shikhandi, O king, who was a woman before,

original: udyoge kathitaṃ yat tat tathā jātā śikhaṇḍinī
analyzed: udyoge kathitam yat tat tathā jātā śikhaṇḍinī
translated: it was told at the time of the preparations that she became a woman.

original: kanyā bhūtvā pumāñ jātaḥ sa ca yotsyati bhārata
analyzed: kanyā bhūtvā pumān jātaḥ sa ca yotsyati bhārata
translated: Having been a girl, he was born a man, and will fight, O Bharata.

original: tasyāhaṃ pramukhe bāṇān na muñceyaṃ kathaṃ cana🔽yuddhe tu kṣatriyāṃs tāta pāṇḍavānāṃ jayaiṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tasya aham pramukhe bāṇān na muñceyam katham cana  yuddhe tu kṣatriyān tāta pāṇḍavānām jaya eṣiṇaḥ
translated: I will never shoot arrows at him.🔽But in battle, O son, I will kill all the other Kshatriyas of the Pandavas who desire victory,

analyzed: sarvān anyān haniṣyāmi saṃprāptān bāṇa gocarān
translated: all those who come within range of my arrows.

original: evaṃ māṃ bharataśreṣṭho gāṅgeyaḥ prāha śāstravit
analyzed: evam mām bharata śreṣṭhaḥ gāṅgeyaḥ prāha śāstra vid
translated: Thus did Gangeya, the best of the Bharatas, who knows the scriptures, speak to me.

analyzed: tatra sarva ātmanā manye bhīṣmasya eva abhipālanam
translated: There, I think, we should protect Bhishma with all our soul.

original: arakṣyamāṇaṃ hi vṛko hanyāt siṃhaṃ mahāvane🔽mā vṛkeṇeva śārdūlaṃ ghātayema śikhaṇḍinā
analyzed: a rakṣyamāṇam hi vṛkaḥ hanyāt siṃham mahā vane  mā vṛkeṇa iva śārdūlam ghātayema śikhaṇḍinā
translated: For a wolf can kill a lion in the great forest if it is unprotected.🔽Do not let us have Bhishma killed by Shikhandi like a wolf killing a tiger.

original: nirmanuṣyān rathān rājan gajān aśvāṃś ca saṃyuge
analyzed: nirmanuṣyān rathān rājan gajān aśvān ca saṃyuge
translated: He made the chariots, elephants and horses in the battle devoid of men, O king.

analyzed: akarot sa mahā bāhuḥ sarva śastrabhṛtām varaḥ
translated: That mighty-armed one, the best among all wielders of weapons, did this.

original: tasya jyātalanirghoṣaṃ visphūrjitam ivāśaneḥ🔽niśamya sarvabhūtāni samakampanta bhārata
analyzed: tasya jyā tala nirghoṣam visphūrjitam iva aśaneḥ  niśamya sarva bhūtāni samakampanta bhārata
translated: Hearing the twang of his bowstring, which was like the roaring of thunder,🔽all beings trembled, O descendant of Bharata.

original: amoghā hy apatan bāṇāḥ pitus te bharatarṣabha
analyzed: amoghāḥ hi apatan bāṇāḥ pituḥ te bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, the arrows shot from your father's bow never missed their mark.

original: nāsajjanta tanutreṣu bhīṣmacāpacyutāḥ śarāḥ🔽hatavīrān rathān rājan saṃyuktāñ javanair hayaiḥ
analyzed: na asajjanta tanutreṣu bhīṣma cāpa cyutāḥ śarāḥ  hata vīrān rathān rājan saṃyuktām javanaiḥ hayaiḥ
translated: The arrows released from Bhishma's bow did not get stuck in the armor.🔽O king, we saw chariots with their heroes slain, yoked to swift horses,

analyzed: apaśyāma mahā rāja hriyamāṇān raṇa ajire
translated: being carried away on the field of battle, O great king.

analyzed: matsya pāñcāla kaikeyān pātayām āsa saṃyuge
translated: He brought down the Matsyas, Panchalas and Kaikeyas in the battle.

analyzed: cedi kāśi karūṣāṇām sahasrāṇi caturdaśa
translated: Fourteen thousand Chedis, Kashis and Karushas

analyzed: mahā rathāḥ samākhyātāḥ kula putrāḥ tanutyajaḥ
translated: were declared to be great warriors, born in noble families and ready to give up their lives.

analyzed: aparāvartinaḥ sarve suvarṇa vikṛta dhvajāḥ
translated: All of them did not retreat and their standards were decorated with gold.

original: saṃgrāme bhīṣmam āsādya vyāditāsyam ivāntakam🔽nimagnāḥ paralokāya savājirathakuñjarāḥ
analyzed: saṃgrāme bhīṣmam āsādya vyādita āsyam iva antakam  nimagnāḥ para lokāya sa vāji ratha kuñjarāḥ
translated: Encountering Bhishma in battle, who was like Death with a gaping mouth,🔽They were submerged, along with their horses, chariots and elephants, for the sake of the next world.

original: bhagnākṣopaskarān kāṃś cid bhagnacakrāṃś ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: bhagna akṣa upaskarān kān cit bhagna cakrān ca sarvaśas
translated: We saw chariots with their axles and yoking poles broken, their wheels shattered in every way,

analyzed: apaśyāma rathān rājam sahasraśas
translated: By hundreds and thousands, O king.

original: savarūthai rathair bhagnai rathibhiś ca nipātitaiḥ🔽śaraiḥ sukavacaiś chinnaiḥ paṭṭiśaiś ca viśāṃ pate
analyzed: sa varūthaiḥ rathaiḥ bhagnaiḥ rathibhiḥ ca nipātitaiḥ  śaraiḥ su kavacaiḥ chinnaiḥ paṭṭiśaiḥ ca viśām pate
translated: With shattered chariots along with their guards, with charioteers slain,🔽With well-armored arrows cut off, with axes, O lord of the people,

original: gadābhir musalaiś caiva nistriṃśaiś ca śilīmukhaiḥ🔽anukarṣair upāsaṅgaiś cakrair bhagnaiś ca māriṣa🔽bāhubhiḥ kārmukaiḥ khaḍgaiḥ śirobhiś ca sakuṇḍalaiḥ
analyzed: gadābhiḥ musalaiḥ ca eva nistriṃśaiḥ ca śilīmukhaiḥ  anukarṣaiḥ upāsaṅgaiḥ cakraiḥ bhagnaiḥ ca māriṣa  bāhubhiḥ kārmukaiḥ khaḍgaiḥ śirobhiḥ ca sa kuṇḍalaiḥ
translated: With maces, clubs, swords, and arrows,🔽With yoking poles, upasargas, and shattered wheels, my dear friend,🔽With arms, bows, and swords, with heads along with earrings,

original: talatrair aṅgulitraiś ca dhvajaiś ca vinipātitaiḥ
analyzed: talatraiḥ aṅgulitraiḥ ca dhvajaiḥ ca vinipātitaiḥ
translated: With arm-guards and finger-guards, and with fallen standards,

original: cāpaiś ca bahudhā chinnaiḥ samāstīryata medinī
analyzed: cāpaiḥ ca bahudhā chinnaiḥ samāstīryata medinī
translated: With bows cut in many ways, the earth was strewn.

original: hatārohā gajā rājan hayāś ca hatasādinaḥ
analyzed: hata ārohāḥ gajāḥ rājan hayāḥ ca hata sādinaḥ
translated: Elephants with their riders slain, O king, and horses with their riders slain,

analyzed: paripetuḥ drutam tatra sahasraśas
translated: Ran swiftly there in hundreds and thousands.

original: yatamānāś ca te vīrā dravamāṇān mahārathān
analyzed: yatamānāḥ ca te vīrāḥ dravamāṇān mahā rathān
translated: And those heroes, striving to restrain those fleeing maharathas,

analyzed: na aśaknuvan vārayitum bhīṣma bāṇa prapīḍitān
translated: They were unable to resist, afflicted by Bhishma's arrows.

analyzed: mahā indra sama vīryeṇa vadhyamānā mahā camūḥ
translated: The great army, being slaughtered by one whose valor was equal to that of the great Indra,

original: abhajyata mahārāja na ca dvau saha dhāvataḥ🔽āviddharathanāgāśvaṃ patitadhvajakūbaram
analyzed: abhajyata mahā rāja na ca dvau saha dhāvataḥ  āviddha ratha nāga aśvam patita dhvaja kūbaram
translated: was shattered, O great king, with no two running together.🔽With chariots, elephants and horses scattered, with flags and poles fallen,

analyzed: anīkam pāṇḍu putrāṇām hāhā bhūtam acetanam
translated: the army of the sons of Pandu was in a state of lamentation and unconsciousness.

original: jaghānātra pitā putraṃ putraś ca pitaraṃ tathā
analyzed: jaghāna atra pitā putram putraḥ ca pitaram tathā
translated: A father killed his son here, and a son his father,

analyzed: priyam sakhāyam ca ākrande sakhā daiva balātkṛtaḥ
translated: and a dear friend cried out to his friend, overpowered by the force of fate.

analyzed: vimucya kavacān anye pāṇḍu putrasya sainikāḥ
translated: Other soldiers of the sons of Pandu, having removed their armor,

original: prakīrya keśān dhāvantaḥ pratyadṛśyanta bhārata🔽tad gokulam ivodbhrāntam udbhrāntarathakuñjaram
analyzed: prakīrya keśān dhāvantaḥ pratyadṛśyanta bhārata  tat gokulam iva udbhrāntam udbhrānta ratha kuñjaram
translated: were seen running about, O Bharata, with their hair disheveled.

analyzed: dadṛśe pāṇḍu putrasya sainyam ārta svaram tadā
translated: That army of the sons of Pandu, with its cattle-pen in turmoil, with its chariots and elephants in disarray,🔽was seen to be in a state of lamentation.

analyzed: prabhajyamānam sainyam tu dṛṣṭvā yādava nandanaḥ
translated: Seeing the army being shattered, the delighter of the Yadus,

original: uvāca pārthaṃ bībhatsuṃ nigṛhya ratham uttamam
analyzed: uvāca pārtham bībhatsum nigṛhya ratham uttamam
translated: having restrained his excellent chariot, spoke to Partha Bibhatsu:

original: ayaṃ sa kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ pārtha yaḥ kāṅkṣitas tava
analyzed: ayam sa kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ pārtha yaḥ kāṅkṣitaḥ tava
translated: This is the moment that has been awaited by you, O Partha.

original: praharāsmai naravyāghra na cen mohāt pramuhyase
analyzed: prahara asmai nara vyāghra na ced mohāt pramuhyase
translated: Strike him, O tiger among men, if you are not confused by delusion.

original: yat purā kathitaṃ vīra tvayā rājñāṃ samāgame
analyzed: yat purā kathitam vīra tvayā rājñām samāgame
translated: O hero, what was said by you earlier in the assembly of kings,

analyzed: virāṭa nagare pārtha saṃjayasya samīpatas
translated: in the city of Virata, O Partha, in the presence of Sanjaya,

analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa mukhān sarvān dhārtarāṣṭrasya sainikān
translated: I will slay all the soldiers of Dhritarashtra's army led by Bhishma and Drona,

original: sānubandhān haniṣyāmi ye māṃ yotsyanti saṃyuge
analyzed: sa anubandhān haniṣyāmi ye mām yotsyanti saṃyuge
translated: along with their followers, who will fight with me in battle,

original: iti tat kuru kaunteya satyaṃ vākyam ariṃdama
analyzed: iti tat kuru kaunteya satyam vākyam ariṃdama
translated: O Kounteya, O destroyer of enemies, make that statement true.

original: kṣatradharmam anusmṛtya yudhyasva bharatarṣabha🔽ity ukto vāsudevena tiryagdṛṣṭir adhomukhaḥ
analyzed: kṣatra dharmam anusmṛtya yudhyasva bharata ṛṣabha  iti uktaḥ vāsudevena tiryak dṛṣṭiḥ adhomukhaḥ
translated: Remembering the duty of a kshatriya, fight, O bull among the Bharata race.🔽Thus addressed by Vasudeva, with sidelong glances and downcast face,

original: akāma iva bībhatsur idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: akāmaḥ iva bībhatsuḥ idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Vibhatsu, as if unwilling, spoke these words:

original: avadhyānāṃ vadhaṃ kṛtvā rājyaṃ vā narakottaram
analyzed: avadhyānām vadham kṛtvā rājyam vā naraka uttaram
translated: Having killed those who should not be killed, or having a kingdom ending in hell,

original: duḥkhāni vanavāse vā kiṃ nu me sukṛtaṃ bhavet
analyzed: duḥkhāni vana vāse vā kim nu me su kṛtam bhavet
translated: or having the sufferings of forest life, what good deed would be mine?

original: codayāśvān yato bhīṣmaḥ kariṣye vacanaṃ tava
analyzed: codaya aśvān yatas bhīṣmaḥ kariṣye vacanam tava
translated: Drive the horses to where Bhishma is, I will do what you say.

analyzed: pātayiṣyāmi durdharṣam vṛddham kuru pitāmaham
translated: I will bring down the invincible old grandfather of the Kurus.

analyzed: śvān rajata prakhyān codayām āsa mādhavaḥ
translated: Then Madhava urged the horses that were like silver,

original: yato bhīṣmas tato rājan duṣprekṣyo raśmivān iva
analyzed: yatas bhīṣmaḥ tatas rājan duṣprekṣyaḥ raśmivān iva
translated: where Bhishma was, O king, like the sun difficult to gaze upon.

original: tatas tat punar āvṛttaṃ yudhiṣṭhirabalaṃ mahat
analyzed: tatas tat punar āvṛttam yudhiṣṭhira balam mahat
translated: Then that great army of Yudhishthira turned back again,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā pārtham mahā bāhum bhīṣmāya udyantam āhave
translated: Seeing the mighty-armed Partha ready to fight with Bhishma in battle,

original: tato bhīṣmaḥ kuruśreṣṭhaḥ siṃhavad vinadan muhuḥ
analyzed: tatas bhīṣmaḥ kuru śreṣṭhaḥ siṃha vat vinadan muhur
translated: Then Bhishma, the best of the Kurus, roaring like a lion again and again,

analyzed: dhanaṃjaya ratham śīghram śara varṣaiḥ avākirat
translated: Quickly covered Dhananjaya's chariot with showers of arrows.

original: kṣaṇena sa rathas tasya sahayaḥ sahasārathiḥ
analyzed: kṣaṇena sa rathaḥ tasya sa hayaḥ saha sārathiḥ
translated: In a moment, his chariot along with the horses and charioteer,

original: śaravarṣeṇa mahatā na prājñāyata kiṃ cana
analyzed: śara varṣeṇa mahatā na prājñāyata kim cana
translated: Was not at all visible due to a great shower of arrows.

original: vāsudevas tv asaṃbhrānto dhairyam āsthāya sātvataḥ
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ tu asaṃbhrāntaḥ dhairyam āsthāya sātvataḥ
translated: But Vasudeva, the Satvata, unperturbed, resorting to patience,

original: codayām āsa tān aśvān vitunnān bhīṣmasāyakaiḥ
analyzed: codayām āsa tān aśvān vitunnān bhīṣma sāyakaiḥ
translated: Urged those horses wounded by Bhishma's arrows.

original: tataḥ pārtho dhanur gṛhya divyaṃ jaladanisvanam
analyzed: tatas pārthaḥ dhanuḥ gṛhya divyam jalada nisvanam
translated: Then Partha, taking up his divine bow with a sound like thunderclouds,

original: pātayām āsa bhīṣmasya dhanuś chittvā śitaiḥ śaraiḥ
analyzed: pātayām āsa bhīṣmasya dhanuḥ chittvā śitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: Cut down Bhishma's bow with sharp arrows and brought him down.

original: sa cchinnadhanvā kauravyaḥ punar anyan mahad dhanuḥ
analyzed: sa chinna dhanvā kauravyaḥ punar anyat mahat dhanuḥ
translated: The Kaurava, with his bow cut off, took up another great bow

original: nimeṣāntaramātreṇa sajyaṃ cakre pitā tava🔽vicakarṣa tato dorbhyāṃ dhanur jaladanisvanam🔽athāsya tad api kruddhaś ciccheda dhanur arjunaḥ
analyzed: nimeṣa antara mātreṇa sajyam cakre pitā tava  vicakarṣa tatas dorbhyām dhanuḥ jalada nisvanam  atha asya tat api kruddhaḥ ciccheda dhanuḥ arjunaḥ
translated: And strung it in the twinkling of an eye, your father.🔽He drew that bow with his two arms, with a sound like thunderclouds.🔽Then Arjuna angrily cut down that bow of his as well.

original: tasya tat pūjayām āsa lāghavaṃ śaṃtanoḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat pūjayām āsa lāghavam śaṃtanoḥ sutaḥ
translated: Shantanu's son praised his dexterity

original: sādhu pārtha mahābāho sādhu kuntīsuteti ca🔽samābhāṣyainam aparaṃ pragṛhya ruciraṃ dhanuḥ
analyzed: sādhu pārtha mahā bāho sādhu kuntī suta iti ca  samābhāṣya enam aparam pragṛhya ruciram dhanuḥ
translated: Well done, O Partha, O mighty-armed one, well done, O son of Kunti!🔽 Having thus addressed him, he took up another beautiful bow

original: mumoca samare bhīṣmaḥ śarān pārtharathaṃ prati
analyzed: mumoca samare bhīṣmaḥ śarān pārtha ratham prati
translated: And released arrows in battle towards Partha's chariot.

analyzed: adarśayat vāsudevaḥ haya yāne param balam
translated: Vasudeva displayed his supreme skill in driving the horses,

original: moghān kurvañ śarāṃs tasya maṇḍalāni vidarśayan
analyzed: moghān kurvam śarān tasya maṇḍalāni vidarśayan
translated: Making his arrows ineffective by showing circular motions.

analyzed: śuśubhāte nara vyāghrau bhīṣma pārthau śara kṣatau
translated: Those two tigers among men, Bhishma and Partha, wounded by arrows,

analyzed: go vṛṣau iva saṃrabdhau viṣāṇa ullikhita aṅkitau
translated: Shone forth like two enraged bulls, their bodies marked by scratches from horns.

analyzed: tatas pravavṛte raudraḥ saṃgrāmaḥ loma harṣaṇaḥ
translated: Then a terrible battle ensued, making the hair stand on end,

original: pāṇḍavānāṃ ca mukhyasya kurūṇāṃ pravarasya ca
analyzed: pāṇḍavānām ca mukhyasya kurūṇām pravarasya ca
translated: Between the foremost of the Pandavas and the best of the Kurus.

original: tālamātre vikarṣantau tāv ubhau raṇakarkaśau🔽dhanuṣī dṛḍhamuṣṭī tāv ubhau pautrapitāmahau
analyzed: tāla mātre vikarṣantau tau ubhau raṇa karkaśau  dhanuṣī dṛḍha muṣṭī tau ubhau pautra pitāmahau
translated: Drawing their bows to the length of a palm tree, those two fierce warriors,🔽Those two grandsons and great-grandfathers, with firm grips on their bows,

analyzed: śyāmasya palitena asau saṃgamaḥ pratyaśobhata
translated: That encounter between the dark one and the gray one was splendid,

analyzed: gaṅgā yamunayoḥ yadvat jalayoḥ pratisaṃcaraḥ
translated: Like the meeting of the waters of the Ganga and Yamuna flowing in opposite directions.

analyzed: pārtha nāma aṅkitāḥ bāṇāḥ petuḥ bhīṣmasya vakṣasi
translated: Arrows marked with Partha's name fell on Bhishma's chest,

analyzed: nirguṇānām kṛtaghnānām manāṃsi iva hi sādhuṣu
translated: Like the minds of the ungrateful and the qualityless towards the virtuous.

analyzed: bhīṣmasya api tatas bāṇāḥ petuḥ arjuna vakṣasi
translated: Then arrows fell on Arjuna's chest from Bhishma as well,

analyzed: mahādeva pariprāpta dhanuḥ vidyām jigīṣavaḥ
translated: Desiring to conquer the knowledge of archery obtained from Mahadeva.

analyzed: vāsudevaḥ tu saṃprekṣya pārthasya mṛdu yuddha tām
translated: But Vasudeva, seeing Partha's gentle fighting,

original: bhīṣmaṃ ca śaravarṣāṇi sṛjantam aniśaṃ yudhi
analyzed: bhīṣmam ca śara varṣāṇi sṛjantam aniśam yudhi
translated: And Bhishma incessantly showering arrows in battle,

analyzed: pratapantam iva ādityam madhyam āsādya senayoḥ
translated: Scorching like the sun in the middle of the two armies,

analyzed: varān varān vinighnantam pāṇḍu putrasya sainikān
translated: Slaughtering the best of the soldiers of the sons of Pandu,

original: yugāntam iva kurvāṇaṃ bhīṣmaṃ yaudhiṣṭhire bale
analyzed: yuga antam iva kurvāṇam bhīṣmam yaudhiṣṭhire bale
translated: Bhishma acting like the end of the yuga in the army of Yudhishthira,

analyzed: na amṛṣyata mahā bāhuḥ mādhavaḥ para vīra hā
translated: The mighty-armed slayer of enemy heroes, Madhava, could not tolerate it.

original: vāsudevas tu saṃkruddho roṣāj jajvāla saṃyuge
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ tu saṃkruddhaḥ roṣāt jajvāla saṃyuge
translated: But Vasudeva, enraged, blazed in battle out of anger,

analyzed: utsṛjya rajata prakhyān hayān pārthasya māriṣa
translated: Abandoning Partha's horses, which were as radiant as silver, O father,

analyzed: kruddhaḥ nāma mahā yogī pracaskanda mahā rathāt
translated: The great yogi named Krodha, became angry and jumped down from the great chariot.

analyzed: abhidudrāva bhīṣmam sa bhuja praharaṇaḥ balī
translated: The powerful one, with his arms as weapons, rushed towards Bhishma,

analyzed: pratoda pāṇiḥ tejasvī siṃha vat vinadan muhur
translated: The energetic one, with the reins in his hand, roaring like a lion again and again,

original: dārayann iva padbhyāṃ sa jagatīṃ jagatīśvaraḥ
analyzed: dārayan iva padbhyām sa jagatīm jagatī īśvaraḥ
translated: As if splitting the earth with his feet, that lord of the world,
Krishna, with eyes red with anger, of immeasurable splendor, desiring to kill (Bhishma),

original: grasann iva ca cetāṃsi tāvakānāṃ mahāhave
analyzed: grasan iva ca cetāṃsi tāvakānām mahā āhave
translated: As if devouring the hearts of your troops in that great battle,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā mādhavam ākrande bhīṣmāya udyantam āhave
translated: Seeing Mādhava advancing towards Bhishma in that battle,

original: hato bhīṣmo hato bhīṣma iti tatra sma sainikāḥ
analyzed: hataḥ bhīṣmaḥ hataḥ bhīṣmaḥ iti tatra sma sainikāḥ
translated: The soldiers there cried out, Bhishma is slain! Bhishma is slain!

analyzed: krośantaḥ prādravan sarve vāsudeva bhayāt narāḥ
translated: Out of fear of Vasudeva, all the men fled.

analyzed: pīta kauśeya saṃvītaḥ maṇi śyāmaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Janārdana, attired in yellow silk garments, dark as a jewel,

original: śuśubhe vidravan bhīṣmaṃ vidyunmālī yathāmbudaḥ🔽sa siṃha iva mātaṅgaṃ yūtharṣabha ivarṣabham
analyzed: śuśubhe vidravan bhīṣmam vidyut mālī yathā ambudaḥ  sa siṃhaḥ iva mātaṅgam yūtha ṛṣabhaḥ iva ṛṣabham
translated: Shone as he rushed towards Bhishma, like a cloud with lightning.

analyzed: abhidudrāva tejasvī vinadan yādava ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The energetic bull of the Yādavas, roaring, rushed towards him🔽Like a lion towards an elephant, or a leader of a herd towards a bull.

analyzed: pratoda pāṇiḥ bhagavān śuśubhe yādava ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: The illustrious bull of the Yādavas, with his whip in hand,

analyzed: yathā aṃśunā ardayat candram amāvāsyām divākaraḥ
translated: Shone like the moon when it is eclipsed by Rāhu on the new moon day.

analyzed: tam āpatantam saṃprekṣya puṇḍarīkākṣam āhave
translated: Seeing Pundarikaksha (Krishna) rushing towards him in battle,

original: asaṃbhramaṃ raṇe bhīṣmo vicakarṣa mahad dhanuḥ
analyzed: asaṃbhramam raṇe bhīṣmaḥ vicakarṣa mahat dhanuḥ
translated: Bhishma, without fear, drew his great bow in the battle.

analyzed: uvāca ca enam govindam asaṃbhrāntena cetasā
translated: And he spoke to Govinda with a fearless mind:

original: ehy ehi puṇḍarīkākṣa devadeva namo 'stu te
analyzed: ehi ehi puṇḍarīkākṣa devadeva namaḥ stu te
translated: Come, come, O lotus-eyed one, god of gods, salutations to you.

analyzed: mām adya sātvata śreṣṭha pātayasva mahā āhave
translated: Today, O best of the Sātvatas, bring me down in this great battle.

original: tvayā hi deva saṃgrāme hatasyāpi mamānagha
analyzed: tvayā hi deva saṃgrāme hatasya api mama anagha
translated: O god, O sinless one, even if I am killed in battle by you,

original: śreya eva paraṃ kṛṣṇa loke 'muṣminn ihaiva ca
analyzed: śreyaḥ eva param kṛṣṇa loke muṣmin iha eva ca
translated: I will attain the highest good, O Krishna, in this world and the next.

analyzed: saṃbhāvitaḥ smi govinda trailokyena adya saṃyuge
