analyzed: tava bhrātā mama sakhā saṃbandhī śiṣyaḥ eva ca
translated: Your brother is my friend, relative and disciple.

original: māṃsāny utkṛtya vai dadyām arjunārthe mahīpate
analyzed: māṃsāni utkṛtya vai dadyām arjuna arthe mahīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, I would cut off my own flesh and give it for Arjuna's sake.

original: eṣa cāpi naravyāghro matkṛte jīvitaṃ tyajet
analyzed: eṣa ca api nara vyāghraḥ mad kṛte jīvitam tyajet
translated: And this tiger among men would give up his life for my sake.

original: eṣa naḥ samayas tāta tārayema parasparam
analyzed: eṣa naḥ samayaḥ tāta tārayema parasparam
translated: This is our agreement, O father, that we should save each other.

original: sa māṃ niyuṅkṣva rājendra yāvad dvīpo bhavāmy aham
analyzed: sa mām niyuṅkṣva rāja indra yāvat dvīpaḥ bhavāmi aham
translated: Appoint me, O lord of kings, as long as I am an island unto you.

original: pratijñātam upaplavye yat tat pārthena pūrvataḥ
analyzed: pratijñātam upaplavye yat tat pārthena pūrvatas
translated: What Partha formerly vowed at Upaplavya,

analyzed: ghātayiṣyāmi gāṅgeyam iti ulūkasya saṃnidhau
translated: that I will slay Gangeya, in the presence of Uluka,

original: parirakṣyaṃ ca mama tad vacaḥ pārthasya dhīmataḥ
analyzed: parirakṣyam ca mama tat vacaḥ pārthasya dhīmataḥ
translated: and that vow of the wise Partha must be protected by me.

original: anujñātaṃ tu pārthena mayā kāryaṃ na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: anujñātam tu pārthena mayā kāryam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: But what has been permitted by Partha must certainly be done by me.

original: atha vā phalgunasyaiṣa bhāraḥ parimito raṇe
analyzed: atha vā phalgunasya eṣa bhāraḥ parimitaḥ raṇe
translated: Or this limited task in battle belongs to Phalguna.

analyzed: nihaniṣyati saṃgrāme bhīṣmam parapuraṃjayam
translated: He will slay Bhishma, the conqueror of enemy cities, in battle.

original: aśakyam api kuryād dhi raṇe pārthaḥ samudyataḥ
analyzed: aśakyam api kuryāt hi raṇe pārthaḥ samudyataḥ
translated: Partha, when aroused, can do even what is impossible in battle.

analyzed: tridaśān vā samudyuktān sahitān daitya dānavaiḥ
translated: Or the assembled thirty gods together with the Daityas and Danavas,

original: nihanyād arjunaḥ saṃkhye kim u bhīṣmaṃ narādhipa🔽viparīto mahāvīryo gatasattvo 'lpajīvitaḥ
analyzed: nihanyāt arjunaḥ saṃkhye kim u bhīṣmam narādhipa  viparītaḥ mahā vīryaḥ gata sattvaḥ lpa jīvitaḥ
translated: Arjuna will kill him in battle, not to speak of Bhishma, O lord of men.🔽Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, is certainly confused and has lost his senses and his life.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ śāṃtanavaḥ nūnam kartavyam na avabudhyate
translated: He does not understand what should be done.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: evam etan mahābāho yathā vadasi mādhava
analyzed: evam etat mahā bāho yathā vadasi mādhava
translated: It is just as you say, O mighty-armed one, O Madhava.

original: sarve hy ete na paryāptās tava veganivāraṇe
analyzed: sarve hi ete na paryāptāḥ tava vega nivāraṇe
translated: For all of them are not able to withstand your force.

analyzed: niyatam samavāpsyāmi sarvam eva yathā īpsitam
translated: I will certainly obtain everything I desire.

original: yasya me puruṣavyāghra bhavān nātho mahābalaḥ
analyzed: yasya me puruṣa vyāghra bhavān nāthaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: For I have you, O tiger among men, as my mighty protector.

original: sendrān api raṇe devāñ jayeyaṃ jayatāṃ vara
analyzed: sa indrān api raṇe devām jayeyam jayatām vara
translated: O best of the victorious, I can conquer even the gods with Indra in battle.

original: tvayā nāthena govinda kim u bhīṣmaṃ mahāhave
analyzed: tvayā nāthena govinda kim u bhīṣmam mahā āhave
translated: O Govinda, with you as my protector, what to speak of Bhishma in the great battle?

original: na tu tvām anṛtaṃ kartum utsahe svārthagauravāt
analyzed: na tu tvām anṛtam kartum utsahe sva artha gauravāt
translated: But I cannot allow you to go without a fight, out of respect for my own interests.

analyzed: ayudhyamānaḥ sāhāyyam yathoktam kuru mādhava
translated: Fight without fighting, do as you have said, O Madhava.

original: samayas tu kṛtaḥ kaś cid bhīṣmeṇa mama mādhava
analyzed: samayaḥ tu kṛtaḥ kaḥ cit bhīṣmeṇa mama mādhava
translated: But a certain agreement was made with Bhishma by me, O Madhava.

original: mantrayiṣye tavārthāya na tu yotsye kathaṃ cana
analyzed: mantrayiṣye tava arthāya na tu yotsye katham cana
translated: I will counsel for your sake, but I will never fight in any way.

original: duryodhanārthe yotsyāmi satyam etad iti prabho
analyzed: duryodhana arthe yotsyāmi satyam etat iti prabho
translated: For Duryodhana's sake I will fight, this is the truth, O lord.

original: sa hi rājyasya me dātā mantrasyaiva ca mādhava🔽tasmād devavrataṃ bhūyo vadhopāyārtham ātmanaḥ
analyzed: sa hi rājyasya me dātā mantrasya eva ca mādhava  tasmāt devavratam bhūyas vadha upāya artham ātmanaḥ
translated: He is the giver of my kingdom and counsel, O Madhava.🔽Therefore, O Madhusudana, we all, together with you,

original: bhavatā sahitāḥ sarve pṛcchāmo madhusūdana🔽tad vayaṃ sahitā gatvā bhīṣmam āśu narottamam
analyzed: bhavatā sahitāḥ sarve pṛcchāmaḥ madhusūdana  tat vayam sahitāḥ gatvā bhīṣmam āśu nara uttamam
translated: will again ask Devavrata for a means of killing him.🔽O Varshneya, if it pleases you, we will go to that best of men, Bhishma,

original: rucite tava vārṣṇeya mantraṃ pṛcchāma kauravam
analyzed: rucite tava vārṣṇeya mantram pṛcchāma kauravam
translated: and ask the Kourava for counsel.

original: sa vakṣyati hitaṃ vākyaṃ tathyaṃ caiva janārdana
analyzed: sa vakṣyati hitam vākyam tathyam ca eva janārdana
translated: O Janardana, he will speak beneficial and truthful words.

original: yathā sa vakṣyate kṛṣṇa tathā kartāsmi saṃyuge
analyzed: yathā sa vakṣyate kṛṣṇa tathā kartāsmi saṃyuge
translated: O Krishna, I will do in battle as he will say.

original: sa no jayasya dātā ca mantrasya ca dhṛtavrataḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ jayasya dātā ca mantrasya ca dhṛta vrataḥ
translated: He, who is firm in his vows, is the giver of our victory and counsel.

original: bālāḥ pitrā vihīnāś ca tena saṃvardhitā vayam
analyzed: bālāḥ pitrā vihīnāḥ ca tena saṃvardhitāḥ vayam
translated: We were children, deprived of our father, and he raised us.

original: taṃ cet pitāmahaṃ vṛddhaṃ hantum icchāmi mādhava
analyzed: tam ced pitāmaham vṛddham hantum icchāmi mādhava
translated: If I wish to kill that aged grandfather, O Madhava,

original: yasyāṅge krīḍitaṃ nityaṃ bālye ca parivardhitāḥ
analyzed: yasya aṅge krīḍitam nityam bālye ca parivardhitāḥ
translated: in whose lap we always played as children and grew up,

analyzed: astrāṇi vidhivat ca eva śikṣitāni janārdana
translated: and from whom we learned the weapons properly, O Janardana,

original: taṃ hantum udyatāḥ kṛṣṇa rājyahetor vayaṃ yudhi
analyzed: tam hantum udyatāḥ kṛṣṇa rājya hetoḥ vayam yudhi
translated: we are ready to kill him in battle, O Krishna, for the sake of the kingdom.

original: pituḥ pitaram iṣṭaṃ vai dhig astu kṣatrajīvikām
analyzed: pituḥ pitaram iṣṭam vai dhik astu kṣatra jīvikām
translated: Shame on the livelihood of a kshatriya, that we should wish to kill our father's father.

original: satyaṃ bṛhaspater vākyaṃ devānām agrataḥ kila
analyzed: satyam bṛhaspateḥ vākyam devānām agratas kila
translated: The words of Brihaspati are true, it is said, in the presence of the gods,

original: bhāṣitaṃ guruṇā pūrvaṃ tan nibodha janārdana
analyzed: bhāṣitam guruṇā pūrvam tat nibodha janārdana
translated: spoken by the preceptor before, know that, Janardana.

original: putraḥ pitaram āsādya pitā putraṃ ca mānada
analyzed: putraḥ pitaram āsādya pitā putram ca mānada
translated: A son, having approached his father, and a father, O bestower of honor,

analyzed: rājya arthe ghātayet evam kṣatra dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: a son, would thus cause to be killed for the sake of the kingdom, such is the eternal Kshatriya dharma.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: tatas bravīt mahā rāja vārṣṇeyaḥ kuru nandanam
translated: Then, O great king, the Varshneya (Krishna) spoke to the descendant of Kuru (Arjuna):

original: rocate me mahābāho satataṃ tava bhāṣitam
analyzed: rocate me mahā bāho satatam tava bhāṣitam
translated: O mighty-armed one, your words have always been agreeable to me.

analyzed: devavrataḥ kṛtī bhīṣmaḥ prekṣitena api nirdahet
translated: Devavrata (Bhishma) is skilled and Bhishma can burn down (the enemy) even by a mere glance.

analyzed: gamyatām sa vadha upāyam praṣṭum sāgaragā sutaḥ
translated: Go to him, the son of the ocean-going (Ganga), to ask about the means of his destruction.

original: vaktum arhati satyaṃ sa tvayā pṛṣṭo viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: vaktum arhati satyam sa tvayā pṛṣṭaḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: He should speak the truth, especially when asked by you.

original: te vayaṃ tatra gacchāmaḥ praṣṭuṃ kurupitāmaham
analyzed: te vayam tatra gacchāmaḥ praṣṭum kuru pitāmaham
translated: We shall go there to ask the grandfather of the Kurus.

original: praṇamya śirasā cainaṃ mantraṃ pṛcchāma mādhava
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā ca enam mantram pṛcchāma mādhava
translated: Having bowed our heads to him, we shall ask for counsel, O Madhava.

original: sa no dāsyati yaṃ mantraṃ tena yotsyāmahe parān
analyzed: sa naḥ dāsyati yam mantram tena yotsyāmahe parān
translated: Whatever counsel he gives us, with that we shall fight the enemy.

original: evaṃ saṃmantrya vai vīrāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ pāṇḍupūrvaja
analyzed: evam saṃmantrya vai vīrāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ pāṇḍu pūrvaja
translated: Having thus consulted, O elder brother of Pandu, the heroic Pandavas,

original: jagmus te sahitāḥ sarve vāsudevaś ca vīryavān
analyzed: jagmuḥ te sahitāḥ sarve vāsudevaḥ ca vīryavān
translated: all of them together with the valiant Vasudeva (Krishna), went (to Bhishma).

analyzed: vimukta śastra kavacāḥ bhīṣmasya sadanam prati
translated: Discarded their weapons and armor and went towards Bhishma's abode.

original: praviśya ca tadā bhīṣmaṃ śirobhiḥ pratipedire
analyzed: praviśya ca tadā bhīṣmam śirobhiḥ pratipedire
translated: And having entered, they bowed their heads to Bhishma.

analyzed: pūjayantaḥ mahā rāja pāṇḍavāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: The Pandavas, O great king, the best of the Bharata race, paid homage to him.

original: praṇamya śirasā cainaṃ bhīṣmaṃ śaraṇam anvayuḥ
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā ca enam bhīṣmam śaraṇam anvayuḥ
translated: Bowing their heads, they sought refuge with Bhishma.

analyzed: caraṇa upagatān gṛhya pariṣvajya ca pāṇḍavān
translated: Taking the Pandavas who had come to his feet, embracing them,

original: mūrdhni caitān upāghrāya aṅkam āropayat tadā
analyzed: mūrdhni ca etān upāghrāya aṅkam āropayat tadā
translated: And placing them on his lap, he inhaled the fragrance of their heads.

analyzed: bāṣpa paryākula mukhaḥ smṛtvā pāṇḍum punar punar
translated: With his face full of tears, remembering Pandu again and again,

analyzed: tān uvāca mahā bāhuḥ bhīṣmaḥ kuru pitāmahaḥ
translated: The mighty-armed Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus, said to them:

original: svāgataṃ tava vārṣṇeya svāgataṃ te dhanaṃjaya
analyzed: svāgatam tava vārṣṇeya svāgatam te dhanaṃjaya
translated: Welcome, O Varshneya! Welcome, O Dhananjaya!

analyzed: svāgatam dharmaputrāya bhīmāya yamayoḥ tathā
translated: Welcome to the son of Dharma, to Bhima, and to the twins!

original: kiṃ kāryaṃ vaḥ karomy adya yuṣmatprītivivardhanam
analyzed: kim kāryam vaḥ karomi adya yuṣmad prīti vivardhanam
translated: What can I do for you today to increase your joy?

original: yuddhād anyatra he vatsāḥ prīyantāṃ mā viśaṅkatha
analyzed: yuddhāt anyatra he vatsāḥ prīyantām mā viśaṅkatha
translated: Except for battle, O sons, be happy, do not doubt.

original: sarvātmanā ca kartāsmi yady api syāt suduṣkaram
analyzed: sarva ātmanā ca kartāsmi yadi api syāt su duṣkaram
translated: I will do whatever is extremely difficult, even with my whole being.

original: tathā bruvāṇaṃ gāṅgeyaṃ prītiyuktaṃ punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: tathā bruvāṇam gāṅgeyam prīti yuktam punar punar
translated: To the son of Ganga, who spoke thus, filled with joy again and again,

analyzed: uvāca vākyam dīna ātmā dharmaputraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma, with a dejected mind, spoke these words:

original: yathā pṛcchasi mām adya kathaṃ tan me ca vā vibho
analyzed: yathā pṛcchasi mām adya katham tat me ca vā vibho
translated: As you ask me today, O lord, how that happened to me,

original: kathaṃ jayema dharmajña kathaṃ rājyaṃ labhemahi
analyzed: katham jayema dharma jña katham rājyam labhemahi
translated: How we may conquer, O knower of dharma, how we may obtain the kingdom,

original: prajānāṃ saṃkṣayo na syāt kathaṃ tan me vadābhibho
analyzed: prajānām saṃkṣayaḥ na syāt katham tat me vada abhibho
translated: How there may be no destruction of the subjects, tell me that, O lord.

original: bhavān hi no vadhopāyaṃ bravītu svayam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: bhavān hi naḥ vadha upāyam bravītu svayam ātmanaḥ
translated: You yourself tell us the means of killing you.

original: bhavantaṃ samare rājan viṣahema kathaṃ vayam
analyzed: bhavantam samare rājan viṣahema katham vayam
translated: How can we withstand you in battle, O king?

original: na hi te sūkṣmam apy asti randhraṃ kurupitāmaha
analyzed: na hi te sūkṣmam api asti randhram kuru pitāmaha
translated: For you, O grandfather of the Kurus, have not the slightest weakness.

analyzed: maṇḍalena eva dhanuṣā sadā dṛśyaḥ si saṃyuge
translated: In battle, you are always seen with your bow drawn into a circle.

original: nādadānaṃ saṃdadhānaṃ vikarṣantaṃ dhanur na ca
analyzed: na ādadānam saṃdadhānam vikarṣantam dhanuḥ na ca
translated: We do not see you drawing, fixing, or stretching your bow,

original: paśyāmas tvā mahābāho rathe sūryam iva sthitam
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ tvā mahā bāho rathe sūryam iva sthitam
translated: O mighty-armed one, standing on your chariot like the sun.

analyzed: nara aśva ratha nāgānām hantāram para vīra han
translated: The slayer of men, horses, chariots, and elephants, the killer of enemy heroes,

original: ka ivotsahate hantuṃ tvāṃ pumān bharatarṣabha
analyzed: kaḥ iva utsahate hantum tvām pumān bharata ṛṣabha
translated: What man, O bull among the Bharata race, would dare to kill you?

analyzed: varṣatā śara varṣāṇi mahānti puruṣa uttama
translated: Pouring down great showers of arrows, O best of men,

original: kṣayaṃ nītā hi pṛtanā bhavatā mahatī mama
analyzed: kṣayam nītā hi pṛtanā bhavatā mahatī mama
translated: My great army has been destroyed by you.

original: yathā yudhi jayeyaṃ tvāṃ yathā rājyaṃ bhaven mama
analyzed: yathā yudhi jayeyam tvām yathā rājyam bhavet mama
translated: How I may conquer you in battle, how the kingdom may be mine,

original: bhavet sainyasya vā śāntis tan me brūhi pitāmaha
analyzed: bhavet sainyasya vā śāntiḥ tat me brūhi pitāmaha
translated: How there may be peace for the army, tell me that, O grandfather.

analyzed: tatas bravīt śāṃtanavaḥ pāṇḍavān pāṇḍu pūrvaja
translated: Then Shantanu's son spoke to the Pandavas, O elder brother of Pandu:

original: na kathaṃ cana kaunteya mayi jīvati saṃyuge
analyzed: na katham cana kaunteya mayi jīvati saṃyuge
translated: By no means, O son of Kunti, will you see prosperity as long as I am alive in battle.

original: yuṣmāsu dṛśyate vṛddhiḥ satyam etad bravīmi vaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmāsu dṛśyate vṛddhiḥ satyam etat bravīmi vaḥ
translated: I tell you this truthfully.

original: nirjite mayi yuddhe tu dhruvaṃ jeṣyatha kauravān
analyzed: nirjite mayi yuddhe tu dhruvam jeṣyatha kauravān
translated: But if I am defeated in battle, you will certainly defeat the Kauravas.

original: kṣipraṃ mayi praharata yadīcchatha raṇe jayam
analyzed: kṣipram mayi praharata yadi icchatha raṇe jayam
translated: Strike me quickly if you desire victory in battle.

analyzed: anujānāmi vaḥ pārthāḥ praharadhvam yathāsukham
translated: I give you permission, O Parthas, strike as you please.

original: evaṃ hi sukṛtaṃ manye bhavatāṃ vidito hy aham
analyzed: evam hi sukṛtam manye bhavatām viditaḥ hi aham
translated: For I consider this to be well done, for I am known to you.

original: hate mayi hataṃ sarvaṃ tasmād evaṃ vidhīyatām
analyzed: hate mayi hatam sarvam tasmāt evam vidhīyatām
translated: When I am killed, everything is killed. Therefore, act accordingly.

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhishthira said:

original: brūhi tasmād upāyaṃ no yathā yuddhe jayemahi
analyzed: brūhi tasmāt upāyam naḥ yathā yuddhe jayemahi
translated: Therefore, tell us the means by which we may be victorious in battle,

analyzed: bhavantam samare kruddham daṇḍa pāṇim iva antakam
translated: For you, when enraged in battle, are like Death with a staff in hand.

original: śakyo vajradharo jetuṃ varuṇo 'tha yamas tathā
analyzed: śakyaḥ vajradharaḥ jetum varuṇaḥ yamaḥ tathā
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, Varuna, and Yama may be defeated,

original: na bhavān samare śakyaḥ sendrair api surāsuraiḥ
analyzed: na bhavān samare śakyaḥ sa indraiḥ api sura asuraiḥ
translated: But you cannot be defeated in battle by Indra himself, or by the gods and demons together.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: satyam etan mahābāho yathā vadasi pāṇḍava
analyzed: satyam etat mahā bāho yathā vadasi pāṇḍava
translated: This is true, O mighty-armed one, as you say, O son of Pandu.

original: nāhaṃ śakyo raṇe jetuṃ sendrair api surāsuraiḥ
analyzed: na aham śakyaḥ raṇe jetum sa indraiḥ api sura asuraiḥ
translated: I cannot be defeated in battle by Indra himself, or by the gods and demons together.

analyzed: ātta śastraḥ raṇe yattaḥ gṛhīta vara kārmukaḥ
translated: With weapons taken up, attentive in battle, with the best of bows grasped,

original: nyastaśastraṃ tu māṃ rājan hanyur yudhi mahārathāḥ🔽nikṣiptaśastre patite vimuktakavacadhvaje
analyzed: nyasta śastram tu mām rājan hanyuḥ yudhi mahā rathāḥ  nikṣipta śastre patite vimukta kavaca dhvaje
translated: But if I lay down my weapons in battle, O king, the great warriors will kill me.🔽If I lay down my weapons, fall down, remove my armor and flag,

original: dravamāṇe ca bhīte ca tavāsmīti ca vādini
analyzed: dravamāṇe ca bhīte ca tava asmi iti ca vādini
translated: Run away, be frightened, or say 'I am yours,'

analyzed: strī jite strī pradhāne ca strī pradhāyini dharmaja
translated: If I am conquered by a woman, if a woman is my chief, or if a woman is my protector, O Dharma's son,

analyzed: striyām strī nāmadheye ca vikale ca eka putrake
translated: If I am a woman, if my name is feminine, if I am disabled, if I have only one son,

original: aprasūte ca duṣprekṣye na yuddhaṃ rocate mama
analyzed: aprasūte ca duṣprekṣye na yuddham rocate mama
translated: If I have not given birth, if I am difficult to look at, then battle does not appeal to me.

original: imaṃ ca śṛṇu me pārtha saṃkalpaṃ pūrvacintitam
analyzed: imam ca śṛṇu me pārtha saṃkalpam pūrva cintitam
translated: And listen to this resolve of mine, O Partha, thought out beforehand:

original: amaṅgalyadhvajaṃ dṛṣṭvā na yudhyeyaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: amaṅgalya dhvajam dṛṣṭvā na yudhyeyam katham cana
translated: Having seen an inauspicious flag, I will never fight in any way.

original: ya eṣa draupado rājaṃs tava sainye mahārathaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa draupadaḥ rājan tava sainye mahā rathaḥ
translated: This Droupadi's son, O king, is a great warrior in your army,

original: apumāṃs tasya putras tu pūrvam āsīd viśāṃ pate
analyzed: a pumān tasya putraḥ tu pūrvam āsīt viśām pate
translated: His son was formerly a eunuch, O lord of the people.

analyzed: abhyavartanta nighnantaḥ tava putrasya vāhinīm

analyzed: rathinaḥ pātayat rājan rathebhyaḥ puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ  sādinaḥ ca aśva pṛṣṭhebhyaḥ padātīn ca samāgatān
translated: and brought down charioteers from their chariots, O king, that best of men🔽and horsemen from the backs of their horses and assembled foot soldiers

analyzed: gaja ārohān gajebhyaḥ ca pareṣām vidadhat bhayam
translated: and elephant riders from their elephants, causing fear to the enemy.🔽Those Pandavas, like the asuras against the wielder of the thunderbolt,

analyzed: śakra aśani sama sparśān vimuñcan niśitām śarān

analyzed: dikṣu adṛśyata sarvāsu ghoram saṃdhārayan vapuḥ  maṇḍalīkṛtam eva asya nityam dhanuḥ adṛśyata
translated: and was seen in all directions bearing a terrible form.🔽His great bow, resembling Shakra's bow,

analyzed: vismayam paramam prāptāḥ pitāmaham apūjayan
translated: your sons attained supreme wonder and honored the grandfather.

original: pārthā vimanaso bhūtvā praikṣanta pitaraṃ tava
analyzed: pārthāḥ vimanasaḥ bhūtvā praikṣanta pitaram tava
translated: The Parthas, becoming dejected, looked at your father

analyzed: na ca enam vārayām āsuḥ vyātta ānanam iva antakam

analyzed: daśame hani saṃprāpte ratha anīkam śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: on the tenth day, when he approached the chariot division of Shikhandi.

analyzed: adahat niśitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ kṛṣṇavartmā iva kānanam

original: taṃ śikhaṇḍī tribhir bāṇair abhyavidhyat stanāntare
analyzed: tam śikhaṇḍī tribhiḥ bāṇaiḥ abhyavidhyat stanāntare
translated: Shikhandi pierced him between the breasts with three arrows,

analyzed: āśīviṣam iva kruddham kāla sṛṣṭam iva antakam
translated: like an angry, virulent serpent, like Death created by Time.

original: sa tenātibhṛśaṃ viddhaḥ prekṣya bhīṣmaḥ śikhaṇḍinam
analyzed: sa tena ati bhṛśam viddhaḥ prekṣya bhīṣmaḥ śikhaṇḍinam
translated: Deeply pierced by him, Bhishma, seeing Shikhandi,

original: anicchann api saṃkruddhaḥ prahasann idam abravīt
analyzed: an icchan api saṃkruddhaḥ prahasan idam abravīt
translated: though unwilling, angrily spoke this, as if laughing:

analyzed: kāmam abhyasa vā mā vā na tvām yotsye katham cana
translated: Whether you attack me or not, I will not fight with you in any way.

original: yaiva hi tvaṃ kṛtā dhātrā saiva hi tvaṃ śikhaṇḍinī
analyzed: yā eva hi tvam kṛtā dhātrā sā eva hi tvam śikhaṇḍinī
translated: You were indeed created by the Creator as a woman, you are indeed Shikhandi.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā śikhaṇḍī krodhamūrchitaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā śikhaṇḍī krodha mūrchitaḥ
translated: Hearing those words of his, Shikhandi, beside himself with rage,

analyzed: uvāca bhīṣmam samare parilelihan
translated: spoke to Bhishma in the battle, licking the corners of his mouth:

analyzed: sarvam eva mahā yuddham śrutavantam mahā raṇe
translated: Having heard everything about the great battle in the great war,

analyzed: jānāmi tvām mahā bāho kṣatriyāṇām kṣayaṃkaram
translated: I know you, O mighty-armed one, the destroyer of the Kshatriyas.

original: mayā śrutaṃ ca te yuddhaṃ jāmadagnyena vai saha
analyzed: mayā śrutam ca te yuddham jāmadagnyena vai saha
translated: I have heard of your battle with Jamadagni's son.

original: divyaś ca te prabhāvo 'yaṃ sa mayā bahuśaḥ śrutaḥ
analyzed: divyaḥ ca te prabhāvaḥ yam sa mayā bahuśas śrutaḥ
translated: And this divine power of yours has been heard by me many times.

original: jānann api prabhāvaṃ te yotsye 'dyāhaṃ tvayā saha
analyzed: jānan api prabhāvam te yotsye dyā aham tvayā saha
translated: Knowing your power, I will still fight with you today.

original: pāṇḍavānāṃ priyaṃ kurvann ātmanaś ca narottama
analyzed: pāṇḍavānām priyam kurvan ātmanaḥ ca nara uttama
translated: Doing what is dear to the Pandavas and to myself, O best of men.

analyzed: adya tvā yodhayiṣyāmi raṇe puruṣa sattama
translated: Today, O best of men, I will fight with you in battle.

original: dhruvaṃ ca tvā haniṣyāmi śape satyena te 'grataḥ
analyzed: dhruvam ca tvā haniṣyāmi śape satyena te gratas
translated: And I will certainly kill you, I swear truthfully before you.

original: etac chrutvā vaco mahyaṃ yat kṣamaṃ tat samācara
analyzed: etat śrutvā vacaḥ mahyam yat kṣamam tat samācara
translated: Having heard these words of mine, do what is proper.

original: kāmam abhyasa vā mā vā na me jīvan vimokṣyase
analyzed: kāmam abhyasa vā mā vā na me jīvan vimokṣyase
translated: Whether you fight with me or not, you will not escape me alive.

analyzed: su dṛṣṭaḥ kriyatām bhīṣma lokaḥ yam samitiṃjaya
translated: O Bhishma, O conqueror of assemblies, look well upon this world.

original: evam uktvā tato bhīṣmaṃ pañcabhir nataparvabhiḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas bhīṣmam pañcabhiḥ nata parvabhiḥ
translated: Having said this, he pierced Bhishma in battle with five straight arrows,

analyzed: avidhyata raṇe rājan praṇunnam vākya sāyakaiḥ
translated: O king, as if goading him with the arrows of his words.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā savyasācī paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā savyasācī paraṃtapaḥ
translated: Having heard those words, Savyasachi, the scorcher of enemies,

analyzed: kālaḥ yam iti saṃcintya śikhaṇḍinam acodayat
translated: thinking that the time had come, urged Shikhandi,

original: ahaṃ tvām anuyāsyāmi parān vidrāvayañ śaraiḥ
analyzed: aham tvām anuyāsyāmi parān vidrāvayam śaraiḥ
translated: I will follow you, driving away the enemies with my arrows.

analyzed: abhidrava su saṃrabdhaḥ bhīṣmam bhīma parākramam
translated: Attack with great rage Bhishma, whose prowess is terrible.

original: na hi te saṃyuge pīḍāṃ śaktaḥ kartuṃ mahābalaḥ
analyzed: na hi te saṃyuge pīḍām śaktaḥ kartum mahā balaḥ

original: tasmād adya mahābāho vīra bhīṣmam abhidrava
analyzed: tasmāt adya mahā bāho vīra bhīṣmam abhidrava
translated: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, O hero, attack Bhishma today.

original: ahatvā samare bhīṣmaṃ yadi yāsyasi māriṣa
analyzed: a hatvā samare bhīṣmam yadi yāsyasi māriṣa
translated: If you go without killing Bhishma in battle, O venerable one,

analyzed: avahāsyaḥ sya lokasya bhaviṣyasi mayā saha
translated: you will become a laughingstock to the world, along with me.

analyzed: na avahāsyāḥ yathā vīra bhavema parama āhave
translated: O hero, so that we may not become a laughingstock in this great battle,

original: tathā kuru raṇe yatnaṃ sādhayasva pitāmaham
analyzed: tathā kuru raṇe yatnam sādhayasva pitāmaham
translated: act in such a way that you accomplish the grandfather in battle.

original: ahaṃ te rakṣaṇaṃ yuddhe kariṣyāmi paraṃtapa
analyzed: aham te rakṣaṇam yuddhe kariṣyāmi paraṃtapa
translated: I will protect you in the battle, O scorcher of enemies,

analyzed: vārayan rathinaḥ sarvān sādhayasva pitāmaham
translated: restraining all the charioteers, accomplish the grandfather.

original: droṇaṃ ca droṇaputraṃ ca kṛpaṃ cātha suyodhanam
analyzed: droṇam ca droṇa putram ca kṛpam ca atha suyodhanam
translated: And Drona, and Drona's son, and Kripa, and Suyodhana,

analyzed: citrasenam vikarṇam ca saindhavam ca jayadratham
translated: Chitrasena, Vikarna, and Jayadratha the ruler of the Sindhus,

analyzed: vinda anuvindau āvantyau kāmbojam ca sudakṣiṇam
translated: Vinda and Anuvinda from Avanti, and Sudakshina from Kamboja,

original: bhagadattaṃ tathā śūraṃ māgadhaṃ ca mahāratham
analyzed: bhagadattam tathā śūram māgadham ca mahā ratham
translated: the brave Bhagadatta, and the great warrior from Magadha,

original: saumadattiṃ raṇe śūram ārśyaśṛṅgiṃ ca rākṣasam
analyzed: saumadattim raṇe śūram ārśyaśṛṅgim ca rākṣasam
translated: the brave Somadatta's son in battle, and the Rakshasa Almasha's son,

original: trigartarājaṃ ca raṇe saha sarvair mahārathaiḥ
analyzed: trigarta rājam ca raṇe saha sarvaiḥ mahā rathaiḥ
translated: And the king of Trigarta in battle, along with all the great warriors,

analyzed: aham āvārayiṣyāmi velā iva makara ālayam
translated: I will restrain them, like the shore restrains the abode of makaras.

original: kurūṃś ca sahitān sarvān ye caiṣāṃ sainikāḥ sthitāḥ
analyzed: kurūn ca sahitān sarvān ye ca eṣām sainikāḥ sthitāḥ
translated: And all the Kurus together, and those who are stationed as their soldiers,

analyzed: nivārayiṣyāmi raṇe sādhayasva pitāmaham
translated: I will restrain in battle. Accomplish the grandfather.

analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

analyzed: ke rakṣan pāṇḍava anīke śikhaṇḍinam udāyudham
translated: Who protected Shikhandi in the Pandava army,

analyzed: tvaramāṇāḥ tvarā kāle jigīṣantaḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: The maharathas eager to conquer at a time when speed was essential?

original: kathaṃ śāṃtanavo bhīṣmaḥ sa tasmin daśame 'hani
analyzed: katham śāṃtanavaḥ bhīṣmaḥ sa tasmin daśame hani
translated: How did Shantanu's son Bhishma fight on that tenth day,

analyzed: ayudhyata mahā vīryaḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ saha sṛñjayaiḥ
translated: The greatly valorous one, together with the Pandavas and the Srinjayas in battle?

analyzed: na mṛṣyāmi raṇe bhīṣmam pratyudyātam śikhaṇḍinam
translated: I cannot bear that Bhishma should be attacked in battle by Shikhandi.

analyzed: kaccit na sya dhanuḥ vā aśīryata asyataḥ
translated: I hope his chariot was not destroyed, or his bow shattered while he was shooting?

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

analyzed: na aśīryata dhanuḥ tasya ratha bhaṅgaḥ na ca api abhūt

analyzed: yudhyamānasya saṃgrāme bhīṣmasya bharata ṛṣabha
translated: While Bhishma, bull of the Bharata lineage, was fighting in battle.

analyzed: nighnataḥ samare śatrūm śaraiḥ saṃnata parvabhiḥ
translated: Slaying the enemies in battle with straight-tufted arrows,

analyzed: aneka śata sāhasrāḥ tāvakānām mahā rathāḥ
translated: Many hundreds and thousands of great warriors on your side,

analyzed: ratha danti gaṇāḥ rājan hayāḥ ca eva su sajjitāḥ
translated: With masses of chariots and elephants, O king, and well-equipped horses,

analyzed: abhyavartanta yuddhāya puraskṛtya pitāmaham
translated: Advanced to battle, placing the grandfather at the forefront.

analyzed: yathāpratijñam kauravya sa ca api samitiṃjayaḥ
translated: As promised, O descendant of the Kuru lineage, that conqueror in assemblies,

analyzed: pārthānām akarot bhīṣmaḥ satatam samiti kṣayam
translated: Bhishma, always caused destruction among the Parthas.

analyzed: yudhyamānam mahā iṣvāsam vinighnantam parām śaraiḥ
translated: While that great archer fought and killed the enemy with his arrows,

analyzed: pāñcālāḥ pāṇḍavaiḥ sārdham sarve eva abhyavārayan
translated: All the Panchalas, together with the Pandavas, surrounded him.

analyzed: daśame hani saṃprāpte tatāpa ripu vāhinīm
translated: On the tenth day, he scorched the army of the enemy,

analyzed: kīryamāṇām śitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ sahasraśas
translated: Scattered in hundreds and thousands by sharp arrows.

original: na hi bhīṣmaṃ maheṣvāsaṃ pāṇḍavāḥ pāṇḍupūrvaja
analyzed: na hi bhīṣmam mahā iṣvāsam pāṇḍavāḥ pāṇḍu pūrvaja
translated: The Pandavas, O elder brother of Pandu, were unable to conquer Bhishma, that great archer,

analyzed: aśaknuvan raṇe jetum pāśa hastam iva antakam
translated: In battle, like one with a noose in hand, like Death himself.

analyzed: atha upāyāt mahā rāja savyasācī paraṃtapaḥ
translated: Then, O great king, Savyasachi, the scorcher of enemies,

analyzed: trāsayan rathinaḥ sarvān bībhatsuḥ aparājitaḥ
translated: Approached, O king, terrifying all the charioteers, that invincible Bibhatsu,

original: siṃhavad vinadann uccair dhanurjyāṃ vikṣipan muhuḥ
analyzed: siṃha vat vinadan uccais dhanuḥ jyām vikṣipan muhur
translated: Roaring loudly like a lion, repeatedly stretching his bowstring,

original: śaraughān visṛjan pārtho vyacarat kālavad raṇe
analyzed: śara oghān visṛjan pārthaḥ vyacarat kāla vat raṇe
translated: Partha, releasing torrents of arrows, moved about in the battle like Death.

analyzed: tasya śabdena vitrastāḥ tāvakāḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, your troops were terrified by his roar.

analyzed: siṃhasya iva mṛgāḥ rājan vyadravanta mahā bhayāt
translated: Like deer by a lion, O king, they fled in great fear.

analyzed: jayantam pāṇḍavam dṛṣṭvā tvad sainyam ca abhipīḍitam
translated: Seeing the victorious Pandava and his own troops afflicted,

analyzed: duryodhanaḥ tatas bhīṣmam abravīt bhṛśa pīḍitaḥ
translated: the greatly afflicted Duryodhana then spoke to Bhishma:

analyzed: eṣa pāṇḍu sutaḥ tāta śvetāśvaḥ kṛṣṇasārathiḥ
translated: O father, this son of Pandu, with white horses and Krishna as his charioteer,

analyzed: dahate māmakān sarvān kṛṣṇavartmā iva kānanam
translated: is burning down all my troops like a forest fire.

analyzed: paśya sainyāni gāṅgeya dravamāṇāni sarvaśas
translated: Look, Gangeya, at the troops fleeing in all directions,

analyzed: pāṇḍavena yudhām śreṣṭha kālyamānāni saṃyuge
translated: being routed by Pandava, the best of warriors, in battle.

analyzed: yathā paśu gaṇān pālaḥ saṃkālayati kānane
translated: Just as a herdsman drives herds of cattle in the forest,

analyzed: tathā idam māmakam sainyam kālyate śatru tāpana
translated: so this army of mine, O tormentor of enemies, is being driven away.

analyzed: dhanaṃjaya śaraiḥ bhagnam dravamāṇam itas tatas
translated: Broken by Dhananjaya's arrows, it is running away here and there.

original: bhīmo hy eṣa durādharṣo vidrāvayati me balam
analyzed: bhīmaḥ hi eṣa durādharṣaḥ vidrāvayati me balam
translated: For this invincible Bhima is scattering my army.

original: sātyakiś cekitānaś ca mādrīputrau ca pāṇḍavau
analyzed: sātyakiḥ cekitānaḥ ca mādrī putrau ca pāṇḍavau
translated: Satyaki, Chekitana, the two Pandava sons of Madri,

original: abhimanyuś ca vikrānto vāhinīṃ dahate mama
analyzed: abhimanyuḥ ca vikrāntaḥ vāhinīm dahate mama
translated: and the valorous Abhimanyu are burning down my army.

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnas tathā śūro rākṣasaś ca ghaṭotkacaḥ🔽vyadrāvayetāṃ sahasā sainyaṃ mama mahābalau
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ tathā śūraḥ rākṣasaḥ ca ghaṭotkacaḥ  vyadrāvayetām sahasā sainyam mama mahā balau
translated: The brave Dhrishtadyumna and the Rakshasa Ghatotkacha,🔽Those two greatly powerful ones suddenly routed my army.

analyzed: vadhyamānasya sainyasya sarvaiḥ etaiḥ mahā balaiḥ
translated: While my army is being slaughtered by all those greatly powerful ones,

original: nānyāṃ gatiṃ prapaśyāmi sthāne yuddhe ca bhārata
analyzed: na anyām gatim prapaśyāmi sthāne yuddhe ca bhārata
translated: I do not see any other recourse, O Bharata, except you,

analyzed: ṛte tvām puruṣa vyāghra deva tulya parākrama
translated: O tiger among men, whose prowess is equal to that of the gods.

original: paryāptaś ca bhavān kṣipraṃ pīḍitānāṃ gatir bhava
analyzed: paryāptaḥ ca bhavān kṣipram pīḍitānām gatiḥ bhava
translated: You are capable of quickly becoming the refuge of those who are afflicted.

original: evam ukto mahārāja pitā devavratas tava
analyzed: evam uktaḥ mahā rāja pitā devavrataḥ tava
translated: Thus addressed, O great king, your father Devavrata,

original: cintayitvā muhūrtaṃ tu kṛtvā niścayam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: cintayitvā muhūrtam tu kṛtvā niścayam ātmanaḥ
translated: Having thought for a moment and made up his mind,

analyzed: saḥ tividdhaḥ mahā iṣvāsaḥ duḥśāsanam abhāṣata
translated: Deeply pierced, that great archer said to Duḥśāsana:

original: eṣa pārtho raṇe kruddhaḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ mahārathaḥ
analyzed: eṣa pārthaḥ raṇe kruddhaḥ pāṇḍavānām mahā rathaḥ
translated: This Pārtha, the great chariot of the Pāṇḍavas, is enraged in battle.

analyzed: śaraiḥ aneka sāhasraiḥ mām eva abhyasate raṇe
translated: In battle, he attacks me alone with many thousands of arrows.

original: na caiṣa śakyaḥ samare jetuṃ vajrabhṛtā api
analyzed: na ca eṣa śakyaḥ samare jetum vajrabhṛtā api
translated: And he cannot be conquered in battle even by the wielder of the thunderbolt,

analyzed: na ca api sahitāḥ vīrāḥ deva dānava rākṣasāḥ
translated: Nor can the heroes, the gods, demons and rākṣasas united,

original: māṃ caiva śaktā nirjetuṃ kim u martyāḥ sudurbalāḥ
analyzed: mām ca eva śaktāḥ nirjetum kim martyāḥ su durbalāḥ
translated: Conquer me, let alone very weak mortals.

original: na cāham api śaktas tu sarvair api mahārathaiḥ
analyzed: na ca aham api śaktaḥ tu sarvaiḥ api mahā rathaiḥ
translated: And I too am not able to conquer all the great chariot-warriors,

original: ṛte 'rjunaṃ susaṃkruddhair etat satyaṃ bravīmi te🔽evaṃ tayoḥ saṃvadatoḥ phalguno niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
analyzed: ṛte rjunam su saṃkruddhaiḥ etat satyam bravīmi te  evam tayoḥ saṃvadatoḥ phalgunaḥ niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: Except for Arjuna, I tell you this truthfully.

analyzed: śikhaṇḍinam puraskṛtya bhīṣmam vivyādha saṃyuge
translated: While they were conversing thus, Phalguna, placing Shikhandi in front, pierced Bhishma in battle with sharp arrows.

original: tato duḥśāsanaṃ bhūyaḥ smayamāno 'bhyabhāṣata🔽atividdhaḥ śitair bāṇair bhṛśaṃ gāṇḍīvadhanvanā
analyzed: tatas duḥśāsanam bhūyas smayamānaḥ bhyabhāṣata  atividdhaḥ śitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ bhṛśam gāṇḍīvadhanvanā
translated: Then, smiling again, he addressed Duhshasana:🔽He is deeply pierced by the sharp arrows of the wielder of Gandiva.

analyzed: vajra aśani sama sparśāḥ śita agrāḥ saṃpraveśitāḥ
translated: They are sharp-pointed and have the touch of Indra's thunderbolt.

analyzed: vimuktāḥ avyavacchinnāḥ na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: They are released without interruption and are not the arrows of Shikhandi.

analyzed: nikṛntamānāḥ marmāṇi dṛḍha āvaraṇa bhedinaḥ
translated: They are cutting through my vital organs and penetrating my strong armor.

original: musalānīva me ghnanti neme bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
analyzed: musalāni iva me ghnanti na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: They are striking me like clubs and are not the arrows of Shikhandi.

analyzed: brahmadaṇḍa sama sparśāḥ vajra vegāḥ durāsadāḥ
translated: They have the touch of Brahma's staff, the speed of lightning, and are unassailable.

original: mama prāṇān ārujanti neme bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
analyzed: mama prāṇān ārujanti na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: They are robbing me of my life and are not the arrows of Shikhandi.

original: bhujagā iva saṃkruddhā lelihānā viṣolbaṇāḥ🔽mamāviśanti marmāṇi neme bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
analyzed: bhujagāḥ iva saṃkruddhāḥ lelihānāḥ viṣa ulbaṇāḥ  mama āviśanti marmāṇi na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: They are like angry serpents, licking their tongues with virulent poison.🔽They are entering my vital organs and are not the arrows of Shikhandi.

analyzed: nāśayanti iva me prāṇān yamadūtāḥ iva āhitāḥ
translated: They are destroying my life-breath, like the messengers of Yama, the god of death.

analyzed: gadā parigha saṃsparśāḥ na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: They have the touch of clubs and maces and are not the arrows of Shikhandi.

original: kṛntanti mama gātrāṇi māghamāse gavām iva
analyzed: kṛntanti mama gātrāṇi māgha māse gavām iva
translated: They are cutting my body, like a cow in the month of Magha.

original: arjunasya ime bāṇā neme bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
analyzed: arjunasya ime bāṇāḥ na ime bāṇāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: These are Arjuna's arrows, not Shikhandi's arrows.

original: sarve hy api na me duḥkhaṃ kuryur anye narādhipāḥ
analyzed: sarve hi api na me duḥkham kuryuḥ anye narādhipāḥ
translated: For all the other kings would not cause me as much pain,

analyzed: vīram gaṇḍīvadhanvānam ṛte jiṣṇum kapidhvajam
translated: Except for the hero Gandiva-wielder Jishnu, the monkey-bannered one.

original: iti bruvañ śāṃtanavo didhakṣur iva pāṇḍavam
analyzed: iti śāṃtanavaḥ didhakṣuḥ iva pāṇḍavam
translated: Saying this, Shantanu's son, as if wishing to burn the Pandava,

analyzed: sa viṣphuliṅgām dīpta agrām śaktim cikṣepa bhārata
translated: Discharged a spear with sparks and blazing tip, O Bharata.

original: tām asya viśikhaiś chittvā tridhā tribhir apātayat
analyzed: tām asya viśikhaiḥ chittvā tridhā tribhiḥ apātayat
translated: Having cut it into three pieces with three arrows, he made it fall down,

analyzed: paśyatām kuru vīrāṇām sarveṣām tatra bhārata
translated: In the sight of all the Kuru heroes present there, O Bharata.

analyzed: carma atha adatta gāṅgeyaḥ jātarūpa pariṣkṛtam
translated: Then Gangeya took up a shield decorated with gold,

original: khaḍgaṃ cānyataraṃ prepsur mṛtyor agre jayāya vā
analyzed: khaḍgam ca anyataram prepsuḥ mṛtyoḥ agre jayāya vā
translated: And a sword, hoping to meet either death or victory.

original: tasya tac chatadhā carma vyadhamad daṃśitātmanaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat śatadhā carma vyadhamat daṃśita ātmanaḥ
translated: He cut into a hundred pieces the shield of that one with a self-controlled soul,

analyzed: rathāt an avarūḍhasya tat adbhutam iva abhavat
translated: While he was still on his chariot, which seemed marvelous.

original: vinadyoccaiḥ siṃha iva svāny anīkāny acodayat
analyzed: vinadya uccais siṃhaḥ iva svāni anīkāni acodayat
translated: Having roared loudly like a lion, he urged his own troops,

original: abhidravata gāṅgeyaṃ māṃ vo 'stu bhayam aṇv api
analyzed: abhidravata gāṅgeyam mām vaḥ stu bhayam aṇu api
translated: Attack Gangeya! Let not even a little fear be yours!

original: atha te tomaraiḥ prāsair bāṇaughaiś ca samantataḥ
analyzed: atha te tomaraiḥ prāsaiḥ bāṇa oghaiḥ ca samantataḥ
translated: Then they from all sides with lances, javelins and showers of arrows,

analyzed: paṭṭiśaiḥ ca sa nistriṃśaiḥ nānā praharaṇaiḥ tathā
translated: With axes, swords, and various other weapons,

original: vatsadantaiś ca bhallaiś ca tam ekam abhidudruvuḥ
analyzed: vatsadantaiḥ ca bhallaiḥ ca tam ekam abhidudruvuḥ
translated: And with vatsadanta and bhalla arrows, they rushed at him alone.

analyzed: siṃhanādaḥ tatas ghoraḥ pāṇḍavānām ajāyata
translated: Then a terrible lion's roar arose from the Pandavas,

original: tathaiva tava putrāś ca rājan bhīṣmajayaiṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva tava putrāḥ ca rājan bhīṣma jaya eṣiṇaḥ
translated: And likewise your sons, O king, desiring victory for Bhishma,

original: tam ekam abhyavartanta siṃhanādāṃś ca nedire
analyzed: tam ekam abhyavartanta siṃhanādān ca nedire
translated: Rushed at him alone and roared like lions.

original: tatrāsīt tumulaṃ yuddhaṃ tāvakānāṃ paraiḥ saha
analyzed: tatra āsīt tumulam yuddham tāvakānām paraiḥ saha
translated: There was a tumultuous battle there between your troops and the enemy,

analyzed: daśame hani rāja indra bhīṣma arjuna samāgame
translated: On the tenth day, O lord of kings, in the encounter between Bhishma and Arjuna.

original: āsīd gāṅga ivāvarto muhūrtam udadher iva
analyzed: āsīt gāṅgaḥ iva āvartaḥ muhūrtam udadheḥ iva
translated: It was like the whirlpool of the Ganges or the ocean for a moment,

analyzed: sainyānām yudhyamānānām nighnatām itaretaram
translated: As the soldiers fought and killed each other.

analyzed: agamya rūpā pṛthivī śoṇita aktā tadā abhavat
translated: The earth became impassable, covered with blood,

original: samaṃ ca viṣamaṃ caiva na prājñāyata kiṃ cana
analyzed: samam ca viṣamam ca eva na prājñāyata kim cana
translated: And nothing could be distinguished, whether even or uneven.

original: yodhānām ayutaṃ hatvā tasmin sa daśame 'hani
analyzed: yodhānām ayutam hatvā tasmin sa daśame hani
translated: Having killed ten thousand warriors on that tenth day,

analyzed: atiṣṭhat āhave bhīṣmaḥ bhidyamāneṣu marmasu
translated: Bhishma remained in the battle, his vital organs pierced.

original: tataḥ senāmukhe tasmin sthitaḥ pārtho dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tatas senā mukhe tasmin sthitaḥ pārthaḥ dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Then Partha Dhananjaya, standing at the head of the army,

analyzed: madhyena kuru sainyānām drāvayām āsa vāhinīm
translated: Dispersed the Kuru troops through the middle of the army.

analyzed: tatra adbhutam apaśyāma pāṇḍavānām parākramam
translated: We then saw the wonderful valor of the Pandavas

analyzed: drāvayām āsuḥ iṣubhiḥ sarvān bhīṣma padānugān
translated: They drove away with their arrows all the followers of Bhishma

analyzed: vayam śvetahayāt bhītāḥ kuntī putrāt dhanaṃjayāt
translated: We were frightened of Dhananjaya, the son of Kunti, with his white horses

analyzed: pīḍyamānāḥ śitaiḥ śastraiḥ pradravāma mahā raṇāt
translated: Afflicted by sharp weapons, we fled from the great battle

analyzed: sauvīrāḥ kitavāḥ prācyāḥ pratīcya udīcya mālavāḥ
translated: The Souviras, Kitavas, those from the east, west, north and Malava

original: pāṇḍavaiḥ pañcabhiḥ sārdhaṃ sātyakena ca dhanvinā
analyzed: pāṇḍavaiḥ pañcabhiḥ sārdham sātyakena ca dhanvinā
translated: Together with the five Pandavas and the archer Satyaki

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnamukhaiḥ sarvaiḥ pāñcālaiś ca samantataḥ🔽bhidyamānāḥ śarais tīkṣṇaiḥ sarve kārṣṇipurogamaiḥ
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumna mukhaiḥ sarvaiḥ pāñcālaiḥ ca samantataḥ  bhidyamānāḥ śaraiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ sarve kārṣṇi purogamaiḥ
translated: And all the Panchalas led by Dhrishtadyumna from all sides🔽Afflicted by sharp arrows from those led by Krishna

analyzed: droṇa drauṇi kṛpaiḥ sārdham sarve śalya kṛpa ādayaḥ
translated: Together with Drona, Drona's son and Kripa, and all Shalya, Kripa and others

original: tāvakāḥ samare rājañ jahur bhīṣmaṃ mahāmṛdhe
analyzed: tāvakāḥ samare rājam jahuḥ bhīṣmam mahā mṛdhe
translated: Your troops, O king, abandoned Bhishma in that great battle

analyzed: abhīṣāhāḥ śūrasenāḥ śibayaḥ tha vasātayaḥ
translated: The Abhishahas, Shurasenas, Shibis, Vasatis

original: śālvāśrayās trigartāś ca ambaṣṭhāḥ kekayaiḥ saha
analyzed: śālva āśrayāḥ trigartāḥ ca ambaṣṭhāḥ kekayaiḥ saha
translated: The Shalvas, Ashrayas, Trigartas and Ambashthas with the Kaikayas

analyzed: dvādaśā ete janapadāḥ śara ārtāḥ vraṇa pīḍitāḥ
translated: These twelve countries, afflicted by arrows and wounded,

original: saṃgrāme na jahur bhīṣmaṃ yudhyamānaṃ kirīṭinā
analyzed: saṃgrāme na jahuḥ bhīṣmam yudhyamānam kirīṭinā
translated: Did not abandon Bhishma in the battle, while he fought with Kiriti

original: tatas tam ekaṃ bahavaḥ parivārya samantataḥ
analyzed: tatas tam ekam bahavaḥ parivārya samantataḥ
translated: Then many of them surrounded that single one on all sides

analyzed: parikālya kurūn sarvām śara varṣaiḥ avākiran
translated: They surrounded all the Kurus and showered them with arrows.

analyzed: nipātayata gṛhṇīta vidhyata atha ca karṣata
translated: Strike, seize, pierce and drag!

original: ity āsīt tumulaḥ śabdo rājan bhīṣmarathaṃ prati
analyzed: iti āsīt tumulaḥ śabdaḥ rājan bhīṣma ratham prati
translated: Such was the tumultuous sound, O king, towards Bhishma's chariot.

analyzed: abhihatya śara oghaiḥ tam sahasraśas
translated: Having struck him with torrents of arrows in hundreds and thousands,

analyzed: na tasya āsīt a nirbhinnam gātreṣu aṅgula mātrakam
translated: there was not even an inch of his body that was not pierced.

original: evaṃ vibho tava pitā śarair viśakalīkṛtaḥ
analyzed: evam vibho tava pitā śaraiḥ viśakalīkṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, O lord, your father was mangled with arrows

analyzed: śita agraiḥ phalgunena ājau prāc śirāḥ prāpatat rathāt
translated: by Phalguni in the battle with sharp tips, and fell from his chariot with his head facing forward,

analyzed: kiṃcid śeṣe dinakare putrāṇām tava paśyatām
translated: while the sun was still a little above the horizon, in the sight of your sons.

original: hā heti divi devānāṃ pārthivānāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: hā hā iti divi devānām pārthivānām ca sarvaśas
translated: Ah! Ah! such was the great sound in the sky of the gods and on earth of all the kings,

original: patamāne rathād bhīṣme babhūva sumahān svanaḥ
analyzed: patamāne rathāt bhīṣme babhūva su mahān svanaḥ
translated: when Bhishma fell from his chariot.

analyzed: tam patantam abhiprekṣya mahātmānam pitāmaham
translated: Beholding that great-souled grandfather falling,

original: saha bhīṣmeṇa sarveṣāṃ prāpatan hṛdayāni naḥ
analyzed: saha bhīṣmeṇa sarveṣām prāpatan hṛdayāni naḥ
translated: with Bhishma, all our hearts fell.

analyzed: sa papāta mahā bāhuḥ vasudhām anunādayan
translated: That mighty-armed one fell, making the earth resound,

analyzed: indra dhvajaḥ iva utsṛṣṭaḥ ketuḥ sarva dhanuṣmatām
translated: like a banner of Indra let loose, the banner of all archers.

analyzed: dharaṇīm na aspṛśat ca api śara saṃghaiḥ samācitaḥ
translated: Covered with heaps of arrows, he did not touch the ground,

analyzed: śara talpe mahā iṣvāsam śayānam puruṣa ṛṣabham
translated: The great archer, that bull among men, lying on a bed of arrows.

original: rathāt prapatitaṃ cainaṃ divyo bhāvaḥ samāviśat🔽abhyavarṣata parjanyaḥ prākampata ca medinī
analyzed: rathāt prapatitam ca enam divyaḥ bhāvaḥ samāviśat  abhyavarṣata parjanyaḥ prākampata ca medinī
translated: And as he fell from his chariot, a divine essence entered him.🔽The clouds rained down, and the earth trembled.

original: patan sa dadṛśe cāpi kharvitaṃ ca divākaram
analyzed: patan sa dadṛśe ca api kharvitam ca divākaram
translated: As he fell, he saw the sun eclipsed.

original: saṃjñāṃ caivālabhad vīraḥ kālaṃ saṃcintya bhārata
analyzed: saṃjñām ca eva alabhat vīraḥ kālam saṃcintya bhārata
translated: But the hero regained consciousness, O Bharata, after considering the time.

original: antarikṣe ca śuśrāva divyāṃ vācaṃ samantataḥ
analyzed: antarikṣe ca śuśrāva divyām vācam samantataḥ
translated: And in the sky, he heard divine voices all around:

analyzed: katham mahātmā gāṅgeyaḥ sarva śastrabhṛtām varaḥ
translated: How can the great-souled son of Ganga, the best among all wielders of weapons,

analyzed: kālam kartā nara vyāghraḥ saṃprāpte dakṣiṇāyane
translated: The tiger among men, set the time when the sun enters the southern solstice?

original: sthito 'smīti ca gāṅgeyas tac chrutvā vākyam abravīt
analyzed: sthitaḥ smi iti ca gāṅgeyaḥ tat śrutvā vākyam abravīt
translated: Hearing these words, Ganga's son said, I am still here.

original: dhārayām āsa ca prāṇān patito 'pi hi bhūtale
analyzed: dhārayām āsa ca prāṇān patitaḥ hi bhū tale
translated: Though fallen on the ground, he still held on to his life.

analyzed: uttarāyaṇam anvicchan bhīṣmaḥ kuru pitāmahaḥ
translated: Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus, was waiting for the sun to enter the northern solstice.

original: tasya tan matam ājñāya gaṅgā himavataḥ sutā
analyzed: tasya tat matam ājñāya gaṅgā himavataḥ sutā
translated: Understanding his intention, Ganga, the daughter of the Himalayas,

original: maharṣīn haṃsarūpeṇa preṣayām āsa tatra vai
analyzed: mahā ṛṣīn haṃsa rūpeṇa preṣayām āsa tatra vai
translated: Sent the great sages in the form of swans to him.

analyzed: tatas saṃpātinaḥ haṃsāḥ tvaritāḥ mānasa okasaḥ
translated: Then the swift swans from Lake Manasa

analyzed: ājagmuḥ sahitāḥ draṣṭum bhīṣmam kuru pitāmaham
translated: Came together to see Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus.

analyzed: yatra śete nara śreṣṭhaḥ śara talpe pitāmahaḥ
translated: Where the best of men, the grandfather, lies on a bed of arrows.

original: te tu bhīṣmaṃ samāsādya munayo haṃsarūpiṇaḥ
analyzed: te tu bhīṣmam samāsādya munayaḥ haṃsa rūpiṇaḥ
translated: Those sages, assuming the form of swans, approached Bhishma,

analyzed: apaśyam śara talpa stham bhīṣmam kuru pitāmaham
translated: And saw Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus, lying on a bed of arrows.

original: te taṃ dṛṣṭvā mahātmānaṃ kṛtvā cāpi pradakṣiṇam🔽gāṅgeyaṃ bharataśreṣṭhaṃ dakṣiṇena ca bhāskaram
analyzed: te tam dṛṣṭvā mahātmānam kṛtvā ca api pradakṣiṇam  gāṅgeyam bharata śreṣṭham dakṣiṇena ca bhāskaram
translated: Having seen that great-souled one and circumambulated him,

analyzed: itaretaram āmantrya prāhuḥ tatra manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: They spoke to each other there, the wise ones,

original: bhīṣma eva mahātmā san saṃsthātā dakṣiṇāyane
analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ eva mahātmā san saṃsthātā dakṣiṇāyane
translated: Having greeted each other, saying, Bhishma alone, being a great soul, will remain in the southern solstice.

original: ity uktvā prasthitān haṃsān dakṣiṇām abhito diśam
analyzed: iti uktvā prasthitān haṃsān dakṣiṇām abhitas diśam
translated: Having said this, the swans set out towards the southern direction,

original: saṃprekṣya vai mahābuddhiś cintayitvā ca bhārata
analyzed: saṃprekṣya vai mahā buddhiḥ cintayitvā ca bhārata
translated: Having observed them, the one of great wisdom, having thought, O descendant of Bharata,

original: tān abravīc chāṃtanavo nāhaṃ gantā kathaṃ cana
analyzed: tān abravīt śāṃtanavaḥ na aham gantā katham cana
translated: Shantanu's son said to them, I will by no means go.

original: dakṣiṇāvṛtta āditye etan me manasi sthitam
analyzed: dakṣiṇa āvṛtte āditye etat me manasi sthitam
translated: When the sun turns to the south, this is what is in my mind.

original: gamiṣyāmi svakaṃ sthānam āsīd yan me purātanam
analyzed: gamiṣyāmi svakam sthānam āsīt yat me purātanam
translated: I will go to my own place, which was mine in ancient times.

original: udagāvṛtta āditye haṃsāḥ satyaṃ bravīmi vaḥ🔽dhārayiṣyāmy ahaṃ prāṇān uttarāyaṇakāṅkṣayā
analyzed: udak āvṛtte āditye haṃsāḥ satyam bravīmi vaḥ  dhārayiṣyāmi aham prāṇān uttarāyaṇa kāṅkṣayā
translated: When the sun turns to the north, I will go, I tell you the truth, O swans.🔽I will sustain my life in the hope of the northern solstice.

original: aiśvaryabhūtaḥ prāṇānām utsarge niyato hy aham
analyzed: aiśvarya bhūtaḥ prāṇānām utsarge niyataḥ hi aham
translated: I am subject to giving up my life, being the essence of power.

analyzed: tasmāt prāṇān dhārayiṣye mumūrṣuḥ udak āyane
translated: Therefore, I will sustain my life, ready to die in the northern solstice.

original: yaś ca datto varo mahyaṃ pitrā tena mahātmanā🔽chandato mṛtyur ity evaṃ tasya cāstu varas tathā
analyzed: yaḥ ca dattaḥ varaḥ mahyam pitrā tena mahātmanā  chandataḥ mṛtyuḥ iti evam tasya ca astu varaḥ tathā
translated: And the boon that was granted to me by that great-souled father,🔽that my death should be at my own will, let that boon be so.

original: dhārayiṣye tataḥ prāṇān utsarge niyate sati

analyzed: jānāmi aham mahā prājña sarvam etat na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O greatly wise one! I know all this, there is no doubt.

original: yathā vadasi durdharṣa kaunteyo 'haṃ na sūtajaḥ
analyzed: yathā vadasi durdharṣa kaunteyaḥ ham na sūtajaḥ
translated: O invincible one! As you say, I am a son of Kunti, not a charioteer.

original: avakīrṇas tv ahaṃ kuntyā sūtena ca vivardhitaḥ
analyzed: avakīrṇaḥ tu aham kuntyā sūtena ca vivardhitaḥ
translated: But I was abandoned by Kunti and brought up by a charioteer.

original: bhuktvā duryodhanaiśvaryaṃ na mithyā kartum utsahe
analyzed: bhuktvā duryodhana aiśvaryam na mithyā kartum utsahe
translated: Having enjoyed Duryodhana's prosperity, I cannot make it false.

analyzed: vasudeva sutaḥ yadvat pāṇḍavāya dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Just as the son of Vasudeva, firm in his vows, to the son of Pandu,

original: vasu caiva śarīraṃ ca yad udāraṃ tathā yaśaḥ
analyzed: vasu ca eva śarīram ca yat udāram tathā yaśaḥ
translated: My wealth, my body, my vast fame,

analyzed: sarvam duryodhanasya arthe tyaktam me bhūri dakṣiṇa
translated: all have been sacrificed for Duryodhana's sake, O giver of abundant gifts.

analyzed: kopitāḥ pāṇḍavāḥ nityam mayā āśritya suyodhanam
translated: The Pandavas have always been angered by me, relying on Suyodhana.

analyzed: tathā duryodhanasya arthe vīra mārga niṣeviṇā
translated: And for Duryodhana's sake, following the path of heroes,

original: mā caitad vyādhimaraṇaṃ kṣatraṃ syād iti kaurava
analyzed: mā ca etat vyādhi maraṇam kṣatram syāt iti kaurava
translated: I have killed many kings, O grandfather, thinking that the Kshatriyas would not perish.

original: avaśyabhāvī vai yo 'rtho na sa śakyo nivartitum
analyzed: avaśya bhāvī vai yaḥ rthaḥ na sa śakyaḥ nivartitum
translated: That which must inevitably happen cannot be averted.

original: daivaṃ puruṣakāreṇa ko nivartitum utsahet🔽pṛthivīkṣayaśaṃsīni nimittāni pitāmaha
analyzed: daivam puruṣakāreṇa kaḥ nivartitum utsahet  pṛthivī kṣaya śaṃsīni nimittāni pitāmaha
translated: Who would dare to avert fate by human effort?🔽O grandfather, you have seen and described in the assembly

analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ upalabdhāni kathitāni ca saṃsadi
translated: the portents foretelling the destruction of the earth.

original: pāṇḍavā vāsudevaś ca viditā mama sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ vāsudevaḥ ca viditāḥ mama sarvaśas
translated: I know everything about the Pandavas and Vasudeva.

original: ajeyāḥ puruṣair anyair iti tāṃś cotsahāmahe
analyzed: ajeyāḥ puruṣaiḥ anyaiḥ iti tān ca utsahāmahe
translated: We dare to challenge them, thinking they cannot be conquered by other men.

original: vijayiṣye raṇe pāṇḍūn iti me niścitaṃ matam
analyzed: vijayiṣye raṇe pāṇḍūn iti me niścitam matam
translated: It is my firm belief that I will defeat the Pandus in battle.

original: na cec chakyam avasraṣṭuṃ vairam etat sudāruṇam
analyzed: na ced śakyam avasraṣṭum vairam etat su dāruṇam
translated: If it is not possible to end this extremely terrible enmity,

analyzed: dhanaṃjayena yotsye ham svadharma prīta mānasaḥ
translated: with a mind delighted by my own dharma, I will fight with Dhananjaya.

analyzed: adharmam vyādhi maraṇam kṣatriyasya pitāmaha
translated: O grandfather, for a Kshatriya, unrighteous death is better than disease.

original: anujānīṣva māṃ tāta yuddhe prītamanāḥ sadā
analyzed: anujānīṣva mām tāta yuddhe prīta manāḥ sadā
translated: O father, always grant me permission to fight with a delighted mind.

original: anujñātas tvayā vīra yudhyeyam iti me matiḥ
analyzed: anujñātaḥ tvayā vīra yudhyeyam iti me matiḥ
translated: With your permission, O hero, it is my intention to fight.

original: duruktaṃ vipratīpaṃ vā saṃrambhāc cāpalāt tathā
analyzed: duruktam vipratīpam vā saṃrambhāt cāpalāt tathā
translated: Whatever harsh words, disagreeable words, or rash acts I have done out of anger,

original: yan mayāpakṛtaṃ kiṃ cit tad anukṣantum arhasi
analyzed: yat mayā apakṛtam kim cit tat anukṣantum arhasi
translated: you should forgive me for whatever wrong I have done.

analyzed: bhīṣmaḥ uvāca
translated: Bhishma said:

original: na cec chakyam athotsraṣṭuṃ vairam etat sudāruṇam
analyzed: na ced śakyam atha utsraṣṭum vairam etat su dāruṇam
translated: If it is not possible to abandon this extremely terrible enmity,

analyzed: anujānāmi karṇa tvām yudhyasva svarga kāmyayā
translated: I grant you permission, O Karna, fight with the desire for heaven.

original: vimanyur gatasaṃrambhaḥ kuru karma nṛpasya hi
analyzed: vimanyuḥ gata saṃrambhaḥ kuru karma nṛpasya hi
translated: Be free from anger and agitation, and perform the duties of a king.

analyzed: yathāśakti yathotsāham satām vṛtteṣu vṛttavān
translated: Act according to your ability and enthusiasm, and follow the conduct of the virtuous.

original: ahaṃ tvām anujānāmi yad icchasi tad āpnuhi
analyzed: aham tvām anujānāmi yat icchasi tat āpnuhi
translated: I grant you permission, obtain whatever you desire.

analyzed: kṣatra dharma jitān lokān saṃprāpsyasi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt you will attain the worlds conquered by the duty of a kshatriya.

analyzed: yudhyasva nirahaṃkāraḥ bala vīrya vyapāśrayaḥ
translated: Fight without ego, relying on your strength and valor.

original: dharmo hi yuddhāc chreyo 'nyat kṣatriyasya na vidyate
analyzed: dharmaḥ hi yuddhāt śreyaḥ nyat kṣatriyasya na vidyate
translated: For a kshatriya, there is no dharma superior to battle.

original: praśame hi kṛto yatnaḥ sucirāt suciraṃ mayā
analyzed: praśame hi kṛtaḥ yatnaḥ su cirāt su ciram mayā
translated: For a very long time, I have made great efforts towards peace,

original: na caiva śakitaḥ kartuṃ yato dharmas tato jayaḥ
analyzed: na ca eva śakitaḥ kartum yatas dharmaḥ tatas jayaḥ
translated: but have been unable to achieve it. Where there is dharma, there is victory.

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: evaṃ bruvantaṃ gāṅgeyam abhivādya prasādya ca
analyzed: evam bruvantam gāṅgeyam abhivādya prasādya ca
translated: Having thus spoken, having saluted and pleased Gangeya,

original: rādheyo ratham āruhya prāyāt tava sutaṃ prati
analyzed: rādheyaḥ ratham āruhya prāyāt tava sutam prati
translated: Radheya mounted his chariot and departed towards your son.

original: ya idaṃ śṛṇuyād bhaktyā bhīṣmaparva mahādbhutam
analyzed: yaḥ idam śṛṇuyāt bhaktyā bhīṣmaparva mahā adbhutam
translated: One who listens to this with devotion, the wonderful Bhishma Parva,

analyzed: ājanma saṃcitāt pāpāt mucyate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Is freed from sins accumulated from birth, there is no doubt about this.

original: bhīṣmaparva idaṃ śrutvā śatabhojyaṃ tu dāpayet
analyzed: bhīṣmaparva idam śrutvā śata bhojyam tu dāpayet
translated: Having heard this Bhishma Parva, one should give a hundred meals.

analyzed: sarva tīrtha phalam ca eva sarva yajña phalam labhet
translated: One obtains the fruits of all pilgrimages and all sacrifices.

original: etad vai parvadānaṃ ca dattvā svarṇādidakṣiṇām
analyzed: etat vai parva dānam ca dattvā svarṇa ādi dakṣiṇām
translated: This is the gift of the Parva, having given gold and other gifts,

original: samāhitaphalāvāptir jāyate nātra saṃśayaḥ🔽aśvamedhasahasrasya rājasūyaśatasya ca
analyzed: jāyate na atra    aśvamedha sahasrasya rājasūya śatasya ca
translated: One attains the fruits of concentration, there is no doubt about this.🔽On the Bhishma Parva, one obtains the fruits of a thousand horse sacrifices and a hundred Rajasuya sacrifices,

analyzed: gavām koṭi pradānasya phalam syāt bhīṣmaparvaṇi
translated: And the gift of a crore cows.

original: bhīṣmaparva idaṃ śrutvā pūjayed yas tu vācakam
analyzed: bhīṣmaparva idam śrutvā pūjayet yaḥ tu vācakam
translated: One who listens to this Bhishma Parva and worships the reciter,

original: tena brahmā ca rudraś ca viṣṇuś ca vasavas tathā
analyzed: tena brahmā ca rudraḥ ca viṣṇuḥ ca vasavaḥ tathā
translated: By that, Brahma, Rudra, Vishnu, the Vasus,

original: pūjitā ṛṣayaḥ sarve pitaraś ca sahāgnibhiḥ
analyzed: pūjitāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sarve pitaraḥ ca saha agnibhiḥ
translated: All the sages, the ancestors along with the fires are worshipped.

analyzed: prasanne vācake vipre prasannāḥ sarva devatāḥ
translated: When the Brahmin reciter is pleased, all the gods are pleased.

analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣāṇām sa phalam prāpnuyāt naraḥ
translated: That man obtains the fruits of Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha.

original: pañca ślokasahasrāṇi tathā hy aṣṭau śatāni ca
analyzed: pañca śloka sahasrāṇi tathā hi aṣṭau śatāni ca
translated: Five thousand verses, and likewise eight hundred,

original: ślokāś ca caturāśītiḥ proktā vyāsena dhīmatā
analyzed: ślokāḥ ca proktāḥ vyāsena dhīmatā
translated: And eighty-four verses were spoken by the wise Vyasa.

original: śraddhayā parayā yukto bhīṣmaparva śṛṇoti yaḥ
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā yuktaḥ bhīṣma parva śṛṇoti yaḥ
translated: One who listens with supreme faith to the Bhishma Parva,

original: mucyate brahmahatyāyā jayaṃ vai labhate dhruvam
analyzed: mucyate brahma hatyāyāḥ jayam vai labhate dhruvam
translated: Is freed from the sin of Brahmanicide and certainly attains victory.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet samyak vastra alaṃkāra go dhanaiḥ
translated: One should properly feed Brahmins with garments, ornaments, and wealth,

original: pūjayec caiva vaktāraṃ bhīṣmaparvaṇi vai gṛhī
analyzed: pūjayet ca eva vaktāram bhīṣmaparvaṇi vai gṛhī
translated: And honor the reciter of the Bhishma Parva, O householder.
